loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is from Goris town. She lives there with her two children and her husband who is a migrant worker. 

Anush has been engaged in animal husbandry for a long time. She breeds cattle (including 16 cows) and hens. Anush's younger child is a teenager, so only two family members are fully engaged in agricultural activities (Anush and her 21-year-old son). 

Anush now wants to make some investments into her agribusiness to expand and make it more profitable. With the loan's help, she is planning to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock. Please help this hard-working woman to expand her farming business and gather higher income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire labour and buy mulch for his banana plantation

loans.name: Rosita Estefania

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo que es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosita, tiene 54  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 9 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aún viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Rosita es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene una lancha en la cual se dedica a la pesca, el junto a sus hijos se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, ellos se van por tres a cuatro días a realizar sus labores, andan junto a un barco pesquero al cual le entregan todas las tardes el producto de la pesca del día, una vez transcurrido estos días ellos regresan a sus hogares para así después de varios días regresar a sus faenas en el mar, a pesar que es un trabajo duro es la única forma que ellos conocen para sacar adelante a sus familias. 
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y alimentos para los días que tienen que estar en alta mar. Lleva 18 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que nunca les pase nada en alta mar.
texts.en:
The loan group Jaramijo meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo canton, which is known for its beautiful beaches. Here the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and dedicated to the jobs of the sea.

Señora Rosa lives here. She is 54 years old. She is married and from this relationship she has 9 adult children. Two of them still live in her house. Her husband is a fisherman.

Doña Rosita is a great housewife who is taking out the loan so that her husband can use it in his work. He has a boat from which he fishes. He, along with his sons, goes out on the open sea in his small boat to do his fishing work. They go for three or four days to do their work. They go along with a fishing vessel to which they turn over the product of their daily fishing every afternoon. Once these days have elapsed, they return to their homes and thus after a few days they go back to their work on the sea. Although it is hard work, it is the only way that they know to raise their families.

This loan is to buy nets, cords, fuel, and food for the days that they have to be on the open sea. She has been in the loan group for 18 years, and she likes it because of the help that the loans always offer her. Her dreams are that nothing ever happens to them at sea.

loans.use: to buy nets, cord, fuel and food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear to sell

loans.name: Agribert

texts.en: Agribert is an old client of Ugafode Microfinance who has applied for a loan of UGX 3,500,000. He is a serious farmer who grows pineapples and mangoes in Katembe, a village in Isingiro district. He has been doing this for more than five years. Agribert is a hard-working man who has managed to save money from his sales, which has enabled him to acquire a small piece of land in Isingiro. The purpose of the loan is to expand his pineapple garden.

loans.use: To hire labor and buy mulch for his pineapple garden.

loans.name: Noong Het 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Man, 28, lives with her husband and her two sons in a small Thai traditional house that's far from the district center. Her first child studies at grade six while the other one is in grade four. They are good kids with good studying results. Man's family mainly relies on farming productions for a living, such as: breeding ducks, chickens, musk ducks, cultivating rice, and wattles. In addition, her husband works extra for local construction employer to earn more income for the family. Along with the effort of the husband, Man has taken out loan from Anh Chi Em Program to expand her agricultural activities. She said that she was not only grateful for the loan, but also the training sessions she had received, which were very useful for her work and also included interesting activities. This is the fifth loan she has received from ACE. She will use the loan to buy chickens and musk ducks. 

Man hopes that through the investment, she can afford to buy some new furniture for the house as well as better support her children's studying by buying more books for them. She dreams her children will attend a well-known university and have a good job, which can help them escape from poverty. 

In the picture, Man is the woman wearing the blue shirt, standing on the first row, and the first person from the right.

loans.use: to buy chickens and musk ducks.

loans.name: Erika Arlene

texts.en: Erika is 32 years old, married and has two small children that are not yet in school. She works at a beauty salon from Monday to Saturday. She also provides some beauty services at some clients' houses. She is asking for a loan to provide more free lance services and increase her income. Erika says that she only asks for loans that she can afford to pay back and only for investing in her business. Her biggest accomplishment is helping her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: To buy some equipment to provide free lance beauty services.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkan vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Ségou coura de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles ce sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de restauration et de fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djenebou (la 2eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de friture de farine et de pâté dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 sac de farine de blé à Ségou et du sucre afin de faire des pâtés et des fritures de farine. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Djenebou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 25 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle espère continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Benkan all live in nuclear families, and they average 28 years of age and two children each, all living in the Ségou Coura district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They have small-scale businesses involving fruit & vegetables and food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Djelika (the second woman standing at the right in the photo) is a major vendor of wheat flour fritters and of pâté in and around the district. She intends to use her loan to purchase a sack of wheat flour in Ségou and some sugar to make pâtés and flour fritters. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often credit at her house and at the market. 

With this loan, Ms. Djelika hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used for the children’s sundry needs and also for increasing her capital. She hopes to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour to make fritters and pâtés

loans.name: Nyame Ye Odo Paa Group

texts.en:
Adwoa is a representative of Nyame Ye Odo Paa group. She is 63 years old with two children, aged 22 and 13 years old. Adwoa is divorced; hence, she takes care of all the children who are currently attending school. She and her children live in Kadadwen in the Assin Fosu District of the Central Region of Ghana. Adwoa has been a cocoa farmer for the past 34 years. She earns her living by selling the cocoa beans to local cocoa buying company during fruit seasons. As a single mother, she is also into palm oil processing to earn additional income to support her children. Adwoa normally sells her processed oil at the local market during market days. 

Adwoa and her group members need micro finance assistance to be able to shift from their three stone stove with open fire by use of firewood to a clean cook stove (Elsa Stove). A micro loan of GHS 300 will enable Adwoa purchase Elsa Clean Cook Stove to help her eliminate the indoor air pollution from the open firewood fire within her kitchen. Adwoa and her two children are grateful to all the micro lenders for their kind support in improving their health.

loans.use: To purchase a clean cook stove for personal use.

loans.name: Lahidou Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Lahidou vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Résidentiel de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, de grains et de produit cosmétique. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  13eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mariam (la 1ere femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax de tout genre dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mariam espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 35 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Lahidou all live in nuclear families, and they average 33 years of age and three children each, all living in the Résidentiel district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They have small-scale businesses involving clothing, grains, and cosmetic products. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 13th solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Mariam (the first woman standing from the right in the photo) is a major vendor of clothing made from Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) of all types in and around the district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 50 pieces of Wax ‘pagne’ clothing in Ségou. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often credit at her house and at the market. 

With this loan, Ms. Mariam hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used for the children’s sundry needs and also for increasing her capital. She would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.en:
By acquiring his 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Urbano made a crucial step towards reaching his ideal of living in a more sustainable way. Indeed, the biodigester will allow him to rapidly and definitively displace the non-renewable and expensive propane gas and chemical fertilizers he used to purchase for the operations of his farm. 

Through this investment, he will now produce his own biogas and biofertilizer simply by taking advantage of his animals' waste and closing the natural cycle of his farm. His family’s living standards will improve and they will live in harmony with the society and their environment, all of this while saving money! 

The loan represents 45% of the total cost of the biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata (la 1ere femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de jus de fruits et la glace dans le quartier et ses environnants. loans.name: Adom Nyame  Group

texts.en: Atta is a member and a leader of Adom Ara Kwa Group. He is 73 this year and is happily married with six children. Three of his children are still in school. Atta lives with his family in Abura Koforidua in the Central Region of Ghana. Atta has been farming for 40 years. He grows oranges on a six acre farm land and his farm is his main source of income. His crops, together with the members of his association, are purchased by a local fruit processing company. Due to his age, it is becoming physically demanding to maintain the farms alone. He is very happy and optimistic about his business prospects since income from the farm has been the main source of livelihood for his family. Atta's greatest challenge is how to finance the maintenance costs for his farm. Without the financial capital, Atta cannot afford to hire labor to weed and harvest his crops. A loan of GHC 800 will help Atta increase his yield significantly to make more gains to support his family. Atta thanks all his micro-lenders for their generous assistance.

loans.use: To weed and harvest the crops.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a small Mexican milk farmer who owns several cows and sheep. He is able to maintain his family by selling the milk his animals produce, but his operating costs, especially energy and forage for his animals, remain very high. 

When he purchased his 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he was first and foremost interested in taking advantage of his animals' manure to reduce his carbon footprint and his operating costs. His objective is to replace the expensive liquefied petroleum gas with the renewable biogas he can now produce by himself. In addition, the biodigester will allow him to use the potent organic fertilizer instead of chemical ones to feed his animals with safe forage, and thus reducing the contamination of the soils. 

The full waste-to-energy solution represents a great opportunity for David to progressively improve his family's living standards. This loan represents 48% of the total cost of the Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They have small-scale businesses involving firewood, grains, and artisanal crafts.

Ms. Ganda (the first woman sitting from the right in the photo) is a major vendor of firewood in around the district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 8 loads of wood in Ségou. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often credit at her house and at the market.

The four women of the group Heremokono all live in nuclear families, and they average 35 years of age and four children each, all living in the Angoulême district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. Ms. Korotoumou (the second woman standing from the right in the photo) is a major vendor of cosmetic products in around the district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 dozen of perfume and 2 dozen of Bébé & Maman ointments in Ségou. loans.name: Nyame Abe Ye Group

texts.en: Fatima is the group representative of the Nyame Abe Ye Group. She is 52 this years and is happily married with four children. Three of her children are still in school. Fatima lives with her family in Abura Koforidua in the Central Region of Ghana. Fatima has been farming for the past 20 years as her source of income in support of the husband in caring for the family. She grows oranges and coconuts. She also owns a small provisions shop, though her main source of income remains to be from the farms. She also belongs to a registered local farming association that negotiates prices on their behalf. Fatima has confidence in the future prospects of her business since her farming association has a lot of good will from development partners in building their capacity to maintain farm hygiene to increase crop yield. Fatima has not the physical strength to maintain the farm alone as a woman. Her main challenge is how to finance the costs of maintaining her farm to maximize productivity. Particularly, Fatima has to hire laborers to harvest and transport the crops to a point of sale. A micro-loan is essential for Fatima to maximize profit. She hopes to expand her farms and her provisions shop with any profit she makes. She will also use her profit to support the husband to pay for their children's school fees. A working capital loan of GHS 1,000 is required by Fatima to pay for the cost of harvesting and transporting the crops for sale. Fatima is grateful to all her micro-lenders for their generosity in supporting her business.

loans.use: To hire labor to harvest and transport the crops.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, fruits et légumes et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  6eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Assan (la  femme assise dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  pagne  wax dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  20 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou et Bamako. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Assan  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 50 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Danaya all live in nuclear families, and they average 35 years of age and four children each, all living in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They have small-scale businesses involving clothing, fruit & vegetables, and food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their sixth solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Assan (the woman sitting in the photo) is a major vendor of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in around the district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 lengths of Wax ‘pagne’ cloth in Ségou and Bamako. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often credit at the house and at the market. 

With this loan, Ms. Assan hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for the children’s sundry needs and also for increasing her capital. She would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase Wax ‘pagne’ cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used vehicles and repare them for resale

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Babacar est gérant d’une boulangerie de la place depuis 1999. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’ainée, une fille de 7 ans et le cadet, un garçon de 11 mois. Babacar est gérant de la boulangerie, mais est aussi livreur de pain ; il travaille de 4h du matin à 23h. Babacar possède un véhicule, celui avec lequel il effectue des travaux de livreur. Il vient solliciter ce crédit pour pouvoir réfectionner ce dernier. Il vit en grande famille et c’est lui qui s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne et du payement des factures. 
Ayant acquis une expérience de 15 ans dans ce domaine, Babacar aimerait avoir sa propre boulangerie, développer son parc automobile pour maximiser ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Babaca has been the manager of a local bakery since 1999. He is married and the father of three children, including a 7-year-old girl, and a boy, who is the youngest at 11 months of age. Babacar is the manager of the bakery but also delivers the bread. He works from 4 AM until 11 PM. He owns a vehicle that he uses to carry out his deliveries. 

He is here to requesting this loan to be able to repair his vehicle. He lives in a large family, and he is the one taking care of the day-to-day expenses and paying the bills. Having acquired over fifteen years of experience in his domain, Babacar would like to have his own bakery and develop his automobile fleet in order to maximize his profits.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle to continue delivering bread

loans.name: Eranuhi

texts.en: Eranuhi is a farmer from Gay village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, son, and father-in-law. The latter works at a local village school. His salary, however, is not enough to meet the needs of the family. With the help of her family members, Eranuhi is engaged in plant cultivation. They cultivate beans, eggplant and grass. Eranuhi realizes the agricultural products at the local market, which is the most important source of her family's income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, she needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer and pesticides. Eranuhi and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to sustain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Evernadeth

texts.en: Evernadeth, 50, is married with seven children. She helps her husband in their fishing business to make a living. For over 10 years in the business, she was able to provide for the family and the fishing business is still doing well. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy new fishing nets. She saves a portion of her revenue for the future education of her children. She hopes to improve the living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Ryan Dominic

texts.en: To make a living, Ryan Dominic is operating a general store with the help of his wife in their village. He earns well from this and it is their main source of income. The business is doing well and he fully paid his previous loan used for the business. Improving is his desire for he wants to have a better source of income for the family in the future. He took a new loan recently to purchase more stock of grocery goods for the  store. He wants to have a better life with his family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery goods for his store

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Шахноза способная умная женщина в возрасте 33 лет, проживающая в районе Дж.Руми. В их районе услуга швеи очень востребована, так как женщины и девушки предпочитают шить себе платья под размер и свой вкус. Для этой цели она обращаются к услугам швеи. Так как Шахноза знает это ремесло, она хотела бы начать собственное дело в этой сфере и таким образом зарабатывать на жизнь. Шахноза имеет опыт в швейном деле. Она почти в течение года вместе с мужем находилась в России и научилась там шитью европейских женских платьев. Поэтому Шахноза планирует брать заказ на пошив и национальных и европейских платьев. К тому же она умеет печь национальные сладости и хочет купить духовку для производства сладостей. 
Целью запрашиваемого кредита Шахнозы является покупка модернизированной швейной машинки, а также духовки для начала двух новых деятельностей. 
У Шахнозы двое детей- сын и дочь. Она хочет обеспечить им хорошее будущее. Поэтому она начинает новые бизнесы, чтобы принести в семью источники дохода.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a capable, smart, 33-year-old woman, living in the J. Rumy district. Seamstress services are in high demand in her district because women and girls prefer to have their dresses sewn according to their size and taste. This is why they seek the services of a seamstress. Because Shahnoza knows this trade, she wants to start her own business in this sphere and, thus, earn a living. Shahnoza has experience in the sewing business. She spent almost a year in Russia with her husband and learned how to sew women's European dresses there. This is why Shahnoza is planning to take orders to sew national and European dresses. Additionally, she can bake national desserts and want to buy an oven to make desserts. The goal of Shahnoza's loan is to purchase a modern sewing machine and also an oven in order to start two new businesses.

Shahnoza has two children - a son and a daughter. She wants to provide them with a good future. This is why she is starting the new businesses in order to bring a source of income to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine and also an oven in order to start two new businesses

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina wants to fulfill her dreams by completing a degree. She religiously pays attention to making good marks every semester she enrolls. For another school year, Dina is in need of a loan to pay her school fees. Dina has big dreams to help her family and her siblings as well, which is the reason why she works hard for her education.

loans.use: to pay her school fees

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in Gay village in the Armavir region with her husband and two children.
 
She is an experienced agronomist. To take care of her family, Narine is extensively engaged in an agribusiness. With the help of her husband, she is engaged in plant cultivation in greenhouses, and in cultivation of greens. They realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Their agribusiness currently needs some investments in order to function in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 2,000 will support this hardworking woman and her family greatly, enabling them to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer, and pesticides and hire workers for land cultivation. Narine and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support in collecting the loan amount to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer and pesticides and hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en: Nelie has switched from selling vegetables to selling "suman tinambiran" (malagkit/sweet rice with coconut milk). Her business is doing well since she doubled her time perfecting her own "suman tinambiran" recipe. With her family's help, she has maximized her profits and kept pursuing her goals for the good of her family. The reason why she availed another loan from PMPC is to buy ingredients for her "suman tinambiran" business. Today, Nelie is able to help others do a retailing business with her "suman tinambiran" and they have also earned for their own family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her Suman Tinambiran business

loans.name: Ceasar

texts.en: Ceasar is a responsible father who requests a loan from PMPC, which he will use to increase his inventory. He wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for resale. In this way, he will be able to sell more produce, which will allow him to earn more money and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more kilos of fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Kimleang

texts.en: Kimleang is 29 years old, a farmer and a married woman with two children living in Takeo Province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 2011. Her husband is 33, a farmer and also a construction worker. Both of them can earn approximately $12 a day. Now Kimleang would like to request a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for rice farming. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to buy more farmland, renovate her house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en: Eneria has been running a general store in order to support her family. Her husband is a farmer and she has to earn for their daily expenditures. She has repaid successfully her previous loans used for the business. Improving her business is her dream because she wants a better source of income for the family. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods for her general store. Adding more goods means attracting more customers and improving sales and profit.  She hopes to have a better future and improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for her general store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 60 years old with one child. She is married to a fisherman and lives in Tangub City. She helps her husband by selling fish in their village. She has her loyal costumers who purchase her fresh-caught fish. She earns a good income from these activities. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, she wants to own a vehicle for transportation and business purposes.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is 49 years old with two children who lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns and operates a retail business selling grocery goods in the local community to earn a living. She has run her business for nine years and is doing well. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase more grocery goods for her retail store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for her retail store

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динаре 43 года, замужем, многодетная мать 4 детей. Динара работает в Военной части делопроизводителем, ее супруг - охранник. На сегодняшний день совокупный ежемесячный доход Динары и ее супруга составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Все средства Динара старается вкладывать в обучение и воспитание ее детей. В этом году Динара решила построить гараж и баню на территории дома. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов и печи для бани. Это позволит Динаре улучшить ее жилищные условия и сохранить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en: Dinara is 43 years old, married and has four children. Dinara works as an administrator at a military base, and her husband is a security guard. Today, the combined income of Dinara and her husband amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS). Dinara tries to invest all of her money into the education and upbringing of her children. This year Dinara decided to build a garage and a sauna on her property. She requested a loan in the amount of 65,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy construction materials and a sauna heater. This will allow Dinara to improve her living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to build a garage and a sauna on her property

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, comenta que su familia lo inspira para poder lograr su meta de ser un profesional psicólogo que pueda ayudar a las demás personas.
Quiere culminar su carrera y por medio de ello también sentirse realizado. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir esforzándose por su meta.
texts.en:
Rebeca is from the city of Carapeguá and says that her family inspires her to work towards her goal of becoming a psychologist. As a psychologist, Rebeca will be able to help other people.

Rebeca wants to finish her degree. She is applying for this loan in order to pay tuition fees and to continue putting in the effort to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Jeiko Porave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Jeiko Porave Rekavo”está en su Quinto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, el grupo lleva ese nombre que significa “en busca de una mejor vida”, ya que de esa forma podrán ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teodolina, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos variados, que vende a su clientela de manera ambulante y sobre pedido. Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante y por ello se sacrifica para un mejor estilo de vida para ella y sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos variados, ya que asi podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejores ingresos que podrán dar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The "Jeiko Porave Rekavo" group is on its fifth loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme where all of the members are part of the poverty elimination project. The group's name means "searching for a better life" and, by doing this, the can help their families.

One member of the group is Teodolina who makes a living selling cosmetics as a street vendor and on order. Teodolina wants to get ahead and is sacrificing certain things in order to have a better quality of life for herself and her loved ones.

Teodolina is applying for this loan in order to buy cosmetics and continue with her sales. She can then fight for a higher income to give to her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Jazgul

texts.ru: Жазгул погасила предыдущий кредит своевременно и использовала его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам. У нее в семье произошло пополнение, теперь Жазгул счастливая мама 3 детей. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Жазгул есть 2 коровы, 10 овец и 1 лошадь. Также на собственной земельной доле мерою 3,0 ГА она выращивает пшеницу, картофель и сено. Жазгул планирует и дальше развивать свое хозяйство, поэтому она вновь обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Жазгул планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, также она хочет приобрести автомобиль для своей семьи.
texts.en: Jazgul repaid her previous loan on time and used it as she had intended.  She is very thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who supported her.  Jazgul's family has grown a little larger, as she is now the happy mother of three children.  Jazgul's farming business now also consists of two cows, 10 sheep and one horse.  In addition, she grows wheat, potatoes and hay on her own 3-hectare plot of land.  Jazgul is planning to further develop her farming business, and for this reason she has once more turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her business.  She would also like to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to make a profit and buy a car for her family.

loans.name: Wiñay Kury Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “WIÑAY KURY”, esta ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, provincia de Quispicanchis departamento del Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Dianet ella es conviviente y tiene 44 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos lacteos,la socia vende queso y leche, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de queso y leche. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar queso y leche.

El socio que está pegado a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de queso, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de cereales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The "Wiñay Kury" community bank is located in the Quiquijana district in the Quispicanchis province of Cusco department.

The member is Dianet. She is in a relationship, is 44 years old and has two children. She works in her business selling dairy products. She sells cheese and milk. She works from 8AM until 6PM. The member already has many years experience in this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand the business selling cheese and milk. She is requesting the loan to buy cheese and milk.

The member is in the photo attached to the group photo. They took the photo after the meeting because she asked permission due to work reasons. The other members are dedicated to businesses selling clothing, selling cheese, a grocery store and a business selling cereals.

The member is thankful to those who are part of this dream and promises to make her payments by the determined deadlines..

loans.use: to buy cheese and milk.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: maria de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la confeccion de ropa desde hace 20 años, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por su buen trabajo y los buenos precios, Doña maria esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas materiales para la costura como: hilos, agujas, telas, elásticos, etc. ya que ha tenido mucha demanda en los ultimos meses y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, 53, lives in her own house with her family. She has been dedicated to making clothing for twenty years. Her shop has been located in her place of residence for many years. She has many customers due to her good work and good prices. Maria is requesting a loan again to buy more materials for sewing such as thread, needles, fabric, elastic, etc. since she has had a lot of demand in these last months and thus will be able to obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, fabric, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Progresando Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROGRESANDO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Norma ella es soletra y tiene 40 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Progresando" community bank. This bank is located in the district of Santa Cusco belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Norma. She is single,  is 40 years old and has two children. She works in her restaurant. She prepares different dishes like chicken with potatoes, soups and salted meats. She works from 8AM until 5PM. She already has had this business for ten years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand the restaurant. She is requesting the loan to buy products to cook like chicken, meat and vegetables.

The member is in the photo attached to the group photo. The photo was taken after the meeting because she asked permission due to work reasons.

The other members are dedicated to the business of selling animals, raising cattle, a grocery store and a restaurant.

The member is thankful to those who are part of this dream in this way and promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy products to cook like chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Erika Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La Pradera se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Erika. tiene 33 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 12, 6 y 1 año, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el siguiente en escuela.
Doña Erika es una muy buena madre que hace todo lo posible para que a sus hijos no les falte nada, ella trabaja en una institución del Estado, pero para obtener mejores ganancias se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y sus compañeras de trabajo son sus mejores clientes, también los fines de semana y ratos libres se desplaza por la localidad ofreciendo sus prendas, ya son más de 5 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante junto a sus hijos. 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar ropa de todo tipo.  Lleva 3 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The La Pradera credit group meets every two weeks in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited all year long, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with a lot of tourist attractions. 

This is where Erika lives. She is 33 years old. She is separated and from that relationship has 3 children, aged 12, 6 and 1. The oldest is in high school and the next oldest is in primary school. Erika is a very good mother who does everything possible for her children to lack nothing. She works in a state institution, but to make more income she works as a merchant. She sells all types of clothing and her co workers are her best customers. Also, on weekends and in her free time she goes around the city offering her clothing. She has been doing this activity for more than 5 years and with it she is getting ahead with her children. 

She is going to use this loan to buy all types of clothing. She has been in the credit group for 3 years. She likes it because of the help they always give with the loans  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos dependientes, vive con su familia(esposo e hijos) en el Caserío San José distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería, y comercio.

Yolanda se dedica a la crianza de animales y venta posterior de los mismos, desde hace más de 6 años; los animales los acobija en su corral(que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio) por las noches y en el día los pastorea por los alrededores del caserío San José, además Yolanda se dedica a la agricultura cultivando maíz y arroz en chacras arrendadas; con el préstamo otorgado realizará la implementación y ampliación de los corrales en donde acobija a sus animales caprinos por las noches. Pues desea invertir en el cercado de corrales, en la compra de depósitos de recopilación de agua para cada corral, división de corrales uno para chivas, otro los chivos y los otro para los cabritos; ya que con esto podrá criar a su animales en mejores condiciones, lo que le va a permitir venderlos a un mejor precio por lo que podrá obtener mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 38 years old. She is in a relationship, has three dependent children, and lives with her family (husband and children) in the village of San José, in the Pucará district, in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Perú. The population of the district is mainly dedicated to farming, raising animals and trade.

Yolanda has been dedicated to raising animals and the subsequent sale of the same for more than six years. She keeps the animals in her corral (that is located in the rear part of her house) at night and, during the day, puts them to pasture in the area around the village of San  José. Additionally, Yolanda is dedicated to farming, planting maize and rice on rented land. With the loan granted, she will complete the building and expansion of the corrals where she keeps her goats at night. She wishes to invest in corral fencing, buying water collection tanks for each corral, and pen dividers -- one for goats and the other for kids -- since, with this, she will be able to raise her animals in better conditions which will allow her to sell them at a better price and earn better income resulting in a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build and expand the corrals where she keeps her goats.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Sabina, la socia sigue dedicándose a la actividad de lavado de vehículos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres para su casa.
 La socia Sabina está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA.
 La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member's name is Sabina. She remains committed to her current business, car washing, which is doing well thanks to the determination she puts in to her work each day. She would love to be able to continue working in car washing as well as continue supporting her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy food for her home. Sabina is very grateful for the help from KIVA. She belongs to the communal bank of "KANCHARY" in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy food for her home.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  KANCHARY, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 37 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una empresa privada, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su  trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de víveres y otros para su hogar.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the KANCHARY communal bank. The bank is located in the department of Cuzco. He is 37 years old and has 2 children. He alternates his daily activities with working in a private business. He has had his job for some time and it is going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his work every day. He wants to be able to keep working so that he can support his family.  

He is asking for the loan to buy groceries and other things for his home. He is grateful for the loan and committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy groceries and more for his home.

loans.name: Mariana Florida

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La Pradera se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 65 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es mecánico de carros.
Doña Mariana con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar en los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días por ratos ya que no cuenta con horarios fijos, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido para que él lo emplee en su taller, el compra lata, pinturas y otras refacciones que necesita para  brindar un buen trabajo ya que de esto dependen sus ingresos. Lleva más 10 años en su negocio y su esposo más de 30  con el cual siempre han salido adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos Avon y pinturas que necesita su marido. Lleva 3 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "La Pradera" loan group meets every 15 days in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited often all year round, as well as for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Mariana lives in this place. She is 65 years old, married and, from this relationship, has four adult and independent children. Her husband is a car mechanic.

Mariana, with the goal of earning her own income and thus helping with the home expenses, is dedicated to selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works every day without a fixed schedule. She will also give a part of the loan to her husband so that he can use it in his shop. He will buy tin, paint, and other parts that he needs to provide good work since his income depends on this. She has more than ten years experience in this business and her husband has more than 30 with which they have always been getting ahead. This loan is going to be used to buy Avon products and paint that her husband needs. She has been with the loan group for three years and she likes it because the loans help a lot. Her dream is to keep progressing.

loans.use: to buy Avon products and paint.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Yesenia, la socia sigue dedicándose a la actividad de cosmetóloga en su salón de belleza, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a sui familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de tintes entre otros.
La socia Yesenia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, para fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y educar a sus hijos. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is named Yesenia. She has remained dedicated to her current job, cosmetology at her beauty salon. She has continued to do well at her work, because of the determination and effort that she puts in to it each day. She would love to continue working in this field, because it allows her to support her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy hair dye, among other things. 

Yesenia is very grateful for the hep of KIVA, which allows her to strengthen her economic standing. This in turn allows her to improve the quality of living for her and her family, and to educate her children. She belongs to the communal bank "KANCHARY" in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, among other things.

loans.name: Gertrudis Blanca

texts.es: Gertrudis de 48 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar, ella posee un taller de costura ubicado en su casa desde hace 25 años, tiene mucha clientela que la buscan por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, elásticos, agujas, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Gertrudis, 48, lives with her family. She has had a sewing shop located in her house for 25 years. She has a lot of customers who come to her for the quality of her work. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, needles, etc. and thus be able to continue her job that generates good income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, needles, etc.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Yenny, la socia sigue dedicándose a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de casacas.
La socia Yenny está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y en la educación de su único hijo. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Yenny. She continues to work selling women's, men's and children's clothing. She has had her business for some time and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She wants keep working so she can continue to support her family. She is asking for the loan to buy jackets. 

Yenny is very grateful for the help from KIVA, for helping her fortify her economic activity which allows her to offer her family a better quality of life and an education to her only child. She belongs to the “KANCHARY” communal bank in the city of Cuzco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy jackets.

loans.name: Rosa Ines Mireya

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La Pradera se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo el cual es mayor de edad pero aun vive con ella. Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la ciudad.
Doña Rosa con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, sabanas, edredones, cobertores de  muebles, toldos y muchas cosas más, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que siempre le llevan sus trabajos. Lleva más de 20 años con esta actividad con la cual saco adelante a su hijo sola y  le sirve para salir adelante.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
The credit group "La Pradera" meets up every 15 days in the city of Manta--a city known for its beautiful beaches that are well-traveled at every time of year, as well as its unparalleled beauty and lots of tourist attractions.

This is where Rosa lives. She is 57 years old, is a single mother, and has a son (who is older, but still lives with her). Many years ago, she learned dressmaking at an academy in the city. 

With the intention of obtaining her own income and leveraging her expertise in dressmaking, Rosa opened a small sewing workshop in her home. She now makes her living sewing every kind of clothing, as well as blankets, sheets, furniture covers, awnings, and more. She works based on orders for certain people that always ask for her work. She has spent more than 20 years on this particular activity while raising her child alone and trying to get ahead.

She will use this new loan to buy fabric and other material for her business. She has spent 5 years in this particular credit group, and she is appreciative because the loans have helped her a lot. Her dream is to have a much bigger workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Saeeda Group

texts.en:
This is the same group as previously, which consists of five female members. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from Kiva lenders, and all the members of the group warmly thank Kiva lenders for their first loan. They have now applied for a second loan of 180,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

Saida is the same leader of the group. She applied for a first loan from Kiva lenders to purchase an amount of perfumes, incense, henna and clothes to sell. That first loan helped her very much to increase her business and to be able to meet most of the demands of her customers. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their first loan. 

She hasn't yet completed the first loan but has applied for another concurrent loan of 40,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase another amount of henna, perfumes, incense and other things to enlarge her business. This will again help her to meet all the demands of her customers.

She hopes to be financed in this loan.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense and henna, in addition to clothes, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Toribio

texts.en: Toribio and his small family want to optimize their resource usage on their small family farm. They would like to fully benefit from the animal waste produced onsite. They will be able to use their 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to process the manure into a potent biofertilizer, displacing agrochemical fertilizers, and methane-rich biogas, allowing them to displace the non-renewable and expensive propane they currently use to cook and heat bathwater. This loan represents 49% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Wencelsao

texts.en: The cost to produce forrage (animal feed) is increasing because of the amount of agrochemical fertilizers required to grow crops in soils poor in organic matter. Wenceslao is investing in a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to process animal waste into biofertilizer, allowing him to improve his soils while reducing his dependance on expensive, petroleum based fertilizers. The biodigester will also produce methane-rich biogas as a byproduct of the digestion process allowing Wenceslao to decrease his dependence on the non-renewable propane he currently uses to cook and heat bathwater. This loan represents 45% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and a biogas stove.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is  married  and settled for a living in Clarin with her family.  She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. The business is doing well and within six years, she was able to support the family needs. She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for vehicle spare parts and tires. Recently, she took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to cover motor repair and maintenance costs. In the future, Esterlita wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover motor repair and maintenance costs

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.en: Throughout the years he spent working at his carp farm, Estanislao and his family have become experts in raising, preparing and cooking the delicious fish in their little restaurant, where they serve it to loyal customers. However, purchasing his 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa represents a fundamental investment and innovation for Estanislao and his combined farm/restaurant business. From now on, he will be able to dramatically reduce the operating costs of his restaurant, since the cookstove will be supplied by the biogas produced from the organic waste from the farm. He will not have to purchase the expensive liquefied petroleum gas to provide his customers with their favorite carp dish. In addition to the biogas, Estanislao will also take advantage of the resources made available by the biodigester to feed the carps with the biofertilizer produced throughout the process. The loan represents 51% of the total cost of the Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna is 32-years-old, a farmer and a married woman living in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 2005. Her husband is 56-years-old, a construction foreman. Both of them can earn approximately $13 a day. Now Vanna would like to request a loan to buy more farmland to cultivate rice. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
To make a living, Henry operates a motor transportation services  in his community. For many years, this has been his main source of income. He has successfully repaid his previous loan from Gata Daku MPC that he used for buying new tires. Aside from this, his wife runs a retail store in order to earn additional income for the family. 

He recently took a new loan buy spare parts and accessories and some for goods to be displayed in a sari-sari store. He wants to improve the general living conditions of his family in the future and with this he works with discipline and determination.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories and goods to be displayed in a sari-sari store

loans.name: Luz Flora

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La Pradera se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Luz, tiene 60 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella.
Doña Luz es una mujer muy luchadora que le ha gustado siempre trabajar para salir adelante y así sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, ella además de ropa también vende pintura del tipo industrial, esto le realizan en base a pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación y ella les entrega en los barcos o talleres donde sus clientes lo requieran. Trabaja todos los días y casi todo el día. Tiene mas de 35  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se siente muy bien ya que así es como se gana la vida
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa americana y pintura ya que tiene varios pedidos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  12 años y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus sueños es seguir en su negocio.
texts.en:
La Pradera Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year and for being a city of unequaled beauty with a lot of tourist attractions.

Luz, 60, lives there.  She's divorced and has three adult children from that relationship, one of whom still lives with her.  Luz is a very persevering woman who has always liked to work to make progress and get ahead with her children.

She works selling clothing from the United States.  She sells door-to-door as well as at home, where she has a small space.  Besides clothing, she also sells industrial paint on advance request from her customers; she delivers to the boats or shops where her customers need it.  She works almost all day, every day.  She has worked in this job for more than 35 years and she feels good about it because it's how she earns a living.

Luz is going to use this loan to buy clothing from the United States and paint, because she has a lot of requests.

She has been in the communal bank for 12 years and she likes it because the loans are a big help to her.  Her dream is to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and paint

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is in need of more capital to invest in her retail store to have more goods to offer and to renovate her store. This will allow her to increase her stock levels, have a more comfortable place, and increase the hygiene standards. She wishes to continue working and generating income to get ahead with her family, which is an incentive for her to better manage her profits. Her sales and profits have improved and her family lives a comfortable life.

Apolonia decided to request a new loan because of the positive effects it generates. This loan will help her to purchase more variety of grocery goods to sell.  She wants to offer more goods each time to her customers and to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is married and a 35-year-old mother of three who settled for a living in Tangub City. Her husband works as a carpenter and she manages transportation services. They have a farm of corn where they get more income and use for consumption. She has been in these activities for many years since she got married in order to make a living. 

She joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a new loan to repair her motorcycle and a portion will be used to buy manure fertilizer to improve her farm. In the future, she wants improvement to her business and to expand her corn production.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle and to buy manure fertilizer to improve her farm

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is 54-years-old, married and has four children. She sells fish and vegetables for income. She had been in her business for four years. Linda is now asking for additional revolving capital of PHP 4,000 to buy more fish, tomatoes, eggplant and beans to sell. She hopes to keep selling good products and services for additional profits.

loans.use: to buy more fish, tomatoes, eggplant and beans to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna, age 55, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a hog raising business in their village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 for each hog for every five months. Her income on this business is usually spent on their daily expenses at home. Due to insufficient funds from her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase a supply of hog feeds. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of hog feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrated feed

loans.name: Sokthy

texts.en:
Sokthy is 34 years old, a garment-factory worker and a married woman with a child living in Takeo province of Cambodia. She has been a garment-factory worker since 2001. Her husband is 44, a farmer and also a fisherman. Together, they can earn approximately $9 a day. 

Now Sokthy would like to request a loan to buy cows to feed and breed for calves to sell. This loan will help her earn more income. 

In the future, she is going to expand cow fattening, build a new house, and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy cows to feed and breed for calves

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is age 53, married to a farmer/construction worker, and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a hog raising business for almost five years, and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 for every 1 hog that she sells. 

Due to a lack of capital for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase a supply of hog feed. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to become more productive and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of hog feed.

loans.name: Rafael Arturo

texts.es: Rafael de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, él se dedica al cultivo de yuca desde hace 15 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados y ya tiene clientela establecida por los buenos productos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, Rafael esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos.
texts.en: Rafael is 30 years old and lives in his own home with his daughter. He has made a living from growing cassava for 15 years. He sells his products in different markets and has an established clientele for good products. From the earnings he makes from sales he can afford the living costs at home. Rafael is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, pest control, etc. to continue growing his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Don Feliciano de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo de 21 años de edad, él se dedica  a la venta de dulces y galletas, vende en un carretón por las diferentes calles y colonias de donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus venta logra salir adelante y solventar lo que se le presenta en su hogar, Don Feliciano está solicitando un crédito para la  compra de más mercadería por mayor y así poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan ingresos.
texts.en:
Feliciano, 59, lives in his own house with his 21-year-old son.

He earns a living selling candy and cookies, selling from a little cart throughout the various streets and neighborhoods where he lives.  With what he earns from his sales, he manages to get ahead and pay for whatever comes up in his household.

Feliciano's requesting a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale so he can continue with his sales, which generate an income for him.

loans.use: to buy candy and cookies

loans.name: Casiana

texts.en:
Casiana finds pleasure in doing her work with her piggery business. Not only that she is doing her hobby with her husband, but she earns an income as well. At the age of 52 and married, she keeps herself busy to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase additional piglets for her piggery. She sells her pigs in town, and sometimes vending meat on weekends. 

In the future, Casiana wishes to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets

loans.name: Jobel Obdulio

texts.es: Jobel de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa, jobel esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  frutas y verduras por mayor asi como muestra la fotografía, y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos para solventar los gatos que se le presenta y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Jobel is 31 years old and lives in his own home with his partner and his daughter. He makes a living selling fruit and vegetables at the market that is near his home. Jobel is requesting a loan to buy wholesale fruit and vegetables, as shown in the photo, so that he can improve his income in order to pay expenses that arise and give his family what they need, with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is age 39, and still single. She has owned and operated a motorcycle transport in their village for almost three years, and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on the school allowances of her nephew. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance for her motorcycle. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance for her motorcyle.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Don Guadalupe de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el se dedica  a la crianza de pollos desde hace 4 años, comercializa los pollos en los alrededores de la zona, con las ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  concentrado y vitaminas para continuar con la crianza y asi obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 38, lives in his own house with his life partner and his two children.

He has earned a living raising chickens for four years.  He sells the chickens in the vicinity of his area.  With his sales, he manages to pay some of the household expenses that come up.

Guadalupe's requesting a loan to buy concentrated feed and vitamins to continue raising chickens and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and vitamins

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 45 years old and with three children, settled for a living in Misamis Occidental with her family. She is a banana grower, and with her income, she was able to put up a retail store to make a living. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used for purchasing seedlings and organic fertilizer, for the previous cropping season. 

She took  a new loan recently to purchase manure fertilizer to restore farm nutrients; a portion will be use to buy grocery goods for her retail store.

Charita hopes to improve her business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase manure fertilizer and for grocery goods

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: To make a living, Helen owns and manages a general store where she sells assorted groceries. She has been in this business for over nine years and is able to support her family's needs. This 40-year-old mother of two has been able to sustain her business and has successfully repaid her previous loans from Gata Daku MPC. She used these previous loans for her business. She took a new loan recently to buy additional variety of grocery goods for her retail store. She plans to expand her business and send her children to school so that they can finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional variety of grocery goods

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan is 35 years old, a worker in weaving handicrafts, and a married woman with two children living in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. She has been working since 2012. Her husband is 37 is a security guard at a university. Both of them can earn approximately $12 per day. 

Now Sokhan would like to request a loan to buy calves to fatten and resell. This loan will help her earn more income. 

In the future, she is going to build a new house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten and resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en una zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de ropa, su madre es quien le dejo ese negocio y con el ha logrado salir adelante, vive con sus padres y su hermana, la joven esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder mas comprar ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor ya que le ha ido muy bien en las ventas y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: The young woman has had her face pixelated as she is 21 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has made a living for 3 years selling clothing. Her mother was the person who left her this business and with it she has managed to get ahead. She lives with her parents and her sister. The young woman is requesting a second loan to buy more wholesale men's and women's clothing, as her sales have been good, and she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing wholesale

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El socio Rafael se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, el socio realiza diferentes platos como caldo de gallina y caldo de cordero, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un restaurant. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne y pollo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rafael makes a living from the business of selling food. He creates several different dishes, such as chicken soup and lamb soup. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. He already has worked for 8 years in this business and it is going very well for him. His dream is to have a restaurant. 

Rafael is requesting the loan to purchase products to cook, such as rice, meat, and chicken.

Rafael is happy because of the loan and promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase products to cook, such as rice, meat, and chicken.

loans.name: Paula Marlene

texts.es: Paula de 46 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta, desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de minutas en las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes ya que es un producto muy vendible, ella vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hielo, jaleas de sabores, vasos, cucharas, etc. para continuar con sus ventas y obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Paula, 46, is a very hardworking, responsible, and honest woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her four children.

She has worked for eight years selling "minutas" [slush ice drinks] in the various neighborhoods near her house.  She has a lot of customers because it's a very marketable product. 

She's requesting a loan to buy ice, flavored syrups, glasses, spoons, and so on to continue with her sales and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy ice, flavored syrups, glasses, spoons, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
