loans.use: to purchase candy, basic grains, soft drinks, soups, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Hasellanne

texts.en:
Hasellanne, is aged 23, and married. 

She owns and has operated a retail store in her village for almost two years. She earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. Her income from this business is usually spent on daily expenses at home. Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase canned goods, noodles, beverages, and bread to sell. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, beverages, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Neonita

texts.en:
Neonita, a 56 year old mother of two children settled for a living in Misamis Occidental with her family.  

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in her village earning well for a living. Neonita borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store. She has been running the general store for many years. 

Improving the business is her passion because she wants to have a stable source of income for the family in the near future. Neonita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a 45-year-old mother of two who has settled for a living in Misamis Occidental with her family. She raises pigs in her backyard. Her husband is a farmer, and is growing a variety of crops to make a living. 

Sally borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC micro credit to buy feeding supplies and a piglet to raise. 

She is hoping to improve her pig's shelter to be used for expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies and a piglet to raise

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael de 62 años de edad vive con su esposa en casa propia, él se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de sorbetes artesanales desde hace 40 años, vende un producto de muy buena calidad por eso tiene mucha clientela, Ismael está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos para la elaboración como: leche, coco, azúcar, fresas, vainilla, etc. y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ismael is 62 years old and lives with his wife in their own home. He has earned a living selling homemade sorbets for the last 40 years. He sells a very good quality product and as a result he has many customers. Ismael is requesting a loan to buy supplies for production, such as milk, coconut, sugar, strawberries, vanilla, etc, so that he can improve his income.

loans.use: to buy milk, coconut, sugar, strawberries, vanilla, etc.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: El socio Hilario se dedica al negocio de venta de pollipapas que es un plato a base de pollo con papas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es tener un restaurant.El socio solicita el credito para comprar pollos y papas.
texts.en:
The member, Hilario, works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. selling "pollipapas," a dish made of chicken and potatoes.  He wants to get ahead with this business.

Hilario's requesting the loan to buy chicken and potatoes.

His dream is to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy chicken and potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and handbags at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is a 48-year-old mother of five, who helps her husband operate their own farm to earn a living. She has been doing this since she got married. 

Her farm is improving and she has successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC that she used for buying organic fertilizer.  She took a new loan recently to purchase additional manure fertilizer and to cover weeding maintenance costs. She also raises pigs to earn extra income. 

She hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their career, and she would like to ensure a better income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional manure fertilizer and cover weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is age 25, married and blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a hog raising business in their village for almost two years, and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 for every 1 hog that she sells. Her income from this business is usually spent on purchasing vegetables to sell to generate an additional source of income. 

Due to insufficient funds in her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase supply of hog feed. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of hog feed.

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Phnom Srouch district where farming is a common way to make a living, Chenda is a 27-year-old mother of two dependent children. Rice farming and raising pigs are the main sources of income for the family. She and her husband have been in the farming business for twenty-four years. 

This is not the first microloan for Chenda with Kiva’s partner; she completely paid back the first loan. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Chenda will use her portion to build a decent latrine for her family to use. 

She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Phnom Srouch district

loans.name: Vin's Group

texts.en:
Vin, 43, is a mother of seven children living in Kampong Speu province. To make a living, she grows rice and sells grocery items to earn extra income. She has involved in these businesses for ages, and she can earn about 26,600 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Vin with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. 

She hopes that she can improve her family's healthy living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Uok's Group

texts.en:
Uok, 40, is a father blessed with three children living in Kampong Speu province. He earns income to support his family’s condition through cropping rice, and is also growing beans to earn more income. The current business earns him about 30,000KHR per day. 

For Uok, this is his first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is now leading his group to ask for a loan. Uok, who is the leader, will use his portion to build a decent latrine. 

He hopes that he can update his lifestyle with a good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es: Jose de 37 años de edad se dedica a la venta y compra de chatarra desde hace 6 años, su negocio está en una zona muy céntrica por eso posee un mucha clientela, el vive en casa propia con su esposa quien le ayuda en el negocio y sus tres hijos los cuales estudian actualmente, jose esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar mas aluminio, cobre, bronce, plástico, etc. ya que esn estos meses le ha ido muy bien con las ventas y asi poder obtener muy buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
José, 37, has earned a living for six years buying and selling scrap metal.  His business is in a very central location, so he has a lot of customers.  He lives in his own house with his wife, who helps him with the business, and his three children, who are currently in school.

José's requesting another loan to buy more aluminum, copper, bronze, plastic, and so on.  His sales have gone very well for him in recent months and he wants to be able to earn very good profits.

loans.use: to buy aluminum, copper, bronze, plastic, etc.

loans.name: Placida Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia Placida Luzmila se dedica al negocio de venta de pollipapas que es un plato a base de pollo con papas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y papas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Placida Luzmila earns a living selling 'pollipapas', which is a dish made from chicken and potatoes. She works from 8.00am until 7.00pm. She hopes to get ahead through this business. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy chickens and potatoes. 

She is happy because of the loan and promises to meet all of her repayments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and potatoes

loans.name: Juana Delta

texts.es: Juana de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijos de 25 años de edad y quien le ayuda económicamente, ella posee un taller de costura ubicado en su casa desde hace 18 años, tiene mucha clientela que la buscan por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, elásticos, agujas, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana is 62 years old and lives in her own home with her child, aged 25, who helps support her financially. She has had a sewing workshop in her home for 18 years, and she has a lot of customers, who go to her for her high-quality work. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic needles and other items so that she can keep working and making a good income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic needles and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia had successfully repaid her previous loan used for her grocery store. She had this business for many years, and she was able to provide for her family. The business is doing well, and aside from her income, she also had a farm where she often helped her husband in cultivating. While waiting for her crops, she earns from her store. 

Sonia took a new loan recently to buy additional grocery goods for her retail store. 

In the future, Sonia wants to expand her business to improve their income for the family’s better future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for her retail store

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom is 32 years old, a garment factory worker and married woman with two children living in Takeo province of Cambodia. (In the photo, the borrower is pictured with her nephew.) Sarom has been a garment factory worker since 2000. One of her children is a student. Her husband is 35, a construction worker. Both of them can earn approximately $15 per day. 

Now Sarom would like to request a loan to buy a concrete mixer for her husband to use for work. This loan will help her husband work faster and earn more income for the family. In the future, she is going to renovate her house and help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a concrete mixer for her husband to use for work

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Doña maría desde hace algunos años decidió poner una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de huevos, pan dulce, granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para poder continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
María decided to set up a small store in her home a few years ago.  With her sales she manages to pay some of the household expenses that come up.  She lives in her own house with her family.

She's requesting a loan to buy eggs, pan dulce [sweet bread], basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, etc., so she can continue making sales and earning better profits.

loans.use: to buy eggs, baked goods, basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Juan Cancio Edilberto

texts.es:
El socio Juan Cancio Edilberto se dedica al negocio de agrocultura,el socio tiene un terreno donde cultiva cafe y luego lo vende,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de cafe.El socio solicita el credito para comprar fetilizantes y semillas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan Cancio Edilberto earns a living in the agriculture business.  He has a plot of land where he grows coffee to sell.  He works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  He wants to get ahead with this job.  His dream is to expand his coffee business.

Juan Cancio Edilberto is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

He's happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El socio Ignacio  se dedica al negocio de venta de pollipapas que es un plato a base de pollo con papas,el socio trabaja desde laa 2:00 p.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es tener un restaurant.El socio solicita el credito para comprar pollos y papas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ignacio earns a living selling "pollipapas", which is a dish made from chicken and potatoes. He works from 2.00pm until 9.00pm. He hopes to get ahead through this business. His dream is to have a restaurant. He is requesting the loan to buy chickens and potatoes. 

He is grateful for the loan and he promises to make all repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens and potatoes.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 20 años, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, harina de arroz, frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children, aged 15 and 10, who go to school. She has made a living selling "pupusas" - traditional meat or cheese-filled corn tortillas from El Salvador - for 20 years. She has a lot of customers because her pupusas are fairly-priced and she is a very friendly vendor. 

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, rice flour, beans, pork crackling, cottage cheese, and other items, so that she can keep working to improve her quality of life alongside her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice flour, beans, pork crackling, cottage cheese, and other items.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
El Señor Arnaldo es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene casa propia, es soltero, tiene 22 años, su mama es quien la ayuda siempre en todo lo que necesitan, y se ayudan los unos a los otros.
Arnaldo se dedica como constructor de obras trabaja por la ciudad de Santaní y compañías vecinas, tiene buenos ingresos buenas referencias en su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción, de manera  a poder seguir con su trabajo, con lo que podrá ayudar a su mama.
texts.en: Arnaldo is native of the city of Santaní. He owns his house. He is 22 years old and single. His mother is the one who always helps in everything they need, and they support each other. Arnaldo works as a builder in the city of Santaní and neighboring towns. He has good earnings, good references in his work. He is requesting a loan to invest in building materials. In this way he will continue doing his job, and with it he will be able to help his mother.

loans.use: to buy building materials to be used in construction projects.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es un hombre muy trabajador desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Don francisco vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. así como muestra la fotografía y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisco is a hardworking man who has been working in agriculture for many years. He grows corn and beans to sell around the region he lives in. Francisco lives in his own house with his family. 

He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticide, weed killer, etc. like that shown in the photo so that he can improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticide, weed killers, etc.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El socio Feliciano se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de fertilizantes, por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de fertilizantes. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Feliciano continues working in his business selling fertilizers. In this way, he hopes to get ahead. Feliciano works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. each day. His dream is to expand his business. 

Feliciano is requesting this loan in order to buy fertilizer. He is happy to have this loan and he pledges to make all the scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Kuña Kyrey está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están muy entusiasmadas en poder trabajar y ayudarse las unas a las otras de manera en conjunta.
La Sra. Primitiva es una de las que integran este grupo, ella se dedica a las confecciones variadas, y por medio de ello puede ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos del día a día, es muy luchadora y por sobre todo emprendedora, que pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y demás en cantidad, ya que de esa forma puede cubrir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas reciben de poder seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en:
The Kuña Kyrey group are in their first loan cycle of the women's communal bank programme. They are all very enthusiastic about being able to work and to help each other in a communal way.

Sra. Primitiva is one of the women that make up this group. She works in dressmaking, and through this she is able to help her family and cover their day to day expenses. She is very hard-working and above all entrepreneurial. She is asking for this loan to buy fabric, thread, glues and other materials in bulk. In this way she can meet the demand of her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity that they are all receiving to be able to continue growing and fighting.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, glues and other materials in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fish to sell.

loans.name: San Juan 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Juan 3 está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rocio quien es  manicurista, en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe esforzarse un poco mas a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa.
La Sra. Rocio solicita de este préstamo para la compra de 
Materiales como, Algodón, Esmalte y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más producción y mas venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: The group known as San Juan 3 is in the second cycle of the Women's Committee Program, in which all the women work and help one another to get ahead.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, in which they are all working hard to improve their living conditions. One of the members is Rocio, who is a manicure artist. In her last survey she showed a level of poverty within level one, which means that she needs to work a little harder through ongoing effort and work and conduct herself in a way which is required in order to be a successful woman. Rocio is requesting this loan in order to buy materials including cotton wool and nail polish, which will help her to be more productive and sell more, which in turn will enable her to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy cotton wool, nail polish and other supplies to use for manicures

loans.name: Yunalyn

texts.en:
Yunalyn, 27, finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. This activity is not only a hobby, but also a source of income. A married woman, she is mature enough to think of possibilities in order to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She wants to expand and improve her vegetable garden, for she earns good income from this. She borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC recently to buy organic fertilizer and a few seedlings for her vegetable garden. In the future, Yunalyn  wishes to become one of the suppliers of vegetables in the market in town.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and a few seedlings for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Kevin Daniel

texts.es:
Kevin de 19 años de edad, se dedica a la prestación de servicios de trasporte con el vehículo que ya es de su propiedad, el cual adquirió gracias al financiamiento que se le otorgo anteriormente, él trabaja de lunes a viernes, también trabaja sábado y domingo en una fotoestudio.

Kevin se creció con sus padres quienes lo educaron y lo apoyaron en sus estudios hasta que se graduó como bachiller técnico en el área de periodismo, luego comenzó a trabajar en una comercial en el área de mercadeo, con el paso del tiempo aprendió el trabajo de la fotografía con su amigo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una computadora y una impresora fotográfica, ya que está comenzando a montar su propio negocio de fotografía, la otra parte del dinero será para la reparación de una cámara semi profesional. 

Las metas que él tiene para un futuro son las de pagar el crédito y hacer una nueva solicitud para montar una librería y papelería también pretende comprar otro vehículo para servicios de transporte, tener su casa y formar su familia.
texts.en: Kevin is 19 years old. He works providing transportation services with a vehicle he already owns, which he got thanks to a previous loan. He works from Monday to Friday. He also works Saturdays and Sundays at a photo studio. Kevin grew up with his parents who educated him and gave him support in his studies. He graduated from high school with a technical qualification in journalism. Later he started working in a commercial company in marketing. Over time he learned photography from a friend. He is requesting the loan to buy a computer and a photographic printer, because he is starting to set up his own photography business. He will use the other part of the money to repair a semi professional camera.  His goals in the future are to repay his loan and then seek a new loan to open a bookstore and stationery store. He also would like to buy another vehicle for transportation services, have a house and form a family.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a photographic printer. The other part of the loan will be to repair a semi professional camera.

loans.name: Ma. Nenei

texts.en:
Ma. Nenei is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Carles, Iloilo. 

Ma. Nenei has been engaged in farming business for more than 20 years now. She and her husband are also engaged in fishing ventures. This provides them the additional income that they need. 

Ma. Nenei is asking for a loan to buy a boat engine. Through this, their fishing business will improve as well.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small-time borrower like her. Susan was able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she availed a loan to restock the store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to build a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha is 29 years old, a construction worker and a married woman with two children living in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. 

She has been a construction worker since 2011. One of her children is a student. Her husband is 29 and also a construction worker. Both of them can earn approximately $12 a day. 

Now Tha would like to request a loan to buy lumber to renovate her house. 

In the future, she wants to sell clothes at a market and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy lumber to renovate her house.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es:
Bibiana es una persona que se esta esforzando por ser una enfermera que pueda ser útil a las demás personas por medio de sus conocimientos, esta poniendo lo mejor de si para poder cumplir con su meta. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, lo que le fue de gran ayuda.
hoy pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de titulación que tiene, de manera a estar mas cerca de cumplir su meta de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Bibiana's someone who's making an effort to be a nurse, to be useful to other people through her knowledge.  She's giving it her best effort.  She said she used her previous loan to be able to pay her university fees, which was a big help to her.

She's requesting this loan today to be able to pay the expenses to register her degree.  That way she'll be closer to realizing her goal of being a professional.

loans.use: to pay to register her degree

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia por medio de su carrera quiere sentirse útil a la sociedad, ya que su carrera de psicología forense le abrirá muchas puertas y podrá abrirse camino en el mundo profesional. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y con ello poder cubrir con ese gasto que tiene, que es mucho y le va a costar cubrir.
texts.en: Silvia wants to feel useful to society through her career, because her career in forensic psychology will open doors and will give her opportunities in the professional world. She says that she used her previous loan to pay for her college tuition fees, which was of great help. Today she is requesting a loan to pay for the expenses to get her professional degree, and with it to be able to pay for her expenses which are big and will be difficult to pay.

loans.use: to pay for the expenses to get her professional degree.

loans.name: Doãn

texts.en:
Doãn is 26 years old and he is single with no children. He has his business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Doãn works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. He has been involved in this business for five years.

This is Doãn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Doãn faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

Doãn hopes to remodel his house, for his business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. 

Anita  has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she availed a loan to buy three additional piglets and a sack of feed for her chosen business. Anita wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional three piglets and sack of feed.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 61 years old and lives in Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. 

Antonieta is engaged in house-to-house manicure and pedicure services and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this business. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing new accessories for her manicure and pedicure business. 

Antonieta has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Antonieta hopes to have her own home service.

loans.use: to purchase new accessories for her manicure and pedicure business.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
In 2009, Lani learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Lani  tried her luck at doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Lani requested a loan amounting to PHP 14,900 to pay for labor for planting root crops. This will give her farming income a big boost. Lani looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for labor for planting root crops.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia Sabina   se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabina manages a craft business. She sells knitted goods, sweaters, blankets, and looms. Sabina also sells different woven articles. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Sabina has been in this business for eight years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her business of selling woven articles and looms.

Sabina is requesting a loan in order to buy woven articles, sweaters, and looms. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy woven articles, sweaters, and looms.

loans.name: Al Eha Group

texts.en:
Faten is the featured borrower for Al Eha Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and livelihoods at the same time.

Faten (the first lady at the right) is a 41-year-old married mother of three children. Due to her husband’s limited salary, she decided a year ago to sell Brazilian gold in an attempt to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Faten is acquiring a loan now to expand her work and increase her business merchandise with a more fashionable Brazilian gold collection.

With respect to the other members of the group, Marcela (the lady in the middle) is a 21-year-old single lady who works as hairdresser and makeup artist from her house and wants to buy necessary beauty tools, especially an eyebrow tattoo machine, while Christine (the first one at the left) is a 19-year-old single lady who gives private courses from her house and works as a Tupperware saleswoman who wants to improve her Tupperware business.

loans.use: To expand her work and increase her business merchandise with a more fashionable Brazilian gold collection.

loans.name: Rinalyn

texts.en:
Rinalyn is a 23-year-old married woman and a mother of a 2-year-old child from Iloilo, Philippines. 

She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than three years now. This is the source of her income.
 
Rinalyn is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and fishing nets. Rinalyn believes that this loan could help them improve their income from fishing. 

Rinalyn wants to save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en:
Leopoldo is 62 years old, he is married to Lilia, and they have three children. 

He has been a fisherman for almost 15 years. He does this activity to support his family for their daily needs and to support the education of his children. 

Leopoldo requested a loan from Paglaum to purchase materials for his fishing activities. Someday, he hopes to operate a fish pen through the help of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business failed. 

PMPC came to Esther's rescue by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seed bed preparation. 

Esther perseveres and always believes she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seed bed preparation.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 50 years old with five children. Vilma personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. 

Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost five years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for the purchase of new nets.  

As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  

She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Kairkul

texts.ru: Каиркул успешно погасила предыдущий кредит по линии Кива, использовала его по назначению. Она очень благодарна всем инвесторам и Фонду Кива. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Каиркул есть 2 коровы, 10 овец и 10 коз, также на собственной земельной доле мерою 2,0 ГА она выращивает ячмень и сено. Каиркул уже заготовила 100 тюков и 3 тележки сена на зиму для скота. Она планирует дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса, поэтому обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей их перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Каиркул планирует потратить на ремонт сарая.
texts.en: Kairkul successfully paid off her previous Kiva loan, having used the funds as intended. She is very thankful to all investors and to Kiva. She now has two cows, 10 sheep and 10 goats, as well as her own 2.0 hectare piece of land where she grows barley and hay. Kairkul has already prepared 100 bales and three carts of hay for her animals to eat over the winter. She plants to further develop her business and therefore has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase steers for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan toward repairing her barn.

loans.use: to purchase steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is a student in a university in his village taking Deck Watch Keeping. He wants to finish his course and wants to have a stable career to be able to help his three siblings to become successful in their future. 

He joined Gata Daku MPC and recently borrowed a loan to pay his school tuition fee for the first semester of this current year. He is hopeful for his success in order to help his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee for the first semester of this current year

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is from Baliangao. She found farming as her primary source of income. As a hardworking mother, she seeks financial help from Paglaum. She availed herself of a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. 

Jenalyn perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Joecil

texts.en:
In the year 2007, Joecil learned of Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends. As a farmer in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to finance her root crop gardening. 

After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Joecil feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Limpia

texts.es:
Limpia es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, tiene 35 años, está casada y comenta que tiene 3 hijos, está estudiando y actualmente está en el 4to año de la Licenciatura en ciencias de la educación a fin de que cuando se gradúe pueda tener más campo de trabajo y mejorar su condición económica para invertir en el futuro de sus hijos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el gasto de su titulación, ya que tiene un gasto que quiere cubrir.
texts.en:
Limpia is 35 years old and from the city of Paraguarí. She's married with three children and is in her fourth year of studying toward a degree in Learning Sciences. Once she has graduated, she will have more opportunities to find work and improve her economic situation so that she can invest in the future of her children.

She is asking for this loan in order to invest it in the cost of her qualification, since she has an expense that she would like to cover.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of her qualification

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
In the year 2009, Jocelyn was a farmer in Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City. She tried her luck and borrowed a loan to finance her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Jocelyn feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently, she accessed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next crop season. Jocelyn wishes to sustain her business and be able to put up a stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two dependents, now school-aged. 

Marites has been working as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) in Dubai for five years already to support her family. She is earning an approximate amount of PHP 19,000 each month being an OFW but still their family income is not enough to meet their family needs especially for their children’s education.

Marites has requested a loan to be used in reacquiring their parcel of cocoland that was pawned during the time she was applying for work abroad.

Marites has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Marites hopes to engage in business and will permanently stay here in the country together with her family.

loans.use: To be used in reacquiring their parcel of cocoland

loans.name: Mark James

texts.en:
Mark James lives in Zamboanga Sibugay with his family. He had a big family of five siblings; two of them got married and already had their own familes. 

He studies Deck Watch Keeping in the school located in Zamboanga del Sur. He wants to finish his studies in order to gain knowledge for sustaining lives with a better future.

He joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan  to pay the school tuition fee for this semester. This loan would be of big help to him. He is hoping to accomplish his ambition with determination and faith.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 53 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at their adult age. 

Paz has earned a living from native chicken buying and selling for eight years already. She is also engaged in coffin embroidery and accessories making. She earns approximately 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used for buying additional heads of native chicken for resale. Paz has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Paz hopes to expand her native chicken business.

loans.use: To buy additional chickens

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
"Hardworking mother" best describes Rebecca. She lives in Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She was gifted with six children.

Rebecca is the ever supportive right hand of her husband in earning a living for their family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself helping her husband in plowing the rice field and planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodities. 

In need of additional working capital, Rebecca decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for buying farm and garden fertilizer and paying labor costs for cultivating their land. 

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Rebecca is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all, nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase garden and farm fertilizer and pay labor costs for land cultivation

loans.name: Al Amir Group

texts.en:
Randa is the featured borrower for Al Amir Group. She came together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living situation at the same time.

Randa is a 48-year-old married woman with two stepchildren. Twenty-three years ago, she opened a grocery store to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Randa used to work as a nurse, but increasing family needs and her limited salary caused her to need a daily income business, which she established for this reason. Randa is working hard to improve the living situation of her family, thus she is acquiring a loan to expand and increase her business merchandise with special offer products and more requested products, in an attempt to attract more customers and satisfy their needs, especially for the coming autumn and winter seasons.

With respect to the other group members, Raeda is a 46-year-old married mother of three children who works in tailoring and wants to pay her children’s school fees, while Fawziya is a married mother of six children who works in a farm and wants to renovate her house to make a healthier place for her family.

Randa is the lady standing in the middle, Raeda is the lady on the left, and Fawziya is the lady at the right of the photo.

loans.use: To expand her business merchandise with special offer products and more requested products

loans.name: Nouhad

texts.en:
Nouhad is a 35-year-old divorced mother of three children. Two years ago, she opened a grocery shop to cover the expenses and needs of her children since she has become their sole earner.

She is working hard to provide her children with better social and financial living conditions, through developing her business and increasing her income. For this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy car which will facilitate her needs entirely, in such a way that she’ll be able to search freely for better offers and products, and at the same time respond to her children’s needs.

loans.use: To buy car for her grocery business.

loans.name: Aldin

texts.en:
Aldin learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in 2008. He has accessed loans and tried his luck at doing a business focusing on his farming activities. He is thankful to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital. 

Aldin borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give his farming income a big boost. Aldin looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: El Lirio Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Liro se ubica en una zona cañera, por ende la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican al trabajo en campo, siendo la mejor temporada la zafra que es cuando ocurre el corte de la caña. En esta temporada los campos sin las plantas dejan ver  con mayor claridad el barrio donde esta ubicado el grupo.

Maria Santa- Venta De Ropa 
Celia- Tienda de abarrotes
Ma Del Carmen- Venta De Comida Y Refrescos
Emmanuel- Venta De Refacciones
Patricia- Venta De Plata Y Ropa 
Ruben- Venta De Refrescos
Javier- Servicio De Soldadura
Francisco- Servicio De Soldadura 

Todos ellos son los integrantes del grupo y eligieron su nombre nombre por el gusto que comparten por la flor.

Doña Celia es una mujer muy trabajadora, alegre, honesta y responsable; es madre soltera y le gusta mucho el baile, escuchar música y vivir para sus 4 hijos (sólo una es menor de edad y aun estudia). Desde hace ya 6 años, Celia tiene una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su casa, la cual le permite obtener las ganancias necesarias para solventar los gastos de su hogar, de su hija y continuar con la compra de mercancía para abastecer su tienda. Celia quiere invertir su préstamo en: arroz, sopa, frijoles, aceite, detergentes, azúcar, atún, sardina, harina, cerillos, galletas, pan, tosadas, papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, refrescos, agua y algunas verduras como jitomates, chiles, cebollas, ajos lo que le ayudará a ofrecer un mejor surtido a sus clientes.

*En la imagen: Doña Celia se ubica detrás de la joven de blusa verde.
texts.en:
The group “El Lirio” (The Iris) is located in an area that grows sugar cane. Most of the residents work in that industry. The harvest season is the best time since that is when the sugar cane is cut. During that time, the fields are bare so it is much easier to see the neighborhood where this group is located.

The members are as follows:
• Maria Santa sells clothes.
• Celia has a grocery store.
• Ma. Del Carmen sells food and soft drinks.
• Emmanuel sells snacks.
• Patricia sells silver and clothes.
• Ruben sells soft drinks.
• Javier provides welding services.
• Francisco provides welding services.

All of the members joined this group and chose the name because they like that particular flower.

Doña Celia is a woman who is hardworking, cheerful, honest, and responsible. She is a single mother who enjoys dancing, listening to music, and living for her four children (only one is not an adult and still in school). For the past six years, Celia has been operating a grocery store from her home, which allows her to generate needed income for her household expenses, supporting her daughter, and continuing to buy inventory for her store.

Celia wants to invest her loan in the purchase of rice, soup, beans, oil, detergents, sugar, tuna, sardines, flour, matches, cookies, bread, dried tortillas, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, soft drinks, water, and a few vegetables such as tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, and garlic. This will help her to offer a better stock of products to her customers.

*In the photo, Doña Celia is standing behind the woman wearing a green blouse.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for her store.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 52 years old and married with five children.

Ester works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like toothbrushes, sanitary pads, bottled water, soft drinks, canned goods, candies, etc., to sell.

Ester has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from an Internet cafe.

Ester aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like toothbrushes, sanitary pads, bottled water, soft drinks, canned goods, candies, etc., to sell

loans.name: Néstor Salvador

texts.es:
Néstor de 20 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes principios que lo hacen  una buena persona, él trabaja en el campo de la agricultura. Néstor se creció junto a sus padres quienes fueron personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que le formaron y enseñaron a cultivar la tierra, su familia formada por sus padres y sus 3 hermanos siendo él el mayor de todos a quien le tocaba  ayudar en los trabajos del campo junto a sus padres. Su nivel de estudio es de tercer grado, él pudo sacar sus estudios por la tarde, ya que por la mañana trabajaba la agricultura con su padre al transcurrir el tiempo, cuando ya era un joven conoció a su querida esposa, desde entonces él se dedica a la agricultura y venta de helados los fines de semana. Néstor se ocupa de cultivar granos básicos, con  experiencia de 8 años.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar fertilizantes, ya que ha realizado las siembras de maíz y frijol de postrera y necesita aplicar los fertilizantes adecuados para que tenga una buena cosecha. 

Las proyecciones que tiene a futuro son las de tener un negocio de venta de granos básicos que le permita dar servicio a los habitantes de su colonia,  y apoyar en la educación de su hijo hasta que sea un profesional, tener una casa con todas las comodidades y que le garantiza una vivienda digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Néstor is 20 years old, and is a good person with excellent principles. He works in agriculture. Néstor grew up with his parents, who are very humble and hard-working, and taught him how to work the land. His family is made up of his parents and his three siblings. He is the eldest, and for this reason it was his job to help his parents work the fields. 

Néstor reached the third grade at school. He was able to study in the afternoons, as in the mornings he would work in the fields with his father. He met his beloved wife when he was young, and since then he has made a living in agriculture and selling ice cream at weekends. Néstor grows basic grains, and has 8 years' experience.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy fertilisers, now that he has planted corn and red "postrera" beans and needs to apply the right fertiliser to get a good harvest.

His future plans are to set up a business selling basic grains to the inhabitants of his town, to support his child's education until they become a professional, and to have a house with all conveniences which enables his family to live a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, now that he has planted corn and red "postrera" beans.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, actualmente está estudiando la carrera de psicología con énfasis laboral. 
Él se está esforzando por ser un profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de la profesional que ha elegido. Le gusta mucho la carrera que escogió, es por ello que se dedica mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus útiles de la carrera y también demás materiales. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe que le servirá mucho.
texts.en:
José is from the city of Paraguarí.

Currently he's studying psychology with an emphasis on labor.  He's making an effort to be a professional who can help other people through his chosen profession.  He likes the field he chose a lot, which is why he works so hard.

José's requesting this loan to be able to cover his professional supplies as well as other materials.  He's grateful for the support he's receiving because it will be of great use to him.

loans.use: to buy professional supplies and other materials

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan hoy esta en el octavo semestre de la carrera de análisis de sistemas, comenta que le gusta mucho su carrera y que le esta poniendo su mejor empeño para poder sobresalir y ser un buen profesional. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en el pago de sus cuotas, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en los gastos de su universidad, de manera a comprar sus materiales de estudios y poder seguir con su carrera.
texts.en:
Adan is now in his eighth semester of studying for a degree in systems analysis.  He says that he likes his career a lot.  He is putting forth his best effort in order to be able to succeed and to be a good professional.

He states that he used his previous loan to make his payments, and that it was a big help to him.

He is requesting this loan for his university expenses.  This way he will buy his educational materials and be able to continue with his degree studies.

loans.use: to pay for his educational materials.

loans.name: Ruth Madeli

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KANCHARISUN, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Ruth Madeli  tiene 21 años de edad y es soltera , la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando para una empresa privada, la socia lleva buen tiempo en su trabajo  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día , la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de bienes de consumo.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ruth Madeli belongs to the Communal Bank “Kancharisun” which is located in the District of Cusco, Department of Cusco. She is 21 years old and single. Ruth divides her time between her daily activities and her job at a private company. She has been at this job for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day. Ruth wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy consumer goods. She appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy consumer goods.

loans.name: Kankelen Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Kankelen vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Ségou coura  bamanan de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de bois et de charbon, d’habillement et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  6eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mah  (la 2eme femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de bois et de charbon dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un chargement de bois et 2 sacs de charbon  à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mah espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Kankelen all live in traditional families, and they average 33 years of age and three children each, all living in the Ségou Coura district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They have small-scale businesses involving wood and charcoal, clothing, and food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their sixth solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Mah (the second woman standing in the photo) is a major vendor of wood and charcoal in around the district. She intends to use her loan to purchase a load of wood and 2 sacks of charcoal in Ségou. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often credit at the house and at the market. 

With this loan, Ms. Mah hopes to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used for the children’s sundry needs and also for increasing her capital. She would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase wood and charcoal

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
20 son las mujeres que se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio de ese esfuerzo ayudar a sus seres queridos. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas y conforme a ello poder trabajar para superarse.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marissa, quien vende todo tipo de prendas de manera ambulante, es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora que lucha por su familia para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Twenty women got together to be able to support each other and help their loved ones as a result of their efforts.  They're completing the poverty-elimination survey, through which they'll be able to know each one's circumstances and work to improve themselves accordingly.

One of the members is Marissa, a street vendor of all types of clothing.  She's a very persevering and enterprising woman who strives to give her family everything she couldn't have.

She's requesting this loan to invest in buying t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and other merchandise.  That way she'll be able to continue making sales, fulfilling her customers' requests.

They're all grateful for the opportunity to be able to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and other merchandise

loans.name: Aide

texts.es:
Aide es una joven estudiante, vive y trabaja como empleada domestica para solventar los gastos de su facultad.
Es muy dedicada a sus estudios, es una buena persona que desea sobresalir por medio de sus estudios. Ella está estudiando para poder ser una enfermera que ayude a las demás personas.
Aide pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder estar más cerca de su sueño de ser una enfermera que ayude a las demás personas.
texts.en:
Aide's a young student.  She lives and works as a domestic employee to pay her college expenses.

She's very devoted to her studies.  She's a good person who wants to get ahead with her education.  She's studying to be a nurse who helps other people.

Aide's requesting this loan to be able to pay her fees for her program so she'll be closer to her dream of being a nurse who helps other people.

loans.use: to pay her university feeds

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Lafia vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de grains, d’habillement, cosmétique et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  4eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Aminata  (la 1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de grains d’arachides dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 sacs d’arachides  à Ségou chez les stockeurs. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Aminata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 40 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The seven women of the group Lafia all live in nuclear families, and they average 36 years of age and three children each, all living in the Bagadadji district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They have small-scale businesses involving grains, clothing, cosmetic products, and food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Aminata (the first woman standing from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of peanuts in around the district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 50 sacks of peanuts from warehouses in Ségou. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often credit at the house and at the market. 

With this loan, Ms. Aminata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for the children’s sundry needs and also for increasing her capital. She would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Rossmari

texts.es:
Rossmari está en el cuarto año de la carrera de contabilidad, se está esforzando para poder sobresalir  y ser un profesional útil para la sociedad.
Comenta que por medio de su carrera quiere poder ayudar a las personas de la sociedad y sentirse útil, y también poder realizarse como persona y profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y así seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Rossmari is in the fourth year of her accounting degree. She is working hard to excel and be a professional who is of use to society. She says that through her career, she wants to help people and feel useful, as well as realise her personal and professional potential. 

She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees, and in this way, continue fighting to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es de la ciudad de Pilar, vive con su mama y su hermano, su meta futura es recibirse como Administrador de empresas y poner un negocio en su ciudad.
Lo que le  inspira a hacer esto es su familia ya que ellos siempre  han estado a su lado y lo han ayudado en todo lo que necesita.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas, y seguir con sus estudios y llegar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Carlos is from the city of Pilar.  He lives with his mother and his brother.  His goal for the future is to become a business administrator and to set up a business in his city.

His family inspires him to do this.  They have always been by his side and helped him with everything that he needs.

He is requesting a loan to be able to cover his payments, to continue with his studies, and to meet his goals.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz esta estudiando la carrera de ciencias contables, además de estudiar esta trabajando, y por medio de esto está luchando y cubriendo sus estudios.
Ella es una persona muy emprendedora que esta luchando y se está esforzando para ser una contadora exitosa.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus útiles de la universidad, y asi estar cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Liz is studying for a degree in accounting.  In addition to going to school, she is working.  It is through her work that she is struggling and covering her education.

She is a very enterprising person who is struggling.  She is putting forth great effort to be a successful accountant.

She is requesting this loan for her university supplies.  This way she will be close to her goal.

loans.use: to pay for university supplies.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel, 29 years old, lives in Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack and food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands and snacks to their neighbors. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative and became a became a MIGS (Member in Good Standing) member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional raw ingredients for her snack and food vending. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini fast-food chain.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her snack and food vending

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 53 years old with five children. Leonarda personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  

Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost six years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to 40,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for the purchase of new nets.  

As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  

In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is aged 38, married and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a hog-raising business in their village for almost three years and earns a net income of 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every four months. 

Her net income usually is spent on the school allowances of their children. 

Due to lack of capital in her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase a supply of hog feeds. She's hoping that her business will continue to become more productive and more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn lives in Pagadian City with her family. She is single and studying hotel and restaurant management. She wants to become a successful chef in the future. 

She joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester of this current year. She is hopeful to gain knowledge in order to become a better person in the future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee

loans.name: Resgan

texts.en: Resgan is studying at a university to earn a Bachelor of Science degree in Information Technology. Resgan is very dedicated to his studies and wants to become successful in his career. His father is a tricycle driver and his mother earns a living from her cafeteria. He had a previous loan that he used for paying his previous tuition fee. He is currently taking another loan to pay for the tuition fee for the first semester this year. His goal is to have a better life and career in the future, in order to support his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee for the first semester this year

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years of age and is married. They are gifted with three children. Her husband has no permanent work and is unable to sustain the needs of the family. Rosa has found ways to attain income through snack-vending. It began with selling a small amount of snacks to their neighbors. 

In January of 2006, Rosa joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for 14,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery and is able to have their house repaired.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 40 years old and lives in Pobalcion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 3 children, now at their school age. 

Ruel has been engaged in an ice drop vending business for 8 years already and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month from doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing electrical wires, switches, junction box, breakers and florescent lamp for his house electrical installations. Ruel has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Ruel hopes to have his own ice drop processing business.

loans.use: To purchase electrical wires, switches, junction box, breakers and florescent lamp

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 57 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Victoria is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal solicita un nuevo crédito, ya que el dinero de este préstamo será invertido en la compra de abonos, ya que el primer crédito que saco fue para comprar semillas y algunos fertilizantes, ahora solo necesita comprar varios sacos de abono para terminar de sacar su cosecha.
	
Él tiene un sueño en la vida y quiere poder lograrlo y es poder tener una buena cosecha este año y tener buenos ingresos de su cultivo ya que estará realizando dos tipos de cultivo en el año, esto le generara mejores ganancias y poder pagar su crédito.
texts.en:
Vidal is requesting a new loan. The money will be invested in the purchase of compost. His first loan was used to buy seeds and some fertilizers. Now the only thing he needs to do is purchase several sacks of compost so that he can proceed to the end of the harvest.

His dream in life that he wants to achieve is to have a good harvest this year. By generating a good income, he will have been able to grow two different crops in a year. This will help him earn more income so that he can repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of compost.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con sus hermanos en casa propia de ladrillo y cemento donde ocupa solo una habitación, LUis y su familia viven en La Paz.
El cliente trabaja en su taller elaborando ventanas de aluminio por mas de diez horas al día ya que con lo poco que gana debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
Necesita crédito para  reparar las grietas en las paredes de su casa, estas grietas fueron ocasionadas por el asentamiento de la tierra, ademas, su hogar necesita un revoque y pintado de estuco. Luis es la  principal fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Luis is single, and has no children. He lives with his siblings in his own house made of brick and cement, where he occupies one room. Luis and his family live in La Paz. He works in a workshop making aluminum windows for more than 10 hours a day. He has to pay for food costs and basic services with the little he makes.

He needs a loan to repair the cracks in the walls of his house. The cracks were caused by the settling of the earth. Also the house needs a whitewash and new coating of stucco. Luis is the principal source of income for his household so he needs your help.

loans.use: to repair the cracks in the walls of his house, whitewash it and coat it with stucco.

loans.name: Benjamin Group

texts.fr: Kanefu est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise Benjamin, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 56 ans, mère de 7 enfants, 5 étudient et 2 sont mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuses des denrées alimentaires dans un dépôt du centre commercial depuis 10 ans. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Elle va acheter de haricots. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kanefu is a merchant and a member of the ’banc villageois’ Benjamin. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married, 56 years old, and the mother of seven children (5 students and 2 married). She started her business with funds from her husband. She has been a vendor of grocery items at a warehouse in the commercial center for ten years. Her husband is unemployed. Kanefu is going to purchase some beans. She would like to obtain more loans and provide schooling, clothing, and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase beans

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar tiene un taller de confecciones, es cliente  recurrente excelente de Fundación, esta casado con la Sra. Maria con quien tiene un hijo, por quien estan luchando para poder darle una vida sin privaciones.
El pide este prestamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, accesorios y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones y de esa manera poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Oscar agradece por la ayuda que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda y le permitirá poder crecer en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar has a sewing workshop and is an excellent repeat client of Fundación Paraguaya. He is married to Sra. Maria and they have one child. For this reason, he strives to provide a life without deficiency.

Oscar is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the purchase of fabrics, thread, accessories, and other items. This will enable him to continue sewing, which would allow him to help his loved ones.

Oscar appreciates the assistance he has received since it will be of great help and allow him to grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, accessories, and other supplies.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto finds pleasure in doing his gardening activities. Not only because he is doing his hobby but because he earns an income as well. At the age of 58 and married, he busies himself to sufficiently provide for his family. 

He grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. He credits the cooperative for supporting his gardening activities. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. 

In the future, Alberto wishes to become the supplier of species in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies, clothing, footwear, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to resell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose tiene 3 hijos, vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es propia, la casa esta en buenas condiciones Jose es rentista y director de una un colegio Jose tiene una movilidad y necesita un credito para cubrir los gastos de tramites y documentacion de su vehiculo Jose vive con su madre y ella le asiste pero el cuidado de los hijos es un gasto grande por eso este cliente quiere su ayuda, además, Jose necesita tener su vehiculo con los papeles en orden, caso contrario, no podra movilizarse
texts.en:
Jose has three children. He lives in a brick and cement house that he owns in La Paz. The house is in good condition. He is the treasurer and director of a school.

Jose owns a vehicle and needs a loan in order to cover the cost of fees and documentation for his vehicle. His mother lives with him and she helps him by taking care of his children, which would be a huge expense.

Jose needs assistance so that he can have the papers for his vehicle in order. Otherwise, he would not be able to travel.

loans.use: to cover the cost of filing fees and documentation for his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose  al negocio de venta de carne, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia  lleva años con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar carne.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage her business of selling meat. She has been in this line of work for years and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her business, which has given her personal satisfaction.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy meat. She appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Relais Dolel Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Relais Dolel, est un regroupement de femmes appelées relais ou agent communautaire de santé. Elles ont créé leur association depuis plus de 5 ans, et en sont à leur second crédit à l’IMCEC. La présidente, la dame Awa, fait de la transformation de céréales locales depuis 3 ans. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter du mil, du maïs qu’elle va transformer en couscous et dérivés pour revendre.
Awa est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et appuie son mari dans les charges de la maison.
Elle veut voir un jour, son entreprise se développer à un niveau national, créer une unité de production réglementaire bien connue.
texts.en:
The loan group Relais Dolel is a group of women called “relais” or community health representatives. The women created their association over five years ago and are now on their second loan at IMCEC.
