The president, Ms. Awa, has been processing local grains for three years. With this loan, she is going to purchase some millet and corn that she will process into couscous and other products to resell. 

Awa is married and a mother of four. She helps to cover day-to-day spending and supports her husband in managing household expenses. One day, she wants to see her enterprise develop to a national level and establish a well-known factory according to regulations.

loans.use: to purchase local grains: millet and corn for making couscous and other products to resell

loans.name: Ahmadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ahmadou travaille comme agent d’assurance depuis 7 ans. Ses horaires sont de 8h à 13h et de 15h à 18h. Il est divorcé et père d’un garçon de 14 ans. C’est d’ailleurs pour ce dernier qu’il veut emprunter pour la 2ème  fois, un crédit à l’IMCEC pour lui permettre de régler des charges scolaires
Ahmadou habite avec ses parents et se charge de la dépense quotidienne de toute la famille.
Ahmadou vit des commissions provenant de sa productivité, de là il envisage d’ouvrir son propre bureau d’assurance, qu’il confiera ultérieurement à la femme qu’elle va épouser ; il continuera à exercer et prendra la relève à sa retraite, l’activité aura déjà pris son envol.
texts.en:
Ahmadou has been working as an insurance agent for seven years.  He works from 8am to 1pm and from 3pm to 6pm.  Ahmadou is divorced and has one son who is fourteen years old.  It is because of his son that Ahmadou has requested this second loan from the field partner, UIMCEC.  He plans to use his loan to pay for school fees.  

Ahmadou lives with his parents and provides for the day-to-day expenses of his whole family.  He lives off the commission that he makes from his insurance work, and hopes one day to open his own insurance office.  In the future, he would like to remarry and have his wife work with him in his business.  Ahmadou believes that his business will be successful and his future wife will be able to continue working there once he retires.

loans.use: to pay the school fees of his son.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert lives in Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. He is in a big family of five siblings and one of them got married. 

He studied basic seafaring in the school in the province. He wants to finish his studies in order to gain the knowledge to become a successful man. 

He had joined Gata Daku MPC and requested a loan to pay the school tuition fee for this semester. This loan would be of big help to him and he hopes to accomplish his ambition in the future to become a seaman.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: Akouélé une jeune maman de 02 enfants est revendeuse de profession. Elle revend des habits qu'elle achète au Grand Marché de Lomé de façon ambulante. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Le gain tiré de cette vente lui servira de louer une boutique pour éviter de se promener et de subvenir aux besoins des clients. Âgée de 27ans, elle a une ancienneté de 03ans.
texts.en: Akouélé, a young mom of two, is a retailer by trade. She resells clothing that she purchases at the Grand Marché of Lomé. [She resells her goods] by going door to door. To respond better to the needs of her customers, she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to purchase some merchandise. The profit earned from her sales will be used to lease a shop, so that she can void having to go from door to door. She can also meet customer needs. She is 27 years old and has three years of seniority.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 43-year-old married father of three children.  He is a Palestinian refugee, who lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp.

Twenty years ago, Anwar started working as a carpenter, specializing in doors and furniture, to cover the needs and expenses of his family. His wide talent and experience in his domain provides him with customer's trust and recommendations.

Today, Anwar is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua. He plans on improving and developing his business by purchasing necessary updated and newly released carpentry tools to refine the quality of his services.  

He hopes to expand his business in the future in order to provide better living conditions for his beloved children.

loans.use: to purchase necessary updated and newly released carpentry tools.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, 61, is from Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 4 children.  

Lourdes joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. The co-op supported her by providing the capital to start her fruit and vegetable selling. Helping the family survive, she gives her best efforts to get enough sales daily to provide their basic needs. 

Lourdes is now trying to expand her resources by increasing her inventory to raise more income. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well-known and to build a good business for her loyal customers. 

With her extra income, she wishes to have a good standard of living with her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit and vegetables for selling

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Djappo Dimbalente Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Djappo Dimbalanté qui signifie entraide, regroupe des femmes qui s’activent dans le commerce. Madame Diariètou, à droite sur la photo, est la présidente et elle évolue dans le secteur de la transformation des céréales locales depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle va acheter des céréales, du mil et du maïs, qu’elle va transformer en couscous et dérivés. Elle mettra en sachets et commercialisera cela dans les marchés et chez des clients voisins. 
Diariètou est mariée et elle aide beaucoup son mari dans les charges de la maison et l’éducation de ses enfants.
Elle a comme ambition d’ouvrir une cantine devant la maison et de ne plus faire l’ambulant.
texts.en:
The 'Djappo Dimbalanté' (Mutual Support) Group is made up of women who work in retail.  Diariètou (sitting on the right in the photo) is the group president and has been preparing and selling local cereals for more than ten years.

Diariètou plans to use her loan to buy millet and maize, she will transform it into couscous, pack it in sachets and sell it at market and to her neighbours.

Diariètou is married and helps her husband a lot with their household expenses and their children's school costs.  In the future, Diariètou would like to open a restaurant in front of her house so she can stop selling her couscous on foot.

loans.use: to buy local cereals, prepare them and then resell them.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Angoulême de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de jus de fruit, d’habillement, et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  8eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kadia  (la 2eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de jus de fruit dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de poudre de jus de fruit, 20 kg de sucre et les autres ingrédients à Ségou chez les fournisseurs. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Kadia espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 60 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkadi group are women who all live in nuclear families. They average 43 years of age and seven children each. They live in the district of Angoulême, in the city of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors, through ties of marriage and kinship, and from the income-generating activities that they conduct in the area. They sell fruit juices and clothing, and they offer restaurant services.  

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance program, and this is their 8th group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Kadia (standing 2nd from the right in the group photo) is a leading reseller of fruit juices in her neighborhood and adjacent districts. She plans to use her loan to buy a large supply of fruit juice powder, 20 kg of sugar and other ingredients from wholesalers in Ségou. She sells her products from her home and at the market to a mixed clientele, cash or credit.  

Mrs. Kadia expects to earn an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which she will use to support a portion of her children’s needs and to bolster her capital. She hopes to continue her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy fruit juice powder.

loans.name: Rule

texts.en:
In the year 2010, Rule learned about GDMPC and the financial assistance it gives for start-ups. As a farmer in Misamis Occidental, he tried his luck by beginning a business in transportation services. He became a GDMPC Member this year and borrowed some money, which he will use to buy a new set of tires in order to replace the old and damaged tires. To this day, Rule feels he owes his good fortune to the improvement.

In the future he wishes to sustain his business and to be able to buy more motorcycles. In addition, he would like to supply rice to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires.

loans.name: Jeaca

texts.en:
Jeaca is single and studying Information and Communication Technology in the university. She lives in Pagadian City with her family. 

She wants to become successful someday and she believes that she can achieve that by pursuing her studies. She had joined Gata Daku MPC and requested a new loan to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. 

In the future, she wants to help her parents' living and wants to become a successful woman in their community.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susan is 39 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Susan has a food vending business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Susan has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Elma requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elma would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sainat

texts.ru: Сайнат погасила свой предыдущий кредит своевременно и без нарушений, использовала его по назначению. Сайнат очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам за непосильную помощь. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Сайнат есть 4 коровы и 12 овец, для скота заготовлено 3 тележки сена, подготовлены сараи. На собственной земельной доле мерою 2,0 Га Сайнат выращивает ячмень, сено и фруктовые деревья. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайнат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Сайнат направит на расширение ее хозяйства.
texts.en:
Sainat paid off her previous loan on time and without any problems, having used the funds as planned. She is very thankful to Kiva and all investors for the help she needed. She now has four cows and 12 sheep and has three carts of prepared hay in the barn for winter. She also grows barley, hay and fruit trees on her own 2-hectare piece of land. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Sainat has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase sheep. She will put profits from the loan toward further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es soltera, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Curuguaty,  Estudia, y está cursando el segundo  año   de la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial.
Está luchando para poder convertirse en un profesional útil no solo a si mismo, sino también a las demás personas.  
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de una notebook que le será muy útil en sus trabajos de la universidad. Agradece por esta oportunidad que tiene.
texts.en:
Marlene is single, and lives with her parents in the city of Curuguaty. She studies, and is in the second year of her degree in commercial engineering. She is fighting to become a professional who is of use not only to herself, but to others too.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in buying an electronic notebook, which will be very useful for her university work. She is grateful for this opportunity she has been given.

loans.use: to buy an electronic notebook.

loans.name: Dakan Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Dakan vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Angoulême de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, de bois et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  16eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata  (la 2eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiment de tout genre à Ségou chez les maraîchers. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Fatoumata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 50 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five members of the Dakan Group all live in nuclear families.  They are, on average, 43 years old and have seven children.  The women all live in the Angoulême district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through family, marriage, work and being neighbours.

This group all work in retail, selling food ingredients, wood and running restaurants.

In order to increase their working capital, the group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their sixteenth group loan.

Fatoumata (standing second from the right in the photo) sells food ingredients of many sorts in her neighbourhood and surrounding area.  She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of various foods in Ségou, from local producers.  She will then retail it for cash or on credit, from home and at the market, to both men and women.

Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA which will be used to provide for some of the expenses of her children, and also to increase her working capital.  She would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso in the future.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Maria Precy

texts.en:
Maria Precy is a hog raiser in her village. She earns income by selling the raised hogs to butchers. She had been in her business for four years. 

Maria Precy wants to increase her profits, so she is now asking for additional capital of PHP 4,000 to buy a piglet and its feed. She hopes to nourish it well so she can offer it at a higher price someday. She will save additional revenue for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy a piglet and its feed.

loans.name: Rathna

texts.en:
Rathna is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two dependent children who are currently in school. She lives in a small village in the province of Takeo, Cambodia. She is a pickled cabbage seller in a market of her community. Her husband, Thon, is a motorbike taxi driver. This couple can make a daily income of approximately USD 10.00.  

Rathna wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Uulzhan

texts.ru: Уулжан 42 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Уулжан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1995 году с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Уулжан на сегодняшний день имеет 1 нетель, 1 теленка, 5 овец и 5 коз. Также у Уулжан есть 0,8 ГА собственной земельной доли, на которой она выращивает картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулжан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и реализации. Уулжан является лидером группы "Айдин", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Всего их трое. Доходы от кредита Уулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность построить дом с сараем за селом.
texts.en: Uulzhan is 42 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education, and, to provide additional income for her family, Uulzhan is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started in 1995 with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today Uulzhan has 1 heifer, 1 calf, 5 sheep and 5 goats. She also has 0.8 hectares of owned land, where she grows potatoes. In order to further develop her business, Uulzhan requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy calves for fattening up and resale. Uulzhan is a leader for the "Aydin" group, which consists of two more people. There are three of them in the group. Uulzhan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business in order to have an ability to build a house with a barn outside the village.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Lilibeth has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a businesswoman from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, separated and has expertise in sales. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Norma is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now she is applying for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Norma continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She is a professional engineer and a surveyor. She and her husband have three children.

She wishes to avail herself of the various products and services of PMPC. Now, she is applying for a loan to pay for auto repair. Her plan after this loan is to change her auto unit into a new and additional one, in order to obtain long-lasting operation. This would lead to a higher quality of life for them, and for their children's future.

loans.use: To pay  for auto repair

loans.name: Here Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Hère vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village M’péba de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement et de produit cosmétique. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata (la 1ere  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  pagne wax et d’articles divers dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison à dans le marché une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Fatoumata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 25 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four members of the Hère Group all live in traditional families.  They are, on average, 33 years old and have two children.  The women all live in the village of M'péba in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through family, marriage, work and being neighbours.

This group all work in retail, selling clothing and cosmetic products.

In order to increase their working capital, the group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their second group loan.

Fatoumata (standing on the far left in the photo) sells wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) in her neighbourhood and surrounding area.  She plans to use her loan to buy 10 wax pagnes in Ségou.  She will then retail them for cash or on credit, from home and at the market, to both men and women.

Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA which will be used to provide for some of the expenses of her children, and also to increase her working capital.  She would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso in the future.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and other products for resale.

loans.name: Zyyagul

texts.ru: Зыягул 31 год, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. Зыягул имеет среднее образование, по характеру она спокойный и общительный человек. Зыягул, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, в 1996 году начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством, начав свой бизнес с покупки 15 овец. Зыягул приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 5 овец, 2 козы и 1 теленок. Также есть земельный надел мерою 1,80 ГА, где ежегодно Зыягул выращивает картофель, кукурузу и клевер. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зыягул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма с последующей реализацией. Зыягул является одним из 3 членов группы "Айдин". В будущем, Зыягул планирует и дальше расширять свою деятельность.
texts.en: Zyyagul is 31 years old, married and raising 2 children. Zyyagul has a secondary education and is a very calm and sociable person. In search of an additional source of income, she got involved in raising livestock and farming in 1996, having started her business with purchase of 15 sheep. Zyyagul put forth a lot of effort to develop her business, and today her business consists of 1 cow, 5 sheep, 2 goats and 1 calf. She also has 1.80 hectares of land, where she annually grows potatoes, corn and clover. In order to further develop her business, Zyyagul requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy calves for fattening up and subsequent resale. Zyyagul is one of the three members of the "Aydin" group. In the future, Zyyagul plans to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening up and subsequent resale in order to grow her business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora has mastered her hog raising business in Mamanga Daku, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail of credit to fully support her business. 

In the same way she takes care of her hog raising business, she is conscientious with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always access credit for any financing needs. This loan of PHP 10,000 will help her build concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and help her care for the environment.

loans.use: to build concrete pig pens

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнуре 43 года, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Айнура с 1996 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Айнуры на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы и 20 овец. Также есть 1,50 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Айнура является одним их трех членов группы "Айдин". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и хочет сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Ainura is 43 years old, married and raising 2 children. To provide the primary income for her family, Ainura has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1996, having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Today Ainura's business consists of  4 cows and 20 sheep. She also has 1.50 hectares of owned land, where she grows potatoes and corn. In order to further develop her business, Ainura requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock. Ainura is one of the three members of the "Aydin" group. Ainura plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and wants to make repairs at home.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to grow her business

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en:
Marvie is 32 years old and still single. She has been selling fruits and vegetables in her village for almost eight years. She earns a net income of PHP 3,750 weekly. Marvie uses her motorcycle in her business as she roams to sell around her village and other villages from time to time. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes that her business will continue to become more productive and more improved.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sabali vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Médine de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  9eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mariam (la  femme assise dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mariam espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four members of the Sabali Group all live in nuclear families.  They are, on average, 44 years old and have three children.  The women all live in the Médine district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through family, marriage, work and being neighbours.

This group all work in retail, selling clothing and grains.

In order to increase their working capital, the group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their ninth group loan.

Mariam (sitting in the photo) sells wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) in her neighbourhood and surrounding area.  She plans to use her loan to buy eight wax pagnes in Ségou.  She will then retail them for cash or on credit, from home and at the market, to both men and women.

Mariam hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA which will be used to provide for some of the expenses of her children, and also to increase her working capital.  She would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso in the future.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
Jerson lives in Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur with his family. His parent is earning income from serving as a government employee. He has two siblings, and he is studying in the university. He wants find a stable job in the future. He is taking deck watchkeeping. 

Jerson joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative and borrowed a loan to pay his school tuition fees for the first semester. In the future, he wants to finish his studies and to work for a better future.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees

loans.name: Purreh

texts.en:
Purreh is 59 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and had dependents; they are now at their adult age.

For her source of living, Purreh has been engaged for 15 years in managing an eatery and selling suman [a Filipino food, typically made of glutinous rice and coconut milk]. In addition, she receives income in the form of a pension. She is also operating a “sampan” for sand and gravel quarrying activity. She earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month, through all these sources.

Purreh has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase supplies for sampan repair, including marine plyboards, marine epoxy and paints. The remaining amount of her loan is for additional capitalization for her eatery business.

Purreh has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Purreh hopes to expand her eatery business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for sampan repair, including marine plyboards, marine epoxy and paints.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Lorena is 37 years old and her child is in school.

Ma. Lorena has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Lorena requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock like canned goods, sanitary pads, toothpaste, candy and soft drinks to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Ma. Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, sanitary pads, toothpaste, candy and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Pedro Jesus

texts.es:
Un sol radiante, montañas y vacas con buena salud, son los que a diario le brindan los buenos días a don Pedro, un señor amable y trabajador de 59 años. Está muy agradecido con el financiamiento de kiva a través de MiCrédito, ya que gracias a este logró mejorar los cercos del potrero, brindándole más seguridad a su ganado y al mismo tiempo logró comprar el alimento de estos, lo que los mantuvo en buen estado físico. De esta manera logró incrementar la producción de su capital. 
Su familia ha sido un pilar importante en su desarrollo económico puesto que todos colaboran para mejorar las condiciones de vida y junto puedan progresar. Solicita un segundo crédito para comprar alimentos para el ganado, así como pasto y así puedan sobrevivir la falta de agua que afecta a la comunidad. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que anhela que sus vacas sigan produciendo leche con éxito, de la cual obtiene cuajadas y comercializa en el mercado. Gracias a este negocio logra cubrir los gastos del hogar. Entre sus planes futuros esta hacer crecer su negocio, comprar más vacas y ampliar sus tierras, asegura que trabajará hasta lograrlo.
texts.en:
Every morning, glorious sunshine, mountains and healthy cows greet Don Pedro, a kind, hard-working man aged 59. He is very grateful for the Kiva loan he received through MiCrédito, as thanks to this, he was able to make improvements to the fences of his pastures, making his cattle safer and buying feed for them, which kept them in good physical condition. In this way, he managed to increase production of his capital.

His family has been an important pillar in his financial development, since everyone works together to improve living conditions, and together, they are able to move forwards. 

He is requesting another loan to buy cattle feed and grass, so that his livestock can survive the drought affecting the community.He is placing his trust in the loan, as he wants his cows to continue producing milk, from which he makes curd which he sells at market. Thanks to this business, he is able to pay household expenses. 

His future plans include expanding his business, buying more cows and increasing his land, and he says that he will work until he achieves this.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock and grass.

loans.name: Adalathan

texts.ru: Адалатхан 64 года, замужем. У Адалатхан высшее образование и большой трудовой стаж. Сейчас на пенсии, однако более 14 лет она занимается дополнительным заработком в виде животноводства и полеводства. Благодаря упорному труду Адалатхан на сегодняшний день у нее есть 15 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет всего около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Адалатхан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку племенного скота. Доходы от кредита Адалатхан планирует направить на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, а также на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Adalathan is 64 years old and married. Adalathan has a higher education and an extensive work experience. She is currently retired, however, has been involved in a supplemental income generating activity of animal husbandry and farming. Thanks to Adalathan's hard work, today she has 15 sheep. The monthly profit amounts to about 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Adalathan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy purebred livestock. Adalathan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business and also building a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy purebred livestock in order to grow her business and build a barn for livestock

loans.name: Maryana

texts.ru:
Маряна замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет свой бизнес. 

Маряна имеет большой участок земли и две теплицы. Она выращивает цветы в горшках. В бизнесе задействована ее семья. Также Маряна торгует детской одеждой на рынке, чтобы получать дополнительный доход. Во время сезона работы в теплицах, на рынке торгует продавец. 

Маряна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 40000 гривен на закупку семян и дров. Со временем Марьяна по-прежнему планирует построить дома еще одну дополнительную теплицу для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Maryana is married with two children. She runs her own business with the help of her family. She has a large piece of land and two greenhouses where she grows flowers in pots. She also has a side business selling children's clothing at the market for additional income. During the busy season at the greenhouses, she hires a salesperson for the market.

Maryana is requesting a loan of 40,000 griven to purchase seeds and firewood. In time, as before, she plans to build one more greenhouse on her property to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and firewood for her greenhouses

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es un hombre de 53 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la pesca en bote.
Él es emprendedor, decidido, constante, luchador, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Queguaya’, dicha comunidad es    poseedora de un tesoro cultural ancestral que aún se mantiene vivo en su cosmovisión, tradiciones y rituales; un tesoro arqueológico invaluable y una riqueza natural que fusiona la belleza e inmensidad del  Lago Titicaca con la majestuosidad de la Cordillera Real de los Andes.
Lorenzo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el aymara y también habla español. Su labor diaria es la pesca en bote con red, y también se dedica a la repoblación de las especies del lago; una vez que atrapa a los peces, lo que hace es hallar a los reproductores (macho y hembra), y los separa del resto para poder sacar de forma artificial los huevos y espermas de su interior, esta es una labor que realizan algunos pobladores para continuar teniendo pesca el resto del año.
Su necesidad de realizar la compra de redes y renovar su bote lo ha llevado a solicitar un préstamo para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es por esos motivos que Lorenzo solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca y renovar su bote.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a 53-year-old fisherman. He is single and has no children.

He is entrepreneurial, determined, persevering, tenacious, responsible and hard-working. He works in the Queguaya community, which possesses an ancient cultural wealth that remains alive in its world view, traditions and rituals. The community also possesses an invaluable archaeological wealth and natural treasures that combine the beauty and vastness of lake Titicaca with the majesty of the Andes mountain range. 

Lorenzo has olive skin and short black hair. His mother tongue is Aymara and he also speaks Spanish. His daily occupation is net fishing on a boat. He also works to repopulate the lake's fish species. Once he traps the fish, he finds the breeding males and females and separates them from the rest to artificially take out their eggs and sperm. This is a task that many of the locals carry out to be able to fish for the rest of the year.

The need to buy new fishing nets and renovate his boat has led him to request a loan to improve his income and quality of life. This is why Lorenzo is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and renovate his boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and to renovate his boat.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 48 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with five children now at their adult, school, and infant ages. 

Lucita has been engaged in a fish-vending business for ten years already to support her husband as a fisherman. The family earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repairs.

Lucita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for nine years. In the future, she hopes to expand her fish-vending business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repairs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida has mastered her hog raising business in Aloran. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to receive credit to fully support her business. 

In the same way she takes care her hog raising business, she is conscientious with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always access credit for any financing needs. Now she has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase two additional piglets. She hopes that God will bless her business for the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase an additional two piglets

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Aurelio is from Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is very responsible with his household obligations, and he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and three children. 

Aurelio is a farmer who plants vegetables. He wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina es una mujer de 35 años, de estado civil casada y madre de dos hijos ne las edades de 6 y 10 años. Para no dejar a sus pequeños hijos solos o al cuidado de extraños, decidió incursionar en la venta de mercancías para generar ingresos independientes. Los principales productos de su oferta son las cremas, champú, colonias, directamente a su clientela conformada por familiares amigos y referidos de estos. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado, y para responder a su clientela debe reunir los recursos de crédito, para satisfacer la demanda. Su meta es ampliar su grupo de vendedores, para finalmente tener su propia casa y brindarle un mayor bienestar a su familia.Su mayor desafío es justamente trabajar de manera independiente pues exige una disciplina y un orden para poder sostenerse y ganar dinero. En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidkiva, mediante el cual comprará cremas, y en general productos de belleza. Con ello su negocio mejorará pues aumentará su capital de trabajo, teniendo un fondo de efectivo para reinvertir y generar mas utilidades.
texts.en: Karina is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and has two children (ages 6 and 10). In order not to leave her children alone or with strangers, she decided to start selling merchandise to generate her own income. The main products she offers are creams, shampoo and cologne. She sells directly to her clientele, which is composed of relatives, friends and their referrals. She sells on credit and cash to satisfy her customers' needs. Her goal is to expand her group of salespeople to be able to finally have her own home and provide a better life to her family. Her largest challenge is precisely working independently, as it requires discipline and order to be able to maintain her business and earn money. She is currently applying for a Kiva credit, through which she will buy creams and beauty products in general. This will allow her business to improve, as it will increase her working capital and will allow her to reinvest money and generate higher profits.

loans.use: to buy creams and beauty products in general.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Huilda Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Huilda Francisca  se dedica al negocio de venta de pollipapas que es un plato a base de pollo con papas,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pollipapas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y papas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Huilda Francisca earns a living selling "pollipapas," a dish made of chicken and potatoes.  She wants to get ahead with this business.  Her dream is to expand her business selling "pollipapas" [chickens and potatoes].

She's requesting the loan to buy chickens and potatoes.

Huilda Francisca's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens and potatoes

loans.name: Laguna Las Garzas Group

texts.en:
Santa Cruz del Quiché is a bustling town in Southern Guatemala. In a quiet neighborhood of the town, seven women have come together to create a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Laguna Las Garzas” or lagoon of the heron. They are all Maya Kiché and show off their cultural pride with beautiful traditional costume in bright colors and patterns. 

Lucia is the president of the Trust Bank. She is married and has one child who is 15 years old. After attending school for three years thanks to family contributions, she was forced to discontinue her education and began to work. Therefore, she is very pleased that her son is currently in school and will have more opportunities than she had. Lucia runs a restaurant, which she has owned for 13 years. She serves the residents of Quiché as well as several customers from outside of the town. She employs one young lady who assists her in the restaurant. This very motivated woman would like to broaden her clientele. With the loan, Lucia plans to expand her business, publicizing her restaurant to attract people from other towns in the region as well as possibly hiring additional employees. 

Lucia and all the women of the Trust Bank “Laguna Las Garzas” greatly appreciate the kindness of Kiva investors in funding their loans. They are very driven women who are determined to work hard and pay back the loans. They thank Kiva's investors generosity!

As the ladies average two years of formal schooling, the education that they receive along with the loans as part of the “Microcredit Plus” program is highly valued.

loans.use: To hire additional employees and increase publicity for her restuarant

loans.name: Richardlita

texts.en:
Richardlita is a proud student taking Basic Seaman courses in the university. She has eight siblings living with her family. Her family is earning a living by cultivating their farm. She joined GDMPC in order to gain access to micro finance services of the cooperative. 

Richardlita took a new loan to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. She wants to become a successful woman in the future who would be able to support her family.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a television for her home.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock for her business.

Merlie has been in this business for eight years. Merlie earns more income from farming sugarcane.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Merlie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Jose Dionisio

texts.es:
José, se dedica a cultivar maíz y pipián, hace cinco años trabaja de manera independiente, su jornada de trabajo inicia a las cinco de la mañana y finalizan a las tres de la tarde, el producto lo distribuye a vendedores en el mercado, heredo esta actividad de sus padres y con su experiencia ha sabido mantener su negocio funcionado. Don José vive en casa de sus padres con su compañera de vida y un hijo de 6 años de edad.
Utilizará el capital para comprar 90 libras de maíz, 4 sacos de abono, herbicidas e insecticidas, estos insumos le ayudaran a proteger y dar un mejor desarrollo a sus cultivos, fortalecerá el negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y cumplir con el pago de su deuda.
Los sueños de José son comprar equipo de trabajo para le época de verano, para mantener la estabilidad del negocio y asegurar su crecimiento económico, sobre todo mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
José grows corn and pipián, and he's worked independently for five years. His work days starts at five in the morning and goes until three in the afternoon. He distributes his product to vendors in the market. He inherited this work for his parents, and with his experience he's learned to keep his business running. José lives in his parents' house with his life partner and his six-year-old son. 

He's use the money to buy 90 pounds of corn, 4 bags of ferilizer, herbicides and insecticides, which will all help him to protect and develop his crop. It will strengthen his business so he will earn a better income and pay off his debt.

José's dreams are to pay for a team of workers for the summer to stabilize the business and secure financial growth. More than anything he wants to improve his family's circumstances.

loans.use: to buy 90 pounds of corn, 4 bags of fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides, which will all help him to protect and develop his crop

loans.name: Nhis Group

texts.en:
Nhis is 58 years old, a farmer and a married woman with three children. She has been a farmer since 1988. Her husband, 58, is also a farmer. Two of her children are workers and another is a student. They all live in Tbong Khmum Province of Cambodia. Together, they can make approximately $17 a day. 

Now Nhis would like to request a loan as a member of a group of four; she will use her portion to buy foundation parts for a latrine. This loan will provide her and her family a hygienic lifestyle. In the future, she is going buy more farmland, build a new house, and support her child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy foundation parts for a latrine

loans.name: Ana Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia  Ana Graciela tiene 37 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ventas de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de naranjas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This bank member belongs to the COMUZONE Communal Bank.  Ana Graciela is 37 years old, has two children, and is married.  She alternates her daily chores with her fruit-selling business.  She has had her business for a good while and it is going well for her because of the effort she puts into her business every day.  

She is requesting this loan to buy oranges, among other fruits. 

She is thankful for the loan she has been offered and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy oranges, among other fruits

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky finds pleasure in doing his gardening activities. Not only that he is doing his hobby, he earns an income as well. At the age of 38 and married, he busies himself to sufficiently provide for the family. He grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. He credits to the cooperative his capital in supporting his gardening activities. 

Recently, Ricky applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Ricky wishes to become a supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

texts.es: Bocachico abierto y picado, camarones y productos del mar y mercancía variada como cosméticos perfumería etc, fue en lo que invirtió Juana cuando recibió su credikiva anterior; con el cual logró mayor capital de trabajo, liquidez, aumento de las ventas y utilidades del negocio, con los cuales ha logrado mas ingresos familiares. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará pescado, variedades nuevamente para responder a su clientela nueva,  que lo ha solicitado pues su demanda se ha incrementado especialmente en el último trimestre del año y requiere un fondo de efectivo, para financiar sus cuentas por cobrar. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: "Estoy muy contenta con este apoyo, gracias a ustedes he progresado,mucho sigan apoyándome."
texts.en:
When Juan received her previous loan from Kiva, she invested in filleted and chopped "Bocachico" fish, shrimps and seafood, as well as various goods such as cosmetics and perfume. As a result, she increased her working capital, liquidity, sales and business profits, with which she has increased the household income.

She is currently applying for another Kiva loan, with which she will buy fish and other items for her new customers who have asked for them, as demand for her products has increased, especially during the last quarter of the year. She needs a cash pool, to fund her accounts receivable. 

She says to her Kiva lenders "I am so pleased about this support, thanks to you I have made a lot of progress. Please continue to support me."

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
El socio Ivan   pertenece al banco comunal SAN ANTONIO, él socio tiene 46 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casado, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una empresa privada, él socio lleva buen tiempo trabajando para esta empresa el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio Ivan requiere el préstamo para la compra de víveres y para la compra de un electrodomestico.
  El socio Luis pertenece al banco comunal “San Antonio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco
texts.en: Ivan, 46, belongs to the San Antonio village bank. He is married and has 2 children. He has worked for a private business for some years and it's going well thanks to his daily dedication to her job. He wants to continue this work so that he can continue to support his family. Ivan requires a loan to buy grocery products and other things. He is part of the village bank San Antonio with the Arariwa Association in Cusco.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff and an electrical appliance

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is studying Hotel and Restaurant Management in the university. He wants to become successful in life. Peter will do his best in order to have a better future. 

He joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and borrowed a loan to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester. 

In the future, Peter wants to be a professional chef that brings a name that his parents will be proud of.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está estudiando la carrera de criminalista. A través de su carrera quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas y sentirse útil con la sociedad.
Está esforzándose bastante para cumplir su meta de ser alguien en la vida. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Francisco is from the city of Coronel Oveido. He is studying for a degree in Criminology. With this degree, he wants to help other people and feel useful in society.

Francisco is striving forward to reach his goal so that he can become somebody in life. He is requesting this loan so that he can pay the fees for his degree. Francisco is grateful for the opportunity he has received so that he can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay the fees for his degree.

loans.name: Napok Group

texts.en:
Khamfan's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Khamfan is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, foraging for wood, and/or purchasing bottled water. 

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3 to 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is an experienced agronomist from Goghovit village in Shirak region. She lives with her husband, two sons, and retired father-in-law. Lusine's elder son is an army officer and her husband works in the village municipality. To be able to meet the needs of the family, Lusine is engaged in cattle breeding and in the cultivation of potatoes, wheat and grass. With the help of her second son, she sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

Farming is a very important source of income for the family. Lusine currently needs to make some investments in her agricultural business in order for it to function in a more efficient way. A loan of USD 3000 will greatly support her business, enabling her to purchase two more calves and forage for feeding the livestock. Lusine and her family will highly appreciate the goodwill of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for helping her collect the needed loan to sustain their agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Hadnangkom Group

texts.en:
Den's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Den, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.  

Den is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Den due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing  the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so as to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a youthful 54-year-old shosho (old mum). She is a wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in Kapsowar, in the northern Rift Valley region of Kenya. This mother of two has been practicing mixed farming for the past two years; her primary sources of income have been milk and some vegetables she plants. Lucia enjoys the returns she gets, but she is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. She has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by acquiring a good quality dairy cow. 

Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture, and milk prices in the recent past have been going up. So Lucia, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market, and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms. 

Lucia said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan request because they offer agriculture-based loans, and their interest rate is low and on a reduced scale. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. Lucia hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. 

This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Ana de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad, un nieto de 5 años y el yerno. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza por apoyar la economía de su hogar con su pequeño negocio de elaboración y remiendo de prendas de vestir, la cual realiza desde hace 25 años en su vivienda, su esposo aporta a la economía gracias a su trabajo de supervisor. Ana está realizando mejoras en su vivienda, anteriormente obtuvo un crédito con FUSAI el cual invirtió en la construcción  de un cuarto en su propiedad, actualmente solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, clavos, grava, cemento, arena y polines para construir un corredor con techo y piso en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old and resides in her own home along with her husband, her two children (ages 18 and 16), a five-year-old grandson, and a son-in-law. She is a woman who has strived to help with the household finances by operating her business of making and mending clothes. Ana has been running her business for 25 years from her home. Her husband contributes to the finances thanks to his job as a supervisor.

Ana is making improvements to her home. She previously obtained a loan from FUSAI and the money was invested in the construction of a room on her property. Ana is currently requesting a new loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in metal sheets, wood, nails, gravel, cement, sand, and planks in order to build a corridor with a roof and floor within her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a corridor with a roof and floor within her home.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 52 years old and widowed with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlinda has been in pig fattening for 30 years and also earns additional income from fruit and vegetables vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es madre de 7 hijos en las edades de 12 a 25 años;ella aprovechando que su hijo mayor terminó una carrera técnica en sistemas inició junto a él un negocio , mediante el cual ofrece servicios de Internet y adicionó posteriormente venta de mercancía variada, aprovechando el mercado domestico construido con la primera actividad; esto fue hace 4 años y aun continua sosteniendo su emprendimiento trabajando todos los días de la semana desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Los vecinos del sector son sus principales clientes y por ellos quiere ubicarse en un local mucho mas comercial para atenderlos con mayor calidad, esta es una de sus metas, así como también apoyar la educación profesional de sus otros hijos. En la actualidad son muchas las personas que la visitan para recibir el servicio y ella no tiene la capacidad suficiente para atenderlos de inmediato, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 3 computadores y una impresora para ofrecer un servicio mas diverso, con lo cual mejorará su negocio con una mayor productividad y rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Doris has seven children aged between 12 and 25. Seizing the opportunity represented by her eldest child finishing a technical course on systems, she set up a business with him, through which she offers internet services, and later added the sale of various goods, taking advantage of the domestic market created by the first business. 

That was four years ago, and she continues to run her venture, working every day of the week from 8am to 8pm. Her main customers are her neighbours living in the area, and she wants to move to a much more commercial premises so that she can offer them a better service. That is one of her goals, along with her desire to support the professional education of her other children. 

Today, a lot of people visit her for her services and she doesn't have enough space to attend to them immediately. This is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first funding she is requesting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy three computers and a printer to offer a more diverse service, with which she will improve her business with increased productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy three computers and a printer.

loans.name: Nahun Group

texts.en:
Boun's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Boun, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. 

Boun is excited that she, like her group member, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Boun, due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing  the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Xiengvangthong Group

texts.en:
Buathong's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Buathong, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.

Buathong is excited that she and her group members were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Buathong due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water.

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 36 years old and married with two children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lilibeth has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load (pre-paid mobile phone credits) retailing.  Lilibeth aspires to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise especially for the end of the year.

loans.name: Dongkung Group

texts.en:
Lam's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Lam, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Lam is excited that he and his group members were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Lam due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water.

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items and add several RTW clothes to sell in her store. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Rebecca aims to grow her business so she could give her children the best education possible. She desires to lead a happy and quiet life with her family.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready-to-wear clothes and some grocery items to sell

loans.name: Melissa Grace

texts.en:
Due to capital insufficiency, Melissa Grace wants to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders to improve her small retail store. She is 23 years old and is blessed with two children. She wants to make her business profitable to generate sufficient income and sustain the necessities of her family.

Melissa Grace is in need of PHP 7,000.00 to buy more stocks of bakery breads, soft drinks, candies, noodles, canned goods, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and frozen foods to resell. She is hoping that by availing herself of the requested amount, she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bakery breads, soft drinks, candies, noodles, canned goods, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and frozen foods to resell

loans.name: Al- Reyada Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called  Al- Reyada Al- Hodeidah. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.
 
The president of the group is Fozya. She is a 29-year-old married woman and the mother of 2 children. She works in selling ice cream in the streets. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family, but over time he became unable to look after his family. Fozya decided to help him in that responsibility and for this she decided to start her own business selling ice cream. This business is the sole source of income for the family.  Most of what she earns goes to the expenses of the family.

Fozya wants to expand her business more. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to buy ice cream materials such as flour, sugar, and tongs in order to make the ice cream and sell it in the streets and, in this way, she will increase her working capital and improve her business. Her reason for applying for this loan is lack of capital. She faces many challenges in her business, including increasing her client base, and she will use the profits to improve the quality of life for her family.

Fozya looks forward to expanding her business more in order to make a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy ice cream materials such as flour, sugar, and tongs in order to make ice cream and sell it in the streets

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 44 года, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. У Гульмиры среднее образование, с 2008 года она стала заниматься сельским хозяйством, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 15,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Гульмиры есть 2 дойные коровы и 15 овец, полученное молоко она реализует местным жителям, так как молоко экологически чистое и вкусное, оно пользуется большим спросом. Также у Гульмиры есть земельный надел мерою 0,50 ГА, где она выращивает арбузы, реализуя их оптовым покупателям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых коров и овец. Доходы от кредита позволят Гульмире сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en: Gulmira is 44 years old, married and raising 2 children. Gulmira has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture since 2008, starting with an initial capital of only 15,000 som (KGS). Today Gulmira's business consists of 2 dairy cows and 15 sheep. She sells milk to the local residents because ecologically clean and delicious milk is in high demand. Gulmira also has a 0.50 hectare land plot, where she grows watermelons that she then sells to wholesale buyers. In order to further develop her business, Gulmira requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy purebred cows and sheep. The earnings from the loan will allow Gulmira to make repairs at home.

loans.use: to buy purebred cows and sheep in order to grow her business and make repairs at home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks and inputs to decorate clothes.

loans.name: Yoleidys

texts.es: Cuando su cuñado quedó sin empleo y con la necesidad de generara ingresos no lo pensó dos veces y se fue a  trabajar en un negocio de venta de jugos de sábila, donde aprendió todo lo que hoy sabe. Yoledys cociente de la gran experiencia le propuso que iniciaran un negocio y para ello acudió a su padre quien había recibido una herencia y le prestó un millón de pesos colombianos, con los que construyó dos casetas en madera y empezó a solicitar sábila de Perú que tiene una gran calidad y poco a poco han ido organizandose . En la actualidad tiene dos casetas rodantes que se pasean por muchos barrios ofreciendo un producto natural y medicinal que cada vez muchas mas  personas consumen. Su meta es tener un local distribuidor y finalmente tener dinero para comprar su casa y brindarle una educación de calidad a sus hijas que hoy se encuentran en las edades de 3 años y menos de 1 de nacida. En la actualidad Yoledys está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará un cubetero para fabricar hielo, atendiendo a que en este momento debe gastar ocho mil pesos colombianos diariamente, para poder cubrir la mayoría de barrios. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará generando muchas mas ganancias que le permitirán invertir en mucho mas mejoramiento para su negocio.
texts.en: When her brother-in-law lost his job, and with the need to generate income, she didn't hesitate and started working in an aloe juice selling business where she learned everything she knows today. Yoledys, aware of the valuable experience, proposed that they start a business and for that reason she went to her father who had just received an inheritance. He loaned her a million Colombian pesos, which were used to construct two wooden stalls and she started ordering Peruvian aloe which is very high quality. Little by little they have established themselves. Currently she has two mobile stalls that travel through many neighborhoods selling a product that's natural and medicinal and is consumed by an increasingly large number of people. Her goal is to have a local distributor and eventually have money to buy her own home and provide a quality education to her daughters, a 3 year old and one who's not quite a year old. Currently Yoledys is applying for a credikiva, the first financing she's requested from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and she'll use it to buy an ice machine to make ice. Keeping in mind that at this time she needs to spend eight thousand colombian pesos daily to serve the majority of the neighborhoods. With this investment her business will generate lots more profit which will allow her to invest in many more upgrades for her business.

loans.use: To purchase an ice machine to make ice

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en una zona de alto riesgo, posee un negocio de venta de ropa desde hace 3 años, es madre sotera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y sus padres, con su trabajo logrado salir adelante, la joven esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor y asi poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: The young woman, whose picture has been blurred because she is 27 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has had a clothing sales business for three years, is a single mother, and lives in her own house with her three children and her parents.  With her work, she has managed to get ahead.  The young lady is requesting a loan to buy clothing for ladies and men wholesale and thus to continue with her sales in order to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothing for ladies and men wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
