El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de ganado, comprara una yunta de bueyes para engordarlos y para luego venderlos. Él planea en un futuro mejorar la condición de vida de su familia, ya que tendrá más ingresos en un futuro.
texts.en: José is 29 years old, and studied up until 6th grade. He has two children, and his wife makes a living selling bread in the community. He is a farmer and walks to work, working until noon; sometimes he works close to home, and sometimes he works far from his home. He also breeds and fattens cattle. He is requesting a loan to buy livestock; he will buy a couple of oxen to fatten and then sell. He plans on improving his family's living conditions, as he will have more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy a couple of oxen to fatten and then sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items such as luncheon meat, sugar, milk, sardines, water, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Fatmata. She is married, and has 3 children aged 20, 16 and 7 years old. 

In 1999 Fatmata established her food business selling items such as bouillon cubes, tomatoes, salt, onions, pepper, etc. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living, her monthly earnings and profit margin. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 789,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase more food stuff items such as onions, tomatoes, bouillon cubes and sugar for resale. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to educate her children up to university level and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase food products for her grocery business

loans.name: Chanthone

texts.en: Chanthone's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  The water from those natural sources in the area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking, without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Chanthone is excited that she was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne disease-causing organisms. Some people in the village, including Chanthone, are able to buy bottled water. But the water filter increases disposable income to users, by decreasing the amount of money they would otherwise have used to purchase bottled water. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Chanthone, due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal for boiling water, and it decreases the amount of time they must spend foraging for wood. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter, so her family can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Early Fredy

texts.es:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
El  socio Early continua trabajando para  una institución del estado, el socio lleva buen tiempo trabajando  para esta empresa el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio  es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de víveres y un electrodomestico para su casa.
El  socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Comuzone" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Early is still working for a state institution, which is going well thanks to the hard work he puts in every day. He is a responsible, persevering person, which is how he provides for his family.

He is applying for a loan to buy supplies and an electrical appliance for his house. He is grateful for the support which has been granted to him, and he promises to comply with his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuff and an a electrical appliance

loans.name: Bisan

texts.en:
Bisan is a 22-year-old single lady from Ramallah city. She works in a cosmetics store to help her family with their expenses and also to pay her university installments. Bisan is a student at a local university and she studies finance. She would like to earn her bachelor of arts degree and find a better job in the future. 
Bisan took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help her to improve herself and also her family's living conditions. 
Bisan appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Crizel

texts.en: Crizel wants to become a successful chef someday. She is studying hotel and restaurant management at the university. Her family settled in Labanga Zamboanga del Sur. Her parents earn income from their farm and she wants to help them uplift their standard of living. She works and studies hard to pursue her ambition. She borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to pay her school tuition fee for the semester. She is thankful to GDMPC for being a part of her journey.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fee for the semester

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Tavshut village of the Shirak region with her mother, brother and sister. Her father left the country as a migrant worker with the hope of sustaining the family financially. 

Anahit is a young farmer. With the help from her family, Anahit is engaged in breeding livestock including cows, sheep, calves, and hens. Anahit also is engaged in the cultivation of wheat and potatoes.
Livestock breeding is the main source of her family's income and is of great importance to them. As the family's needs are growing day by day, Anahit needs to expand her livestock to be able to make ends meet. A loan of (USD) $3,000 will greatly support this young lady and her family, enabling her to purchase forage for the livestock, to buy fertilizer and to hire workers for land cultivation. Anahit hopes to sustain and develop her agribusiness with the help of the loan. This is Anahit's first loan and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. 

The family relies on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock, for fertilizer and to hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор занимается выращиванием овощей на собственном участке в Водяном уже 35 лет. У него есть два участка земли, десять больших теплиц под отоплением, где выращивает, в основном, помидоры и огурцы. Дополнительно он занимается изготовлением отопительных котлов. В свое время Виктор жил с родителями, потом женился, взял участок по соседству, занимался там помидорами, построил дом и развил хозяйство. Один раз купил плохие семена и практически ничего не наторговал, потом посадил второй урожай и тоже было плохо — тогда первый раз обратился за дополнительной финансовой помощью. 
Сумма в 40 000 гривен нужна Виктору для того, чтобы закупить все необходимое к сезону, а именно пленку, уголь, семена. Со временем Виктор планирует также купить грузовое авто и возить продукцию в города самостоятельно. Он очень хозяйственный, трудолюбивый — имеет большое хозяйство, не останавливается, развивается.
texts.en:
Viktor has been involved in growing vegetables on his own land in Vodyanoye for 35 years already. He has two plots of land, ten large heated greenhouses, where he primarily grows tomatoes and cucumbers. Additionally, he is involved in making heating boilers. At one time. Viktor lived with his parents, then got married, got a neighboring plot of land, was involved in growing tomatoes, built a house and developed his business. Once, he purchased bad seeds and practically sold nothing, then planted another harvest, which was also bad. That was the first time when he requested additional financial help.

Viktor needs 40 000 hryvnia to purchase everything necessary for the season, specifically plastic, coal and seeds. With time, Viktor plans to also purchase a truck and deliver products to the city independently. He is very practical and hardworking - has a large business, but is not stopping and developing further.

loans.use: to buy plastic, coal and seeds for the new planting season

loans.name: Dilma

texts.es:
Dilma está estudiando para poder ser una buena criminalista, su meta es recibirse y trabajar en su profesión que eligió para dar a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida, ya que se merecen por el esfuerzo dedicado a él.
Ella es una persona muy dedicada y está luchando por ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Dilma is studying to become a great criminologist.  Her goal is to enter and work in her chosen profession so that she can give her parents a better quality of life because they deserve it due to everything that they dedicated to her.  She is a very dedicated person who is striving to be someone in life.  She is seeking this loan to be able to pay her college tuition and be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: pay her college tuition.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 40-year-old married father of two children and is a Palestinian refugee. He started eight years ago working as a taxi driver to cover the needs and expenses of his family.
Thaer is the sole earner of the family, and due to the poor social and living conditions of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, he is trying hard to improve the living conditions of his family.
Today, Thaer is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to make necessary repairs to his car, which is considered his family’s only source of income. He wants to make sure that the car will stay in a very good condition and provide him with a better income 
He hopes that one day in the future he can buy his own taxi plate, and save what he is paying for renting it from someone else to make his living as a taxi driver.

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to his car which is considered his family’s only source of income

loans.name: Luis  Benjamin

texts.es: Don luis de 48 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de arroz, vive en casa propia con su esposa, sus dos hijos y su suegra, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas insumos agrícolas como fórmula y sulfato para el cultivo y asi seguir con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis is 48 years old. He is a hardworking man who has worked for 30 years in agriculture, particularly rice growing. He lives in his own home with his wife, their two children and his mother-in-law. He is requesting a new loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and sulfate. This would allow him to continue with his crops and provide his family with a better quality of life, as this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and sulfate for his crops.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Sabougnouman vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 50 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village M’péba de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de la restauration, de  condiment et  de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  13eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djenebou  N°1 (la 1ere  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande restauratrice  dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 7 sacs de 10 sacs de riz et une grande quantité d’huile à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit dans le marché à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Djenebou   N°1   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 70 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Sabougnouman group  are all women living in traditional households. On the average, they are 50 years old, with three children. They all live in the village of M’péba in Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).

They know each other as neighbors, relatives by blood or marriage, or through their work in the viellage. They work as vendors selling cooked dishes, condiments, and grains. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are no on their 13th solidarity loan.

Mrs. Djenebou (First), the first person standing from left to right in the photo, is a well-known vendor of cooked dishes in her village and nearby areas. She plans to use her loan to buy [seven? ten?—unclear in the original—Translator’s Note] bags of rice and a large volume of vegetable oil in Ségou. She sells for cash and often on credit, at the marketplace, to a mixed clientele. Mrs. Djenebou (First) hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 70,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover some minor needs of her children and also to increase her working capital. She would like to keep collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy glass cases to display sweet bread loaves and improve her locale.

loans.name: Mesar

texts.en:
Mesar is a 32-years-old married man and a father of two children, ages 2 and 5. Mesar lives with his family in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. He is an educated man with a university education. A long time ago, Mesar purchased a piece of land and built a few rooms on that land. He sold most of his wife's jewelry to  purchase that land and build his own house on it. That cost him a lot of money because the expenses of the building were very high. Because of that, Mesar could build only a part of house and couldn't complete the rest of it. He strives to finish the rest of the house. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do that. Now, Mesar and his family live in a small and uncompleted house. The family can't afford this condition. As a result, Mesar is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials as cement, iron, and bricks to expand and complete the building of his house.

Mesar 's dream is building more than one floor and renovating them in order to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, iron, and bricks to expand and complete the building of his house.

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Hace 10 años se dedica al comercio con la venta de ropa usada para damas, caballeros y niños, vende blusas, pantalones, jeans, camisetas, short etc. esta venta la realiza de manera ambulante o por pedidos. Ha obtenido varios prestamos en la Institución, actualmente solicita otro por 7,000 Lempiras para comprar ropa variada como blusas, vestidos, pantalones, ropa de niño, camisetas, ropa de cama, etc. para aumentar su inventario y sus ventas. Su plan es crecer como empresaria y establecer bien su negocio para que sea el patrimonio de sus hijos.
texts.en: María is 56 years old and a single mother with two children. She lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. She has been selling used clothes for ten years. She provides women's, men's, and children's clothes, namely blouses, trousers, jeans, T-shirts, shorts, etc. She sells door-to-door or by order.  She has had several loans from the institution and is now asking for a new one of 7,000 lempiras in order to buy items of clothing such as blouses, dresses, trousers, children's clothes, T-shirts, sheets, etc. in order to have more stock and increase her sales. Her goal is to see her business grow and to strengthen it so that her children can inherit it.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rodolfo Jr.

texts.en:
Rodolfo lives in Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur with his family. In addition to  his fishing business, he raises chicks to make a living. 

Having repaid his previous loan, which he used to repair his fishing boat, Rodolfo has requested a new loan  to purchase livestock feed and other supplies to improve his chick-raising business. He is planning to construct a comfortable cage for expansion.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus familiares Mario es electricista y quiere un credito para la compra de herramientas de trabajo como alicates, tester, repuestos para colocar en sus posteriores trabajos Los padres de Mario no puede ayudarlo más que con darle un hogar, Mario no tiene a quien acudir, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Mario is single, has no children and lives with his parents in the city of La Paz, in a house made of bricks and mortar that belongs to their relatives. He is an electrician and needs a loan to buy tools for his trade, such as wire cutters, electrical testers, and spare parts he might need for future jobs. All Mario's parents can do for him is to give him a roof over his head. He has no one else to turn to, which is why he needs help in the form of this loan.

loans.use: to buy tools for his trade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase corn to continue making her tortillas.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 están en EEUU y no se encuentra viviendo con ella. El hijo que vive con ella se dedica a la agricultura. 

María se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de aves y de cerdos. El negocio lo aprendió por su mamá que desde pequeña le inculco a este oficio. Ella trabaja de 7:00 am hasta las 4:00 pm. 

Con el préstamo comprara aves y cerdos para criarlos y luego venderlos a un futuro. Ella planea que sus cerdos se desarrollen en buen estado y que en un futuro tenga más ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en: María is 60 years old and studied until the third form. She is a single mother who has three children, two of whom live in the USA and not with her. Her remaining son is a farmer. María raises poultry and pigs. She learned the trade at her mother's knee. She works from 7 am to 4 pm. With the loan, she intends to buy poultry and pigs in order to raise them and then resell them. She plans to take good care of the pigs so that she can get a good price for them and increase the income she derives from this activity in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy poultry and pigs to raise and resell.

loans.name: María Elida

texts.es:
La Señora María Elida, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, ella reside en una Comunidad del Municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
Vive con sus 4 hijos, su madre y un hermano. La actividad económica a que se dedica es a la venta de ropa usada, vende blusas, pantalones, short, camisas etc. 
Ella inicio su negocio con el apoyo de un familiar que le enviaba ropa usada desde Los Estados Unidos. Luego con las ganancias comenzó a comprar más ropa para la venta.
Doña Maria Elida ha solicitado otro prestamos a la institución por la cantidad de 8,000 Lempiras para comprar un fardo de ropa usada y continuar con su negocio, Se siente motivada a seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia, apoyar el estudio de sus hijos e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Elida is 38 years old. She is a single mother of 4 who lives in a community in the municipality of Tela, Atlantida. She lives with her 4 children, her mother and a brother. Her occupation is the sale of used clothes -- she sells blouses, pants, shorts, shirts, etc.

She started her business with the support of a relative that sent her used clothes from the United States. She later began to buy more clothes with her profits.

Maria Elida has requested other loans to the institution for an amount of 8,000 Honduran Lempiras to buy a bundle of used clothes and continue with her business. She feels motivated to continue working to support her family, provide an education to her children and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.es: Don Evangelista, está soltera, vive con su hijo, en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Su fuente de ingresos es el negocio de pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, café, pan, huevos, carnes, refrescos, churros etc. y también construyo unos apartamentos para alquiler donde recibe otros ingresos. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 15 años en su casa. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, antes vendía comidas y bebidas. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 30,000 lempiras, para invertirlo en surtir mas el negocio de pulpería con productos como granos básicos, carnes, refrescos, azúcar, harina, frijoles, maíz, productos de aseo y otros abarrotes. ya que por la construcción de sus apartamentos se descapitalizo.  Su plan en su futuro es construir mas apartamentos para vivir de esos ingresos.
texts.en:
Evangelista is single and lives with his son on the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. His source of income is a small store where he sells food products like rice, beans, corn, sugar, coffee, bread, eggs, meat, soft drinks, churros, etc. He has also built some apartments to rent so that he receives other revenue. He has had this business in his house for more than 15 years. He has always been in commerce, before this he sold meals and drinks.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 HNL to invest in stocking his store with with products like basic grains, meats, soft drinks, sugar, flour, beans, corn, cleaning products and other groceries. He used his capital to construct the apartments. His plan for the future is to build more apartments so he can live on this revenue.

loans.use: to stock his store with basic grains, meats, soft drinks, sugar, flour, beans, corn, cleaning products and other groceries.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia es madre de familia, esta estudiando para poder superarse y ser un ejemplo para sus hijos. Esta luchando bastante para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida.
Comenta que su marido también la ayuda para poder seguir su carrera, lo cual es de mucha ayuda para ella. Está estudiando profesorado en trabajo y tecnología.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esta manera podrá ir cubriendo el gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Nidia, a mother, is studying to improve her lot in life and set an example for her children. She is giving her all to better herself and become someone. She says that her husband is helping her in this move, which makes her feel supported. She is studying to become a Career and Technical Education teacher. She asks for this loan to pay for her university fees, which represent a sizeable expense.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Elba Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Elba, tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una colonia de el Municipio de Cofradía, Cortes, junto a un nieto. Doña Elba desde hace mas de 10 años tiene su propio negocio de pulpería. Con este negocio ella ha podido salir adelante. Vende productos de la canasta básica como harina, manteca, frijoles, harina de maíz, arroz, lácteos, embutidos, refrescos etc., y también productos de abarrotería, como papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, pañales desechables de niño, pasta dental, jabón, medicinas, condimentos etc. su negocio es rentable y por lo tanto ha logrado poco a poco mantenerlo estable, con los financiamientos que ha recibido de la Institución. Ahora solicita otro préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para invertir en comprar mas productos como granos básicos, pollo, lácteos, carnes, embutidos, verduras, etc. Con esta inversión espera mejorar aun más sus ventas y estar mejor económicamente para seguir siendo puntual pagando los prestamos a Odef. Su meta es trabajar mucho para llegar a convertir su pulperia en una bodega o mini súper y pueda vender por mayoreo.
texts.en:
Elba is 60 years old, widowed, and has two children.  She lives in a neighborhood in the city of Cofradía, Cortes with her grandson.  For the past ten years, she has had her own grocery store.  With this business, she has been able to get ahead.  She sells basic goods such as flour, lard, beans, corn flour, rice, dairy products, sausages, beverages, etc.  She also sells grocery store items such as toilet paper, sanitary pads, disposable diapers, toothpaste, soap, medicines, condiments, etc.  Her business is profitable and little by little she has been able to maintain its stability through the loans she has received from the institution.  

She is now seeking another loan fro 15,000 Lempiras to purchase more products like basic grains, chicken, dairy products, meats, sausages, vegetables, etc.  With this investment, she hopes to continue improving her sales and improve her financial situation in order to continue being timely with her loan repayments.  Her goal is to continue working hard in order to turn her convenience store into a supermarket and be able to sell in bulk.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, chicken, dairy products, meat, sausages, vegetables, etc. to stock her store and sell.

loans.name: Maynor Alexander

texts.es: Maynor, tiene 32 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene un hijo, reside en el Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Anteriormente trabajaba de motorista y hace dos años estableció una pulpería donde vende harina, arroz, manteca, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, pastas, jugos, pan, refrescos, etc. esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo con la institución y es por 12,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir de azúcar, harina, arroz, refrescos y otros abarrotes para mantener su negocio surtido. Su meta es crecer como comerciante y que su negocio sea grande para darle buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en: Maynor is 32 years old, single, and has a son. He lives in Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. He used to be a taxi driver but started his own grocery store two years ago, where he sells flour, rice, butter, broad beans, sweetcorn, sugar, pasta, juice, bread, drinks, etc. This is his sole source of income. He asks for his third loan from the institution, for a sum of 12,000 lempiras, in order to buy sugar, flour, rice, drinks, and other items to replenish his stock and keep his store going. His goal is to see his business grow in order to be able to pay for a good education for his son.

loans.use: to replenish his stock.

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
Eligio está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, está esforzándose por poder ser un abogado exitoso y que pueda ayudar a las demás personas.
Comenta que quiere ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su carrera y también a su familia. Es un hombre muy luchador y por sobre todo emprendedor.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de cuotas y compra de materiales.
texts.en:
Eligio is studying law and is working hard to become a successful lawyer who can help others.

He says that he wants to help his family and other people through his degree. He is a very hard-working and above all enterprising man. 

He is requesting this loan so that he can pay for his university fees and buy materials.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and materials.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 48 years old, married to Ann and blessed with three children aged 19, 16 and 13 years. 

Paul has been operating a carpentry shop where he makes various furniture, e.g. sofa sets, chairs and beds, for the last five years. He earns a monthly income of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 	
He has applied for his second loan of 50,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy timber, hammers, marking tools and squares for use in his carpentry shop.                                                                                         

Paul will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs and also to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to grow his business and open a bigger carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy timber, hammers, marking tools and squares.

loans.name: Las Vengadoras Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  6   mujeres  emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “LAS VENGADORAS”.  Dora    de 48  años de edad soltera  y sin  hijos, dora   tiene una pequeña bodega  hace unos  4  años. Dora  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender su productos (azúcar, café, leche, arroz etc.) . Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos y así   seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez dora   y  todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado    y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Dora  está parada se le distingue por su chompa de color  ploma es la tercera de la mano (pelo corto) derecha  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: A group made up of 6 enterprising women with a lot of creativity in business. That's how the members of the "Las Vengadoras" communal bank are. Dora, 48 years old and single with no children, has had a small grocery store for 4 years. Dora has come to foster loyalty in her customers, which has generated profits for her so that she can cover her household's expenses. In the future she would like to have her own premises where she could sell her products (sugar, coffee, milk, rice, etc). With the loan given, she will buy more products, and in this way continue to satisfy her customers' needs and move forward. At the same time, Dora and all the members are thankful to Kiva for the loan given and for the confidence that it has been giving them. Dora is standing and can be distinguished by her gray sweater. She is the third from the right (short hair). She takes her leave with the promise that she will achieve all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy products for her small grocery store

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 38-year-old man, married to Sarah, who generates additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four children.  

David has been operating a transportation business for a period of one year, earning himself an income of KES 25,000 at the end of every month.
 
David is now servicing his third loan, in the amount of KES 78,700, with VisionFund Kenya and he intends to use this amount to buy a new motorcycle. 

David plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children, buy land, and he hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 38-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are currently in school.  She has been raising pigs in the Philippines for four years now. 

Merlinda has received seven past loans from NWTF to sustain her business, and is now requesting a PHP 11000 loan to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: para comprar pan, mortadela, salchicha, mayonesa, yuca, aceite, repollo, etc. para elaborar los hoy dog y los enredos.

loans.name: Alejandro De Jesús

texts.es:
Alejandro de 22 años de edad es bachiller agrícola sabe todo lo relacionado a la agricultura, está acompañado  su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar tienen  en común  1 hijo que vive con ellos. Alejandro vive con su madre y hermanos.


Él se dedica a la agricultura, su padre le enseño desde pequeño la siembra de maíz, frijol, maicillo, ajonjolí, entre otros cultivos, y desde que tiene señora trabaja por aparte. La distancia de su trabajo está a 2 kilómetros de su casa que llega caminando y a veces en bicicleta, el horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar bloque, cemento, hierro, arena para construir su propia casa, ya que en casa donde está actualmente es de su mamá y desea vivir  aparte. El préstamo mejorara su calidad de vida, porque tendrá un mejor lugar para vivir, la necesidad a satisfacer será la de tener una vivienda digna para desarrollarse como familia.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando fuerte para sacar a delante a su familia,  para su negocio espera un día tener un puesto de venta donde pueda comercializar de mejor forma sus productos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 22 years old and works in agriculture. He knows everything related to farming. He has a wife, who makes a living as a housekeeper. They have one child who lives with them. Alejandro lives with his mother and siblings. He works in farming; his father taught him how to plant corn, beans, sorghum, sesame, and other crops, from an early age. Since he got married he works independently. He works 2 kilometers from his home, which he walks or sometimes bikes to. He works 6 hours a day. 

He is requesting a loan from CrediCampo to buy blocks, cement, iron, and sand, so that he can build his own home, as he now lives with his mother. The loan will improve his quality of life, because he will have a better place to live, and will have a decent home to raise his family in. His dreams are to continue to work hard to get his family ahead, and to one day own a stall where he can sell his crops.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, iron, and sand, so that he can build his own home, as he currently lives with his mother.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Vantha

texts.en:
Vantha, who is 30 years old, is an active rice farmer in a small community of Prey Veng Province. She has two little children. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a rice farming business on a small piece of farmland which is located near her house. So far, it is fourteen years for her of being a farmer. The net profit that she can make is around USD 7.00 per day.

Vantha wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV, and radio. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. 

She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is earning money from her transportation service-based business. To make a living, she has her employee who has operated her vehicle for over six years. She lets her employee transport customers and packages. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used to buy tires. 

Recently, Anastacia needed repairs for maintenance and she borrowed a new loan to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She saves little by little from a portion of her revenue for her future needs.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Ofelina

texts.es:
Ofelina de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado. Está casada su esposo se dedica al servicio de limpieza en una iglesia y también al servicio de transporte individual, tienen en común 4 hijos los cuales aún viven con ellos,  2 de ellos trabajan y 2 están estudiando. 


Ofelina desempeña los oficios domésticos del hogar y a la sastrería. Anteriormente tenía un puesto de venta de pupusas con el que le colaboraba a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y también apoyaba a sus hijos especialmente a los que están estudiando; pero por la falta de dinero ya no continuo con esa labor,  ahora desea volver a poner su puesto de venta de pupusas pues una persona muy conocida por  preparar muy buenas pupusas,  el negocio que desea reabrir  está a unos tres kilómetros de su casa  y su horario de trabajo es de 5 horas al día.


El préstamo que está solicitando,  es para comprar maíz, frijoles, quesillo, loroco, aceite, entre otros productos que le permitan iniciar su negocio y así volver a tener una actividad económica que le permita colaborar con los gastos del hogar. Además de eso ella comprara material para la sastrería pues también se dedica esa actividad, como hilos, zíperes, aguja.


Para su familia desea ver que se superen con esfuerzo y trabajo porque es la única manera  que sus hijos estudien y desea ayudarlos a que alcancen sus sueños.
texts.en:
43-year-old Ofelina studied up until the sixth grade. She is married. Her husband makes a living by cleaning a church and offering transportation services. Together they have four children who live with them, two of whom work and two of whom are studying.

Ofelina does the housework and is a seamstress. She previously had a stall selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas). With it, she helped her husband with the household expenses and supported her children, especially the ones who are studying; however, due to the lack of money she is no longer doing this work. She now wants to set up her pupusas stall again as she is known for making very good pupusas. The business that she wants to reopen is about three kilometers away from her house and she works for five hours a day.

The loan she is requesting is for purchasing corn, beans, quesillo (soft cheese), loroco (edible flowers), oil, and other products that will allow her to start her business and again have work that will allow her to contribute to paying for the household expenses. Besides this, she will buy materials for sewing, such as threads, zippers, and needles, as she also does that kind of work.

She would like to see her family better themselves with effort and work because it is the only way that her children can study and she wants to help them to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, quesillo (soft cheese), loroco (edible flowers), oil, and other products that will allow her to start her business. She will also buy threads, zippers, and needles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies to help tend for her coffee plants this season.

loans.name: Lamis

texts.en:
Lamis is a 33-year-old, married, mother of two children who became employed three years ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Since she has a limited monthly salary, with additional living expenses, Lamis is acquiring a Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's school fees. Educating her children is her main aim, and she works hard to provide them with the best.

This loan is very important to her for it will help her in providing better living conditions for her beloved kids and building better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro proviene de una Familia de recursos limitados, se desempeña como oficial de créditos en una financiera.
Su objetivo es graduarse con las mejores calificaciones y así aplicar sus conocimientos en el ámbito laboral. Está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y por medio de eso quiere poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad y poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Isidro comes from a low-income household and works as a loan officer for a financial institution. His goal is to graduate with the best marks he can in order to apply his knowledge to his work. He is studying Management, and his aim is to help his loved ones. He asks for a loan in order to pay for university fees and continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay for university feed.

loans.name: Romilaine

texts.en:
Romilaine has been helping her husband by working on their farm to make a living. It is their main source of income and she had repaid successfully her previous loan used for her farm. 

Her ability to manage their farm is now improving and she has recently taken a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase fertilizer. 

She wants to improve their farm as well as improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 41-year-old man married to Rosemary, who adds additional income to support their family, and they are blessed with six children. Benson has been a farmer for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 20,000 at the end of every month.

Benson is now servicing his fourth loan of KES 120,000 with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use this amount to buy seeds and fertilizer, and also to plough his land.

Benson plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to his children and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To plough his land and buy maize and bean seedlings.

loans.name: Josefina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Josefina de 46 años de edad,se dedica a la agricultura con su esposo, la actividad la aprendió de sus padres quienes desde muy pequeña le enseñaron pues fue la única forma en que pudo trabajar. Además de la agricultura también vende leche y queso en la misma comunidad donde vive. Para desempeñar su trabajo recorre diario un aproximado de 8 kilómetros al día para distribuir el producto y su horario de trabajo es 4 horas al día. 


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una vaquilla para mejorar el ingreso por la venta de lácteos, como leche y queso. 


Los sueños siguen siendo los mismos  como cuando estaba joven, los de salir adelante trabajando  y esforzándose,   para su familia sueña con que ellos aunque están aparte logran sus sueños y ayudarlos en lo que puedan.
texts.en:
Josefina, 46 years old, farms with her husband. She learned the work from her parents, who taught her from the time she was very young, since it was the only way she was able to work. In addition to farming, she also sells milk and cheese in the same community where she lives. In order to carry out her work, she travels approximately 8 kilometers per day to distribute the product, and her work schedule is 4 hours per day.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a heifer in order to improve the income from the sale of milk products such as milk and cheese.

The dreams remain the same as when she was young, to move ahead working and exerting herself. For her family she dreams that even though they are apart that they achieve their dreams and to help them as much as possible.

loans.use: to buy a heifer in order to improve the income from selling milk products such as milk and cheese

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica esta estudiando para poder ser una abogada exitosa, quiere ayudar a la sociedad y también a su familia por medio de su profesión. Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y así pudo cubrir ese gasto que tenia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene en su carrera.
texts.en: Jessica is studying to become a successful lawyer. She wants to help society and her family through her profession. She comments that with her last loan she was able to pay the tuition for her studies so she could cover that expenditure. She is requesting this loan to once again pay her university she that she can meet this expense for her studies.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Adolfo Alexander

texts.es:
Adolfo de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta el bachillerato, está casado y su pareja se dedica al comercio de venta de productos de belleza. Tiene 2 hijos de los cuales uno está estudiando. 

Adolfo es empleado desde hace 3 años de trabajar. Aparte de eso trabaja en mecánica. Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para reparar su motocicleta y comprara electrodomésticos. Desea que su motocicleta se encuentre en buen estado, le ayudara mucho ya que podrá comprar electrodomésticos y tendrá una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en: Adolfo is 29 and finished high school. He is married and his wife sells cosmetics. They have two children, one of whom goes to school. Adolfo has been an employee for three years. He is also a mechanic. He works Mondays to Fridays. He asks for a loan in order to repair his motorcycle and buy electrical appliances. With a working motorcycle, he will be able to buy electrical appliances and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and buy electrical appliances.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltero aun, él es agricultor en pequeño actualmente vive en casa de sus padres quienes se dedican a la sastrería. 

Miguel desempeña la agricultura y  la ganadería le gusta criar ganado para la extracción de leche y la elaboración de queso, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace unos seis años, ya que desea prepararse para el futuro y para cuando decida formar su familia, el trabajo está muy cerca de su casa lo que no le dificulta para llegar, en el trabajo se involucra un hermano quien le colabora y el horario de trabajo aproximado es de 8 horas al día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar comprara abonos, semillas, fertilizantes entre otros productos, para cultivar  ajonjolí. Esto vendrá a mejorar la productividad, porque sembrara un producto que le dará ganancia.

Los sueños son tener un negocio de venta de productos agrícolas, ya que  desea ayudar a las personas que no pueden sembrar por falta de dinero, para su familia desea apoyarlos para que ellos puedan lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Miguel, 22 years old, studied through ninth grade. He is still single, and he is a small-scale farmer. Currently he lives in his parents' house. They are tailors.

Miguel farms and ranches. He likes to raise cattle for the milk and to make cheese. He has been doing this work for six years, since he wants to prepare for the future and for when he decides to start his family. The work is very close to his house, so he has no trouble getting there. His brother is involved in the work and collaborates with him. The work schedule is approximately 8 hours per day.

The loan he is requesting is to buy manure, seeds, and fertilizer, among other products, to grow sesame. This will help him to improve productivity, because he will grow a product that will give him a profit.

His dreams are to have a business selling agricultural products, since he wants to help people who can't plant due to lack of money. For his family, he wants to support them so they can achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, and fertilizer, among other products, to grow sesame

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es estudiante de la carrera Administración de Empresas, estudia para salir adelante y así poder ayudar a su familia.
Su  meta es recibirse y ser una profesional destacada, su  aspiración es trabajar en empresas importantes y tratar de mejorar cada día más.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder cumplir con su sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Laura is a Business Administration student. She studies in order to move forward and to thus be able to help her family.

Her goal is to graduate and be an outstanding professional. Her aspiration is to work at important companies and to try to improve every day.

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to use it to pay university fees, so that she can achieve her dream of being a professional.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to make repairs and renovations to his house.

loans.name: Las Intocables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS INTOCABLES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paulina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de ajuares de bebe, venta de comida, tienda de abarrotes, librería, venta de edredones, servicios de construcción, venta de embutidos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paulina es integrante, ella indica que es un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió recientemente con el crédito que obtuvo en Pro Mujer. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el consultorio que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
las Intocables loan group will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II communal bank. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Paulina is the president. The businesses that the members run are varied and include weaving of baby clothes, selling food, a grocery store, a bookstore, selling quilts, construction services, and selling cold cuts. 

The loan they will take out will help small businesses in which Paulina is involved. She says that it has been a year that she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined because of an invitation from a friend who is a client in the institution. At present, she has a business selling food. She said that she learned this business recently with a loan that she got from Pro Mujer.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital by buying potatoes and rice wholesale. She will get the supplies from sellers in the city of La Paz, and after making the food, she will sell the food from a stand. This work allows her to earn resources to support her family financially, since she lives in a common law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings and advice the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and rice wholesale.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao, who is 54 years old, is a married man who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has two unmarried children. 

To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business on a small piece of farmland which is located near his house. On his farmland, he grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he has been involved in this career for fifteen years. 

Sao would like to apply for a Kiva loan via HKL, and he is going to use this loan to buy a motorbike. With the support from this loan, he hopes it can help to promote his living standard. 

He would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge proviene de una Familia de clase media, está cursando el 3er año de la carrera de contabilidad, y está trabajando como un auxiliar.
Su meta es llegar a ocupar un cargo de jefatura dentro de la entidad en la que trabaja utilizando como recursos lo aprendido en la carrera.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jorge comes from a middle class family. He is studying in his third year for a degree in Accounting. Jorge currently works as an assistant.

His goal is obtain a position of leadership at the organization where he works. This would enable him to utilize what he learned for his degree.

Jorge is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his fees. This would allow him to continue his studies as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Venah

texts.en:
Venah, 54, is a farmer in Chisamba, Zambia. Venah has been growing cabbage and fresh greens to sell to buyers at local markets in Zambia’s central region. She plans to get a water pump that will help her realize her goals of further expanding her farm.

Water pumps can be a major boost for rural farmers such as Venah, who often struggle to irrigate their crops using watering cans and buckets. A water pump allows farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they can cultivate. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. 

Because it is the dry season in Zambia, water needs to be applied to the crops regularly. A water pump would significantly reduce Venah’s need for labour and allow her to further expand her gardens.

Rent to Own will deliver a water pump directly to her farm. Rent to Own also provides Venah with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until she has paid off the loan.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, who is 55, single, and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is an independent and loving woman who supports her elderly parents.  She works hard to meet basic daily personal and household needs. 

Jocelyn has been in the fish-selling business for twenty years now. Coron is one of the many islands in the Philippines that has fresh and sweet fish. Local residents and tourists alike love to eat fish since Coron island is rich in marine life and offers the most delicious fish. She buys "dilis" (dried anchovies) and other kinds of fish at a local fish port every morning at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo.  Local residents and tourists alike are her regular customers.

She is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to buy more fish.  She is positive that her sales and income will increase.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given her. Her earnings from her fish selling will greatly help meet her family's living expenses.

Jocelyn hopes to grow her business to improve their quality of life and to give her parents a more comfortable life.   

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: To buy dilis (dried anchovies) and other fish as well as charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Conrad

texts.en:
Conrad is a farmer in Kapiri Mposhi, Zambia. In order to expand his vegetable production, he is requesting a water pump from Rent to Own.

Last season, Conrad grew onions, drawing water by hand from a nearby stream in order to irrigate them. This season, he has big plans to expand his production, and will need a water pump in order to keep up with the irrigation required during Zambia’s dry season.

Rent to Own will deliver a water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides Conrad with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off the loan.

With the water pump, Conrad is planning on growing tomato throughout the dry season, supplying the busy markets in Zambia’s central province.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to add to her herd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es maestra de nivel inicial y está estudiando ahora una profesionalización en enseñanza básica porque quiere ir mejorando para poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Ella es una mujer que quiere salir adelante, es por eso que se está esforzando mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa manera poder cumplir con su meta de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en: Maria is a kindergarten teacher, and is now studying to be an elementary school teacher, because she wants to improve and help her family and loved ones. She is a woman who wants to be successful, and is working hard to achieve that. She is requesting this loan to pay university fees, so she can fulfill her goal of becoming someone important.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Valle Hermoso De Ajllata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VALLE HERMOSO AJLLATA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Norah es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de abarrotes, venta de queso, venta de pollos por mayor, servicio de internet, costura de banderas, venta de fruta, venta de accesorios personales, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Norah es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tostados; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió de sus padres ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, hace ocho años decide implementar su negocio independientemente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de maíz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera pero vive con sus padres.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se observa que una de las clientes no se encuentra en la imagen esto es porque ella se encontraba en el consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The Valle Hermoso De Ajllata Group is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Norah is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as managing a grocery store, selling cheese, selling chickens wholesale, providing Internet service, making banners, selling fruit, selling personal accessories, and selling cosmetics.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Norah. She says this is her first year since joining Pro Mujer. Norah received an invitation during a mass promotion for the organization. She currently has a business of selling popcorn. Norah became familiar with this type of work because she was in a family business that was started by her parents. Eight years ago, she decided to start her own independent business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying corn in bulk. She acquires her supplies from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and then she prepares what she will sell at her vending post. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family financially. Norah is single, but lives with her parents.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Norah said that she enjoys the loans and the health services offered by the organization. The photo shows that one of the members is not present because she had a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy several quintals of corn and shipments of firewood in order to have materials available to continue her business.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, who is a 46-year-old woman, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has one unmarried child and two married children. To make a living and support her family, she have involved with a rice framing business on a small farmland since 1980. 

Because the earning that she can generate from her farming seems to be insufficient for household expenses; currently, she has come up with the new business idea. She wants to be a furniture seller. Now she is applying for KIVA loan, to buy wood and make as furniture to re-sell. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it will help to improve her living standards. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support towards poor people.

loans.use: to buy wood and  make as furniturer to re-sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos de 55 años de edad es una señora conocida por sus vecinos por ser una persona amable, honesta y de buenos modales. Es comerciante de productos varios y atiende con mucho gusto a sus clientes, su esposo falleció desde hace cinco años. Desde entonces ha enfrentado la vida sola y con el apoyo de sus hijos ha sobresalido de la irremediable perdida. 

Santos tiene experiencia en la actividad comercial, lleva 30 años dedicándose a dicho trabajo porque al estar su esposo vivo coordinaban el negocio para mantener abastecimientos de productos en su tienda, pero desde que él falleció ha mantenido el ritmo de trabajo. Además, tiene otra fuente de ingresos desde hace ocho años se dedica a hacer tortillas para venderlas en la zona donde vive y algunas veces las manda a vender al mercado de la Ciudad con su hija que tiene 20 años. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una plancha para la realización de tortillas, puesto que, quiere poner una tortillería más grande para abastecer la zona y obtener más ingresos diarios con los cuales pueda comprar alimentos para el diario vivir y comprar algunos productos que hagan falta en su tienda.


Con amplios deseos de superación la señora anhela poner la tortillería más fuerte y contratar con empleadas.
texts.en:
Santos, 55 years old, is a woman known by her neighbors as a kind, honest person with good manners. She sells a variety of products and waits on her customers with pleasure. Her husband died five years ago. Since then, she has faced life alone, and with the support of her children, she has risen above her irretrievable loss.

Santos has experience in business. She has done this work for 30 years because when her husband was alive they coordinated the business to maintain supplies of products in their store. Since he died, she has maintained the rhythm of work. Also, for 8 years she has had another source of income in making tortillas to sell in the area where she lives. Sometimes she sends them out for sale in the city market with her daughter, who is 20 years old.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a griddle to make tortillas, since she wants to put in a larger tortilla shop to supply the area and to obtain more daily income, with which she can buy food for daily living and other products that her store lacks.

With a great desire to overcome, she wants to make her tortilla shop stronger and hire employees.

loans.use: to buy a griddle to make tortillas, since she wants to open a larger tortilla shop to supply the area

loans.name: John

texts.en: This is John. As a small scale farmer, he has a challenge of providing adequate steady supply of feeds to his animals especially during the dry spells. With an experience of three years, he has learnt that with adequate quality feeds, his cows can improve milk production and maintain a steady supply. He dreams to be large scale dairy farmer who is a learning example for other farmers who lack the necessary skills that he possesses. A loan from Kiva will support John embark on his journey to success.

loans.use: to buy and store feeds for his dairy cows

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: This is Loise. She is married, and a mother of four children. She is actively involved in dairy farming which acts as the a source of income for her family. With seven years of experience, she believes that she has what it takes to move her dairy farming to a level where she can produce one hundred litres of milk per day. She is confident that with dairy farming, she will realize her dream of being a prominent dairy farmer with ability to raise her children and engage in development projects using returns from her dairy farming. Loise plans is to create a financial partnership with Kiva through borrowing and paying until a level when she will achieve her dream. A loan from Kiva will allow her make her first step to realizing her plans.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, the first born in a family of 6 children. She is in her final year of study and is having financial challenges to meet her schooling expenses. 

With a Kiva loan she will be able to finish school and one day achieve her dream of becoming a company secretary.

loans.use: To pay for School fees

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: This is Kevin. He undertakes farming in Kisumu county, Kenya, with his wife. He was introduced to farming by her parents who inculcated the discipline of hard work when he was in primary school. He is a producer of onions and tomatoes which he sells in Kisumu town, both in retail and wholesale. His dream is to grow his farming into a big scale farming, capable of employing many of the idle youths in his village. A loan from Kiva will enable him to make a big step towards his journey of a better life and employment for the youth in his village.

loans.use: to pay for inputs and labor for his tomato and onion crops

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
This is Lilian. She is a small scale farmer in Meru county, Kenya. She is involved in several on-farm activities including dairy keeping, fish farming, poultry keeping and horticulture. A mother of two, she has an ambition of offering best education to her two children for them to live a better quality life than she is living. 

A loan from Kiva will enable Lilian expand her horticulture farming where she will be contracted by Finlays, a French beans exporter, who will assure her market for her produce. With improved production and assured market, she will be confident to offer good education to her children to enable them compete favorably in life.

loans.use: to pay for cost of farm labor and buy inputs for her French beans farm

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.es:
Emanuel esta estudiando la carrera de diseño y comunicación, es una persona que quiere ser alguien en la vida, y es por ello que se esta esforzando mucho, para poder lograrlo. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir pagando sus estudios.
texts.en:
Emanuel is studying Communications and Design.  He is a person who wants to be somebody in this life, which is why he working so hard; he wants to make it happen.  Emanuel says that he used his previous loan to pay his university fees; it was a great help for him. 
Emanuel is asking for this loan to invest in paying the fees for his degree so that he can keep paying for his schooling.

loans.use: to make payments for college.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy actualmente se encuentra trabajando en su negocio propio, pero sabe que debe estudiar además del negocio que tiene, es por eso que esta haciendo el curso de enfermería para que el mismo le pueda ayudar a desarrollar y mejorar su vida para mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a las demás personas.
Daisy es una persona que lucha por progresar y mejorar en sus emprendimientos futuros. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su curso, y así poder estar cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Daisy is currently running her own business.  Her goal is to complete a nursing training program to improve her life conditions, income, and help others. 

Daisy is a determined person, and she is working on the improvements of her future endeavors.

She is requesting this loan to pay her course fees.  This way, she can be close to her goal.

loans.use: to pay for educational expenses.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Gilda has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is the source of their income.

Gilda is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, a boat engine, lead weights and others items. With this, her husband will be able to able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, a boat engine, lead weights and other items.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie settled for a living in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has been operating a retail store selling grocery goods in their village to make a living. In addition to this, she also has a rice farm and she is helping her husband by working on it. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan which was used for buying goods for sale. She is currently taking a loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products for resale

loans.name: Vadim

texts.ru:
Вадиму 43 года. Он из Приветного, где 17 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством. На своих 2.47 га он выращивает ранние и поздние овощи. Ранний урожай выращивает под пленкой и агроволокном. Еще берет в аренду 50 соток, планирует посадить помидоры, перец, цветную и качанную капусту, баклажаны и кабачки. Помидоры и капуста дают два урожая. Рассаду Вадим высаживает в грунт в марте и накрывает пленкой. В теплицах выращивает первый урожай, в мае-июне начинает собирать пленочный урожай и так до морозов. 
На 30 000 гривен, полученных от Кива, хочет приобрести к сезону удобрений и химии, пленки, семян, угля и дров, а также перестроить теплицу, чтобы постепенно ее расширять.
texts.en:
Vadim is 43 and lives in the town of Privetnoe, where he has been working in greenhouse farming for 17 years. He has 2.47 hectares of land where he grows both early and late season vegetables, the early harvest under plastic film and agricultural fabric. He also rents 50 sotkas (5,000 square metres) of land where he plans to plant tomatoes, peppers, cauliflower, cabbage, eggplant and zucchini. Tomatoes and cabbage give two harvests. He will plant the seedlings in the soil in March and cover them with plastic film. The first harvest is done in the greenhouses in May and June, and onward until the first frost in the fall.

With the 30,000 griven received from Kiva, Vadim wants to purchase fertilizers, plastic film, seeds, coal and firewood, as well as to build a greenhouse in order to gradually expand it.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic film and fertilizers, and build a greenhouse

loans.name: Sinet

texts.en: Sinet is a widowed woman with two children and she is a construction worker. She has been a worker since 2010. She has two daughters, one is a garment-factory worker and another is a construction worker. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $12 per day. Now Sinet would like to request a loan to buy cement and bricks to build a ground-floor room. This loan will help her finish her house building. In the future, she is going to run a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks to build a ground-floor room

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in more tools to expand her business.

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.es:
Wilfrida tiene 47 años de edad, está separada, y tiene hijos, comenta que es dueña de un copetín que con mucho sacrificio pudo montar y con lo que ayuda a su familia y cría a sus hijos.
Cabe mencionar que a parte de las ventas de comidas rápidas también posee ciertas ventas de productos de primera necesidad para su venta, en donde también le genera un buen ingreso.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su copetín, como comestibles, golosinas, bebidas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Wilfrida is 47 years old. She is separated and has children. She says she is the owner of a small food kiosk that she was able to open after sacrificing a lot. She helps her family with this, and she also raises her children. Besides the sale of fast food, she also sells basic need products, and that generates a good income

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies for her restaurant, such as food, candy, soft drinks and other things, so she can keep working as she's been doing it.

loans.use: to buy food, candy, and soft drinks among other things.

loans.name: Artan Group

texts.en:
Artan Group, which contains 4 female and 4 male members, have small businesses in Hargeisa City. The Group which supports a total of around 50 dependents has been in business for several years. 

Hibo (who has her hand raised in the group photo and is the group leader) is a bread winner and a mother of 3 children, She has a medium retail cafeteria in Hargeisa. The main products sold by Hibo's cafeteria include fast foods and drinks. The requested loan of $700 could bring her business to the upper ladder and improve the standard of living of her family members. 

Although each and every individual will take his/ her loans separately they are a group of 8 members.

Hibo requested $700 from Kaaba Microfinance Institutions for a loan to buy more general merchandise like sugar, flour, bottled water and soda drinks to sell.

loans.use: to expand her cafeteria.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 36-year-old woman married to Benjamin, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children. Teresa has been operating a clothing sales business and a beauty shop as a secondary business for a period of three years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Teresa was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 30,000 and intends to use this amount to buy shirts, blouses, dresses and blazers to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Teresa plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, dresses and blazers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 54, lives in Chibombo, Zambia. She is asking for a loan so that she can obtain an additional water pump to help her irrigate and expand her garden crops. Last season, Joyce managed to grow tomatoes, onions and fresh greens. This season, she has big plans to expand her production further, and will need an additional water pump in order to keep up with the irrigation required during Zambia’s dry season.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        

Vegetable gardening is an important business for many rural farmers in Chibombo District. Rent to Own will deliver a water pump directly to her farm. Rent to Own also provides Joyce with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until she has paid off the loan.                                                               

With the water pump, Joyce is planning on growing cabbage, onion and tomato throughout the dry season, supplying local markets in Chibombo.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products to resell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
To make a living, Maribel operates a retail business in their village while her husband works as seaman. She has run a retail store for many years and she earns additional income from this alongside from her husband's salary. 

Her previous loan used for the business was repaid successfully. To offer more to her customers, she took a new loan to purchase additional plastic and kitchen utensils for her store. 

She wants to expand her business in order to have a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastic and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 27-year-old woman married to Abdi, who adds additional income to support their family welfare. They are blessed with three children. Susan has been operating a retail shop for a period of eight years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Susan was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use this amount to buy tea leaves, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and detergent to add to her current stock, which is running out.

Susan plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and detergent.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
