She is Analou, 33, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Anthony, a delivery boy, and has one child who is still in preparatory school. She and her husband work hard for a better future for their child and to provide for their daily needs.

Analou has a small general store in their place. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Analou is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to buy sacks of rice, dozens of packs of oil and eggs, and beverages. She is positive that the more varied items she has in her store, the more attractive it will be and, in turn, it will yield more sales and income for her. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Analou hopes to grow her business, so she could send her child to college. She desires for her family to lead a happy and quiet life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Karenge Twizamure Cb Group

texts.en:
Groriose is the group leader and is aged 29. She is married with two children, aged 8 and 5 years. 2 of them go to school. 

The group is called Twizamure, which means “help each other” in English. They sell different products, and they believe to improve their businesses through the loan. 

She has a shop, and has been running her business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, rice, sugar, lotion, and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more salt, rice, sugar, lotion, and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Girubuzima Cb Group

texts.en:
"Girubuzima" is a group led by Chaste, who is 36 years old. The group name means “welfare” in English. Chaste has been a group leader for six years. She has a shop and has been in a retail business for six years. With this loan, Chaste would like to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil for sale.

The group members sell different items, and they have the same idea for changing their lives. The profits from their businesses will be used to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 51 years old and has five children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Anecita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Anecita has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Anecita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to raise and resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase wood to meet several new orders on time

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman sells dry goods in his store in Monrovia, Liberia. He has been in business for fifteen years. 

A Kiva loan helps him add ten improved charcoal stove to his inventory. After selling the stoves, he will repay his loan and use the profit to improve his business.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products to resell

loans.name: Tukamulane Group

texts.en:
Patuma is 40 years old and married to John, 46 years old. She has five children who go to school.  

Patuma owns a market stall selling Kaunjika (second hand clothes) She is applying for this loan to purchase more bales of second hand clothes to attract more customers in her village. 

Patuma started her business to improve her family living standards and to be self-reliant. Before she started her business she was a subsistence farmer and has been involved in this business for several years.

Patuma works from the market and, currently, has an employee who helps with the day-to-day business operations. She plans to expand her business and to employ another person for assistance when she generates enough profits. 

As a woman she is able to satisfy her family's basic needs and she believes that the training she received on 'Business Management' offered by Microloan Foundation will assist her in achieving what she wants from her business.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo es un hombre de 38 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Él es responsable, emprendedor, decidido y muy trabajador. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad de Batallas que se encuentra a una altitud promedio de 3900 metros sobre el nivel del mar, al sureste de Lago Titicaca.
Adolfo es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, su lengua materna es el aymara y también habla español. Su trabajo es la producción de queso artesanal, sus ingresos económicos varían de acuerdo a la cantidad de leche que produzca. Él desea mejorar su calidad de vida para ayudar a su familia, realizando la compra de ganado lechero, con esa inversión obtendría mayor cantidad de leche para la producción de queso.
Es por esos motivos que Adolfo solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero y con los beneficios ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a 38-year-old single man with no children. His business is the production of artisanal cheese.

Adolfo is responsible, resourceful, determined, and very hardworking. He does his work in the community of Batallas, which is situated at an average altitude of 3,900 meters above sea level, southeast of Lake Titicaca. He has a dark complexion and short black hair. His mother tongue is Aymara, and he also speaks Spanish. 

Adolfo's work is the production of artisanal cheese and his income varies according to the quantity of milk produced. He would like to improve his quality of life in order to help his family by making a purchase of dairy livestock. With that investment, he will obtain a larger quantity of milk for the production of cheese. 

This is why Adolfo is requesting a loan for the purchase of dairy livestock so that he can help his family with the profits.

loans.use: to buy dairy livestock, and to help his family with the profits.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo’s cleaning company, New Experience, has been in business since 2009. His idea of cracking the multi-billion dollar cleaning industry was developed in the Business Program at Pompano Beach Community College in Florida.   

“I did research on the field and was passionate about exploring the cleaning industry. Someone always needs something cleaned,” he says.

His home-based business specializes in post-construction cleaning, carpet cleaning, and pressure washing for private homes, condos and townhouses.    Lorenzo derives tremendous satisfaction from being independently employed, “bidding and winning my jobs and taking control of things.”

After five years in business, Lorenzo intends to expand New Experience’s services by upgrading his equipment. “I want to purchase a detail extractor cleaner that is big enough to take on some bigger jobs,” he says, adding that this will easily increase his monthly revenue. 

The loan Lorenzo is requesting will go toward purchasing the equipment he needs and ensuring that New Experience continues thriving.

loans.use: to purchase large-scale cleaning equipment.

loans.name: Ashley

texts.en:
When Ashley gave birth to her second child, she faced a challenge common to many mothers: choosing between her career and her family. Ashley would try to do both while serving her community at the same time. 
 
In 2010, she opened the Rawda Fusha Learning Center, a daycare where she teaches English, social studies and science, along with Arabic and Islamic studies. Ashley holds a Bachelor’s in Secondary Education and a Master’s in Early Childhood Education, a strong educational background that serves her clients well, most of whom range from 4 to 7 years old. 

“Starting the daycare allowed me to provide for my family, spend time with my children and continue with my career in teaching,” she says.

Ashley lives with her two daughters, mother and sisters. At Rawda Fusha, she employs three people part-time. At 30 years old, she has a lot of responsibility, but is excited about the future. "The greatest success so far has been creating a program that now has a waiting list of over 35 families. We have been featured in several local newspapers."

With all the well-deserved success however, has come the burden of space and equipment. “We are seeking to purchase new furniture and learning supplies for three classrooms, install a handicap accessible ramp, and create a library.” 

This loan will allow this dynamic place of learning to offer the best quality of services and equipment that the children in Ashley’s community deserve.

loans.use: to purchase, school equipment, books, and signage

loans.name: Gilberto Alcides

texts.es:
20 años son los que lleva el señor Gilberto dedicado al negocio de la porcicultura, donde engorda y vende cerdos, para carnecerías o para todo aquel que le quiera comprar uno, a sus 48 años de edad pueda tener el orgullo y la satisfacción que la decisión que tomo hace 20 años fue la correcta pues es feliz con lo que hace, lo hace bien y con eso puede mantener los gastos del hogar.

El señor Gilberto es muy consiente con lo que vende y es eso lo que lo diferencia de su competencia pues sus cerdos los alimento con cuido y vitaminas a diferencia de la “aguamasa” que comúnmente se les da, para información de los prestamistas la palabra “aguamasa” es como la recolección de todos las sobras de comida que combinadas se las dan al cerdo puesto que este come de todo.

Solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cuido y vitaminas que en el mercado son caros y los necesita urgentes pues sus provisiones se están agotando y no tiene capital para comprarlos. 

Gilberto sueña con viajar con poder generar empleos en el sector que tanto lo necesita y seguir conforme y feliz con su profesión.
texts.en:
For 20 years Gilberto has raised swine. He fattens and sells pigs to butchers and to anyone else who wishes to buy one. At 48 years old, he can be proud and satisfied that the decision he made 20 years was the correct one. He is happy with his work, he does it well, and through it he can manage the household expenses.

Gilberto is very conscious of what he sells, and this is what sets him apart from the competition. He feeds his pigs animal feed and vitamins, as opposed to the “aguamasa” pigs are commonly given. “Aguamasa” is a word for the combination of various leftover foods that is fed to pigs, given that they eat everything.

He requests a loan to purchase feed and vitamins, which are expensive at the market. He needs them urgently because his supplies are running out and he does not have the capital to buy more.

Gilberto dreams of traveling, of being able to create jobs in a field that badly needs it, and of staying satisfied and happy with his profession.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 33 años de edad, colombiana, madre de una niña de 10 años. Ella  visitaba Costa Rica gracias a una amiga que la traía en  vacaciones, aquí se casó pero a los 5 años solicito el divorcio debido a que su pareja la agredía verbalmente. Maritza me comenta que el chocolate en Colombia es muy utilizado y consumido, por ese motivo ella siempre tuvo una gran fascinación por este dulce, actualmente confecciona todo tipo de figuras en chocolate, pero en lo que desea especializarse es en la venta de Moldes que actualmente le esta funcionando ya que sus moldes son diseños exclusivos de Colombia porque me asegura que nadie cuenta con tanta variedad de diseños en los moldes como ella.

Maritza me indica que desde hace cuatro años comenzó con la venta de todo tipo de figuras en chocolate y desde hace dos está con la venta de moldes, ella considera que la venta de moldes es un mejor negocio y deja más que vender figuras de chocolate, ya que los moldes son de calidad y diseños muy originales. Este crédito le va a permitir comprar más mercadería, desde moldes, hasta cobertores de cupcakes; también la computadora que tanto necesita para continuar promocionando sus productos. 

Ella es una mujer que demuestra haber luchado por el bienestar de su hija principalmente y cumplir el sueño de ser una gran distribuidora de moldes y artículos para repostería.
texts.en:
Maritza is 33 years old and is the mother of a 10-year-old daughter. She's originally from Colombia, but she visited Costa Rica some time ago thanks to a friend who took her on vacation. She married there, but after five years, she got a divorce from her verbally abusive partner.  Maritza says that in Colombia, chocolate is widely used and eaten, and so she's always been fascinated by this sweet. She currently makes all kinds of shapes in chocolate, but she particularly wants to specialize in selling the molds. Her molds are designs exclusive to Colombia, and she assured me that nobody has the kind of variety in mold designs that she does.

Maritza began selling molded chocolate four years ago and started selling the molds themselves two years ago. She finds selling the molds to be the better business, since the molds are both high quality and unique in their design. This loan will let her purchase additional merchandise from molds to cupcake wrappers, as well as a computer, which she urgently needs to keep promoting her products.

She is a woman who has demonstrated the drive to fight for the well being of her daughter, first and foremost, and also for her dream of becoming a large distributor of molds and other dessert-making products.

loans.use: purchase and resell molds for making chocolate

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 45 years old and has three children. Eufemia is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Eufemia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Eufemia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Eufemia has been raising livestock for two years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Eufemia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products to resell.

loans.name: Avencio

texts.en:
Avencio (shown at left) is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in hand-woven tapestries. He works with his brother Juan Francisco (shown at right). Avencio would like to invest in the bulk purchase of wool and cotton yarn for his designs, and he would also like to hire additional artisans for his workshop.

Avencio has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I was born in the Peruvian state of Huancayo. My brother is ten years older, but we work together very well. I'm very proud of one of my older works, The Virgin of Guadalupe, on display in Mexico. I lingered 20 days on this work. Juan weaves charming portrayals of little children; he loves capturing their expressions. It is something magical that just cannot be described."

"I thank you beforehand for this microcredit, because it will allow me to stock up on wool and cotton. I also require the assistance of additional artisans - I am getting on in age, and it's getting difficult to work on my own, especially with the holiday season approaching quickly."

Use the link below to view Avencio's hand-woven tapestries on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/742

loans.use: to invest in the bulk purchase of wool and cotton yarn, and also to hire additional artisans for his workshop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy stock for resale.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Agronoma, vive con sus padres y trabaja en una estación de servicios como playero y a la vez estudia.
Es una persona sacrificada que quiere terminar la carrera y poder trabajar en su profesión para poder crecer como persona y tener una familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de estudios, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Hugo studies agricultural engineering.  He lives with his parents and both attends school and works as an attendant in a service station.  He's a self-sacrificing person who wants to finish his program and be able to work in his profession to grow as a person and have a family.

He's requesting this loan to be able to pay his school expenses.  That way he can continue with his studies, just as he as been doing.

loans.use: to pay his school expenses

loans.name: Diacounda Diabate's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois et il regroupe des femmes issues du même quartier unies par de bonnes relations de voisinages.
Madame Diacounda la responsable, est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus teintés et divers .Avec son nouveau crédit elle va se payer des balles de tissus qu"elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier et au marché central de la ville.
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps. Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Diacounda Diabate group was created from the first cycle of the village’s financial club. It is composed of women from the same neighborhood who are united by excellent neighborly relations.

Mrs. Diacounda, the group’s leader, is a 37-year-old married woman with three children in school. Her business is the retail of dyed fabrics and miscellaneous items. With her new loan, she will pay for bundles of fabrics that she will then retail at the local level and at the central city market. She benefits from a good experience in this business, for she has been at it for a long time. Profits from her business allow her to provide for her family’s alimentary needs.

loans.use: acheter des tissus teintés pour développer son activité de commerce

loans.name: La Princesse Group

texts.en:
Soha is the featured borrower for La Princesse Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Soha is a 21-year-old, married, woman. She started working two years ago from her house as a hairdresser. She is helping her husband in covering the expenses and needs of their family, especially given that they live with her husband’s family, which consists of seven members.

Today, Soha wants to increase her income and improve her living conditions, so she is acquiring a loan to start selling accessories and pajamas in addition to her current business.

With respect to the other group members, Narjes is a 24-year-old single lady who works in a clinic while Fadia is a 47-year-old married mother of three children and they both are acquiring the loan for necessary personal use.
Soha is the lady in the middle, Narjes is the first lady on the left, and Fadia is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to start selling accessories and pajamas in addition to her current business.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is a farmer from Lusaghbyur village in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband and their 7 and 5-year-old daughters. To be able to meet the needs of her family, Lilit, with the help of her husband, is engaged in breeding livestock - cows, sheep, pigs and hens - and in the cultivation of wheat and barley. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

Agribusiness is not the main source of income for the family, however, as Lilit's husband works at a local milk factory as a driver. As life is getting more expensive day by day, Lilit needs to expand the agribusiness to be able to effectively meet the needs of her family. 

A loan of USD 2,000 will greatly support this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to purchase seeds and also forage for feeding the livestock. Lilit and her family will be grateful to all the lenders for their good will and support in collecting the needed loan and helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and also forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Dayyani

texts.es:
Juventud, belleza y emprendimientos son tres características que tiene muy marcadas Dayyani quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía como ropa, zapatos, jeans, accesorios entre otros, con el ánimo y motivación de genera ingresos para alimentar y educar a su pequeño hijo de 5 años quien tiene como madre y padre a la joven Dayyani.

Dayyani siempre pensando en mejorar y hacer de la venta de mercancía una actividad rentable y que le permita vivir dignamente quiere solicitar un crédito para diversificar su mercancía el cual invertirá en la compra de tendidos de cama y productos de aseo que son los que están presentando mayor rotación en el mercado. 

Ayuden por favor a esta joven Cabeza de hogar que quiere salir adelante con su hijo y tener un futuro próspero, amante de los niños que estudia una técnica para poder licenciarse y cuidarlos y tener paralelamente un almacén donde vende sus productos.
texts.en:
Three words that characterize young Dayyani are youth, beauty, and drive. She's in the business of selling merchandise like clothes, shoes, jeans, accessories, and more. She has spirit and motivation to earn money so that she can feed and educate her five year old little boy, to whom she is both father and mother.

Dayyani is always thinking about how to improve her business and make it more profitable, so that she can live a dignified life. She will use this loan to diversify her merchandise, purchasing bed linens and cleaning supplies, which seem to sell faster in the market.

She loves children and is studying for a career as a licensed caregiver, while running her shop and selling her products as a parallel business. Helping this young head of household and her son get ahead means helping them secure a prosperous future.

loans.use: diversify her product line into home goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Delicious Yogini is a non-vegan cookie company that was established in 2010. Nancy grew up with a passion for her Grandma’s chocolate chip bar cookies. The cookies were quite “famous” among family and friends and were a part of every family celebration. In 2009, Nancy decided to share her grandmother's recipe by starting her own business. 
 
Delicious Yogini’s mission is to be at the forefront of ending the practice of inhumane factory farming. Nancy's company is part of the awareness that is occurring in the food industry, helping to educate others on the food industry that eating animal products does not mean that the cruelty of factory farming need exist. This is why Delicious Yogini is firm in baking with free-range butter and eggs only.

Nancy is excited that her Kiva loan of $5,000 will be help her to buy inventory and labeling for her next orders.

loans.use: to pay for Inventory and rent

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 26-year-old married man from a village near Jenin city. He is a father of one son and two daughters. Jihad works with his father on agricultural land. They plant olive trees and other seasonal crops. It is a good business and the income is high but not stable.

Jihad took a USD 500 loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to prepare the land for the new season, including fertilizing and plowing. By taking this loan, he will be able to improve the land and increase its productivity.  

He appears in the photo on the family land.

loans.use: to prepare the land for the new season, including plowing and fertilizing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a brick making machine

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 59 years old and widowed with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, biscuits, etc.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik, a teacher by profession, has been involved in agriculture for many years. She works at the local village school and lives with her husband, mother-in-law and three children. Her husband is a goldsmith. Arevik, with the help of her children, keeps livestock including cows, calves, pigs and piglets as well as cultivating wheat, barley and potatoes.

Now she needs to expand the agribusiness to be able to effectively meet the needs of her family. A loan of USD 2,000 will greatly support this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to purchase forage for the livestock, and also seeds and fuel for land cultivation. Arevik and her family will be grateful to all the lenders for their good will and support in collecting the needed loan and helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock, and also seeds and fuel for land cultivation.

loans.name: Ramon Jose

texts.es:
10 años de su vida lleva el señor Ramón dedicado a la venta de pescado, oficio que aprendió empíricamente y que surgió de la necesidad de hacer algo para mantener a sus tres hijos de 14, 11 y el menor de 6 años. 

Su profesión nació en una época donde el empleo era muy escaso y había que buscar alternativas propias para generar algún ingreso incluso solo para darle de comer a sus hijos y esposa. 

A sus 43 años de edad este es el único oficio que le queda y con él puede darle estudio y alimentación a su familia, solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de pescado pues a mayor distribución mejores ingresos y aprovechara el pensamiento de comida saludable que está adoptando la comunidad, donde las propiedades del pescado son de gran ayuda en una alimentación balanceada
texts.en:
Señor Ramón has dedicated ten years of his life to selling fish.  He learned the trade experientially out of a need to do something to support his three children, who are 14-, 11- and the youngest is 6-years old. 

Señor Ramón's profession was born at a time when employment was scarce.  He had to seek out his own alternatives to generate some income to provide  even food for his children and wife.  

At his 43 years of age, selling fish is the only trade Señor Ramón has with which he can provide schooling and food for his family.  He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fish.  With greater sales, he will have a better income.  He will also be able to take advantage of the current thinking that his community is adopting around healthy food; that the properties of fish are a great aid in a balanced diet.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell in his town and improve his income so that his children can go to school.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane and her group members extend their thanks to Kiva borrowers for their previous loan. Their loan helped them increase their productivity and incomes. 

Jane, the group chairperson, harvested 1250 kilograms of maize and 380 kilograms of beans, and her one season harvest was bigger than her harvest in the 4 previous seasons all put together. She used her income to build a small house for her children, and the rest to pay school fees. Despite the sudden death of their group member - Proscovia - first from right (now replaced by Noelina), Jane's group members are still working together and seek a new loan. 

With the new loan, they will expand their gardens, buy good quality seeds and inputs for their gardens. Jane plans to use her income from the new loan to buy a piece of land so as to establish a permanent garden.

loans.use: to buy good quality vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to expand their gardens

loans.name: Elcy Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Elcy una aguerrida mujer de una avanzada edad, humilde, escasa de recursos pero con un gran espíritu de trabajo, vio en su hogar que hacían falta recursos y de inmediato salió gasto su recursos en montar un pequeño puesto de alimentos y con una bendición decidió iniciar su negocio pidiendo prosperidad para poder alimentar los suyos. 

Es madre de 4 hijos y vende productos fritos, pasteles básicamente, solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos para elaborar sus alimentos, papa, pollo, masa, queso, etc. 

Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá fabricar más alimentos que le significaran más ingresos que en muchas ocasiones es para llevar un alimento a su hogar y no dejar que su familia pase hambre. 

Su sueño es poder un día organizar el lote donde vive y convertirlo en una vivienda digna construida con material.
texts.en:
Señora Elcy is a courageous woman of an advanced age. She is humble and has few resources, but she has a great work ethic. She saw that her household needed resources, so she immediately went out and spent what she had setting up a small food stall. With a blessing, she decided to start her own business, hoping for prosperity so that she could feed her loved ones.

She is the mother of four children, and she sells mostly fried products and cakes. She is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of supplies to prepare her foods: potatoes, chicken, dough, cheese, etc.

With the help of this loan, she will be able to make more food, which means more income. Often, this income is used for bringing food home and not letting her family go hungry. 

Her dream is to one day be able to organize the lot where she lives and turn it into a decent house made of proper materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make her fried foods, including dough, chicken, potatoes, and vegetables; her goal is to earn more income to prevent her family from going hungry.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is a 20-year-old married woman with one child. She resides in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school where she teaches life skills to students. She also volunteers in her community by assisting the elderly. 

To support herself and her family, Agness operates a poultry business from her home where she sells broiler chickens. She started the business from the small savings she collected after being trained as a Learner Guide. Originally, Agness started her business by producing a batch of 50 chickens every six weeks. However, her business has grown to producing 100 broilers every six weeks. 

If she receives a loan from Kiva, Agness is going to continue to increase the number of broiler chicks she produces and buy vaccines for her chickens. The profits will support her family and allow her to help disadvantaged children in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks, feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.en: mariée âgée de 36 ans, Adjovi  réside à  Adidogomé. Elle vend  des chaussures. Elle  s'approvisionne 2 fois  par mois au  grand marché de lomé. Elle  revend par vente ambulante. Adjovi sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her itinerant business

loans.name: Rabeha

texts.en:
Rabeha is a 45-year-old married woman from Yatta, a village near Hebron city. She is a mother of two sons and nine daughters. Her husband and sons are workers, getting a low income that is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Three years ago, Rabeha started selling clothes in a small store in the village. It is a good business and supports the family by covering part of their expenses.
 
Rabeha took a USD 1,500 loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new collection of clothes to resell. By taking this loan, Rabeha will be able to improve her business and also the family income.

Rabeha appears in the photo in her clothing store

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Her name is Glenda, age 42, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Edward, a tricycle driver, and has four children. The eldest is working and the other three are still in the Elementary level. Glenda and her husband work hard to give their children a better future.

Glenda operates a tricycle unit. Her husband drives the tricycle that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Coron, Palawan, Philippines, a tricycle is the most  common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle.  The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to go to church, city hall, market, and to other destinations within their community.  They even transport from one town to another. They earn a minimum of Php 700 a day.

Glenda is requesting a Php 11,000 loan to pay for repair, maintenance and gas for her tricycle unit.  It is important that her tricycle is always in good running condition to ensure good service and steady income. It is their source of income.

Glenda dreams of buying another tricycle unit to improve her income and send all her children to school.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for repair, maintenance and gas for her tricycle.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille(02 enfants scolarisés en charge et rendre stable son activité(vente de produits de premières nécessités(riz, huile, tomate...), Amavi fait sa quatrième demande pour atteindre ses objectifs. Elle est âgée de 41ans et s'approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé. Les 3 derniers crédits ont été payés sans souci.
texts.en:
Amavi, age 41, is seeking a 4th loan to help her achieve her goals of supporting her family, which includes two dependent children who go to school, and stabilizing her activity of selling basic staples (rice, oil, tomatoes, etc.). 

She buys her stock at the Grand market in Lomé. All three previous loans were repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy basic staple goods for resale.

loans.name: Cabelen

texts.en:
Cabelen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Cabelen requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Cabelen has been in this business for 3 years now.

Cabelen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Laurencia

texts.en:
Laurencia, 59 years old, is married and has seven children. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Laurencia has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock for her business.

Laurencia has been raising livestock for 4 years and has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business. Laurencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for her business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila, 57 years old, is widowed and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past 30 years, Leonila has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. to sell. In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 47 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Teofila works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, coffee, etc.

Teofila has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future Teofila would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, coffee, etc

loans.name: Abizerana Cb Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a group leader, aged 44. She is married with seven children aged between 19 and 1 year; five of them go to school. 

The group is called Abizerana, which means “Believe themselves” in English. 

Beatrice sells sorghum and has been selling for the past three years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used for their welfare and to reinvest in same business.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cutlery and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motor for his canoe so he can start his new occupation removing minerals from the river.

loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala lives in Azatan village in the Shirak region with her parents-in-law and two children (6 and 4 years old). Her husband is a migrant worker. Lala and her family members run a farm. To be able to take care of the family's needs, Lala is engaged in raising cows, calves and hens and cultivating wheat and potatoes. Her father-in-law takes the agricultural products to the local market. 

To be able to meet the growing needs of her family more effectively, Lala wants to enlarge her livestock holdings. A loan of 3,000 USD will assist her greatly, enabling her to purchase two cows. It will help the family sustain their business. Lala and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their help.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Djung

texts.en:
Meet Djung. Djung is single and lives with his family in North Bogor, a suburban area about a two-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. To support his family, Djung runs a small shop selling mobile phones, SIM cards, phone accessories, airtime, and household electronics. He is photographed in his store.

About a month ago, Djung was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends. He quickly became interested in joining Ruma because he wants to increase his income. Djung is excited about his new business of selling mobile phone airtime to his community. As the business operates, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community. He will be processing airtime transactions on the weekends. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Victor de 20 años de edad, es un joven que estudio hasta  bachillerato,  es soltero, vive con el papá y la mamá.

Victor trabaja como mecánico desde hace 2 años, lo aprendió  solo, ya que fue saliendo de estudiar decidió buscar trabajo y en ese taller  necesitaban un joven con ganas de trabajar y fue así que le dieron la oportunidad de trabajar ahí. Este trabajo está a una distancia  de 10minutos de la casa al municipio, viaja a pie  y el horario es de  7am  a 4pm.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar  un compresor y unas herramientas porque está por abrir su propio taller. Debido a que ha identificado que es un negocio muy rentable y que si él lo hace mejor los clientes los buscaran más. 

Los sueños de él son,  poder tener un taller muy amplio donde lo visiten muchos clientes y así darle empleo a personas que lo necesiten y quieran trabajar.
texts.en:
Victor is 20 years old. He is a young man who has studied until he earned a degree. He is single and lives with his father and mother.

Victor has worked as a mechanic for 2 years. He learned this by himself. Since he was in school, he decided to find a job, and in the workshop, they needed a young person with the desire to work. Thus, he was given the opportunity to work in the workshop. This job is 10 minutes away from his house; he travels by foot to work, and his work schedule goes from 7am to 4pm. 

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy a compressor and some tools so that he can open his own workshop. He has identified that this is a very profitable business and that if he does a good job, clients will seek his services more.

His dreams are to be able to have a very spacious workshop where many clients come and, thus, to give jobs to people who need them and want to work.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and some tools so that he can open his own workshop.

loans.name: Murdiyanto

texts.en:
Murdiyanto is single and he lives with his family in North Bogor, a suburban area that is located about two hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city. To support his family, Murdiyanto runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime for his customers.

Murdiyanto was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago because he wanted to increase his income and expand his network. He is excited about his new business, which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community. He hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Murdiyanto is in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Stevanus

texts.en:
Stevanus is single and he lives with his family in North Bogor, a suburban area located about two hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city. To support his family, Stevanus runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime for his customers. 

Stevanus was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends. He quickly became interested in joining about a month ago because he wanted to expand his network and to try to be a mobile phone airtime agent. He is excited about his new business selling mobile phone airtime to his community. Stevanus hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Stevanus is in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en: John Bosco is married and has four children, who are all in school. He deals in fish farming, where he derives most of his income to look after his family and to raise school tuition for his children. John Bosco has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy more fish to restock his pond. The breed of fish he wants to put in his pond is found in the Nakasongola district. He is confident that his yields will increase after stocking and he will have a strong market. John Bosco's dream is to dig many fish ponds and stock fish which will help him supply the neighboring towns. John Bosco hopes to build a permanent home for his family and take his children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy fish stock

loans.name: Cucu

texts.en:
Meet Cucu. Cucu lives with her husband and their only child in East Bandung, a regency area in West Java. 

Cucu runs a small stall that sells mobile phone SIM cards, phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime for her customers. Cucu was introduced to PT Rekan Usaha Mikro Anda (Ruma) by one of her friends. About a month ago, she quickly became interested in joining Ruma because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She is excited about her new business which is selling mobile phone airtime to her community. 

As the business runs, Cucu hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. 

In the photo, Cucu is in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy supplies for her coffee crop

loans.name: Moreblessing

texts.en:
Moreblessing is 20 years old and resides in Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She teaches life skills to the students at the local secondary school and in her community.  She is also a businesswoman running a grocery shop where she sells grocery items, such as soap, sugar, salt, matches, and flour.  

With the Kiva loan, she intends to purchase more merchandise for her shop in bulk to reduce transportation costs and get bulk discounts. She also wishes to use the profits to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products for her shop

loans.name: Parvin

texts.en:
Parvin is a third time borrower of the institution and is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX. She is a single mother of one child that she solely takes care of with the help of the small income that she gets from her small boutique which she operates in the outskirts of the city. Pavin is a hard working lady and this can be seen by how she has always managed to meet her installments for the previous loans on time and how she has managed to gradually expand her business despite having other financial responsibilities at her home.

Parvin treasures her boutique and her clients so much but has one major challenge; that of her clients’ demand for clothes surpassing her stock. To have this problem solved, she applied for a loan so that she can stock a variety of clothes and shoes in order to meet all her clients' demands. Given the loan, she has high hopes of seeing her business expand to a level of a very big shop that does wholesale. Besides that, her dream is to purchase a piece of land on which to construct a simple home and rentals to get adequate income to support herself and her child.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
RAQUEL, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y es estudiante de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, carrera que eligió por la cualidades que se necesitan en ésta carrera y que posee.
Raquel estará iniciando su segundo año de estudios para los cual solicita el préstamo para poder cancelar el total de las mensualidades y así poder estudiar con la tranquilidad de no tener apuros para los pagos.
Su mayor deseo es poder tener  su propia empresa aún no decide en que rubro le gustaría trabajar pero poco a poco segun avance sus estudios lo irá decidiendo.
texts.en:
Raquel is 19 years old, is single, and is a business administration student. She chose this career because of she has the qualities that are required.

Raquel will be starting her second year of school, for which she requests the loan so that she can make the monthly payments and so that she can study with the relief of not having the hardships of pending payments.

Her biggest goal is to have her own business, even though she hasn’t decided on the role she would like to do. However, little by little, as she advances in her studies, she is deciding on it.

loans.use: to invest in paying for her business administration education costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for his electrical repair workshop.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 40 years old, widowed, and blessed with three children aged 20, 17 and 11 years. She has been running a beauty shop where she sells ladies' handbags and cosmetic products. She has been in this business for the last two years and earns a monthly income of 35, 000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 	
She has applied for her second loan of 100,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya after repaying her previous loan successfully. She intends to use the loan amount to buy more stock of handbags and other beauty products. 

Loise will use the anticipated profits to pay for school and provide for the family's basic needs. 

She hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of handbags and other beauty products.

loans.name: Hamdi

texts.en:
Hamdi is an 18-year-old single man from Khan Younis. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His mother, the family's sole income provider, works as an employee in the public sector, earning a low income. Hamdi is a student at a local university specializing in Islamic Studies. He would like to complete his BA degree and find a job as a teacher in the future. 

Hamdi took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him buy a laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Hamdi will be able to read articles online and write his reports.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and married. She has three children, and one of them is in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Melde

texts.en:
Ma. Melde is 48 years old and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is married.

Ma. Melde is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Ma. Melde has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ma. Melde would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Jovilyn

texts.en:
Jovilyn is 27 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in the Philippines.  For the past three years, she has been raising chickens. 

Jovilyn is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional chickens, feed, and supplies for her business. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jovilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional chickens, feed, and supplies for her business

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Juvy has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 40 years old and married, with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

Jesusa has been in this business for five years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, an experienced farmer from the Yenoqavan village of the Tavush region, lives with her husband and two daughters. Her elder daughter works at a supermarket and the second one is school aged. Emma's husband works in the police force. 
To help her husband earn a living for the family, Emma is engaged in keeping a livestock of two cows and hens and in the cultivation of wheat, corn, plums, apples and pears. Emma's husband helps her sell the agricultural products in the local market. The family's agribusiness needs some investments to function in an efficient way. A loan of USD 1,000 will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase  two piglets and hire workers for organizing the cultivation process. 
Emma and her family will be grateful to all the lenders for their goodwill in helping them obtain the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to hire workers for organizing the cultivation process and to purchase two piglets

loans.name: Jorge Alexander

texts.es:
Jorge de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato; la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y han procreado una niña de 3 años de edad.  

Jorge es empleado en seguridad pública desde hace 6 años, él decidió este oficio solo ya que cuando salió de estudiar no encontró empleo por dos años y entonces ingreso a la academia de seguridad pública y desde entonces se dedica a esta profesión; pero también trabaja la agricultura en los días libres en un horario de las 6 am a las 11 am y viaja en la carreta a una distancia de 30 minutos. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar 5 sacos de abono para la milpa que ya que está en el punto de aplicarle el abono para que este cultivo sea muy bueno, mas que el de la temporada pasada no fue muy bueno por el fenómeno del niño. Esta inversión le ayudara mucho ya que hoy en día se ve que el invierno ha mejorado y le aplicara suficiente abono.

Los sueños de Jorge, son que Dios siempre lo cuide en su trabajo para seguir con su familia y seguir cultivando la tierra, ya que esto le ayudara mucho a la familia porque son ingresos extra que entran , debido a que dejan para el consumo y una parte a la venta.
texts.en:
Jorge, 33, has a high-school education.  His wife is a homemaker, and they have a three-year-old daughter.

Jorge has been employed in public security for six years.  He decided on this job only when he finished school and didn't find a job for two years.  Then he entered the academy of public security, and he has practiced the profession since then.

He also works in agriculture on his free days.  His schedule is 6 a.m. until 11 a.m., and he travels a distance of 30 minutes by cart.

The loan he's requesting is to buy five sacks of soil amendments for his cornfield.  The field's ready for the application so the crop will be very good--better than last season, which wasn't very good because of the phenomenon of El Niño.  This investment will help him a lot because currently the winter has improved and he'll apply sufficient soil amendments.

Jorge's dream is that God will always take care of him in his job so he can keep going with his family and keep cultivating his land.  This will help the family a lot because this income is extra.  Part of the crop is for consumption and part is to sell.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments

loans.name: Mildrey Johanna

texts.es:
Mildrey una joven de 24 años de edad muy trabajadora dedica al mundo de las confecciones un trabajo que en alguna época fue muy demandado en Colombia pero con el pasar del tiempo se quebraron las grandes empresas, una de estas empresas quebradas es donde trabajaba Mildrey como operaria y de allí recogió y adquirió toda la experiencia con la que decidió montar un local. 

Hoy en día Mildrey tiene su propio taller de confección y genera dos empleos, pero como confeccionista a terceros siempre tiene la aspiración de salir adelante. 
Buscando siempre destacarse por su calidad de confección y precios justo Mildrey solicita un crédito para poder comprar una maquina fileteadora que no solo representara un empleo más que generara sino que también le ayudara a mejorar sus tiempos de producción y calidad de confección.

Tiene una hija de 8 años de edad, su sueño es darle todo a esta hija, poder tener un local donde confeccione su propia marca de ropa y genere empleo
texts.en:
Mildrey is a very hardworking 24-year-old young woman. She earns her living in the world of sewing, a job that was once very in-demand in Colombia, but with the passage of time, the big companies went out of business. In one of these defunct companies, Mildrey used to work as an operator; there, she picked up and acquired all the experience with which she then decided to set up a shop.

Today, Mildrey has her own sewing workshop and she has generated two jobs, but as a third-party sewing contractor, she always aspires to get ahead.

Always looking to stand out for the quality of her sewing and her fair prices, Mildrey is requesting a loan to be able to buy a serger machine. This not only represents another job that will be generated, but it will also help her improve her production times and sewing quality.

Mildrey has one eight-year-old daughter. Her dream is to give her daughter everything, to be able to have a shop where she creates her own clothing line, and to generate jobs.

loans.use: to buy a serger, which will represent a job opening that she will be able to offer to the community.

loans.name: Dilcia Oneyda

texts.es: Dilcia es una joven de 23 años de edad quien se dedica al comercio la venta de productos lácteos, huevos, entre otros que son parte de la canasta básica. Ella está acompañada y aun no tiene hijos. Su grado de educación es de secundaria la cual curso de forma incompleta llegando hasta el 3 de ciclo común básico. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada como promotor de ventas siendo el, apoyo moral y económico el cual en su tiempo libre le apoya con la atención al cliente y las ventas. Su negocio está instalado en el mercado zonal siendo sus clientes los diferentes habitantes de la ciudad el cual está a una distancia de 300 metros desde su casa de habitacion trasladándose fácilmente hasta él. Las ventas en esta temporada del año son muy buenas siempre y cuando se mantenga el producto fresco y en cantidad para poder atender las diferentes necesidades de sus clientes por lo que la lleva a esta necesidad y es de querer crecer en su negocio solicitando a la COMIXMUL apoyo económico para la compra de productos que ayuden a mejorar los ingresos en su negocio esperando ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA ya que las fuentes de empleo no son suficientes. Sus metas poder ampliar su negocio y vender otros productos que aún no cubre como: papel higiénico, polipel, manteca, entre otros que ayudarían a mejorar los ingresos mensuales de su negocio y cubrir una mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Dilicia is a young woman, age 23. She sells dairy products, eggs, and other products that are part of the family food basket in her country. She lives with her partner, and she does not have children yet. She attended high school up to her third semester of general basic studies. 

Her husband works as a sales representative for a private company. He is her moral and financial support, and he also helps her with customer service and sales in his free time.

Her business is in the market zone, and her customers are various residents of the city. It is 300 meters from her house, and she travels there easily.

Sales at this time of year are always very good. In order to serve the various needs of her clients it is important that she keeps a large quantity of fresh products on hand.  She needs to do this because she wants to grow in her business, thus she is requesting a loan with COMIXMUL.  It is for the purchase of products that will help her to expand her business with items that she has not yet covered, such as toilet paper, plastic bags, butter, and similar items.  These products would help her to improve her business’s monthly income and cover a wider market.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products and other items in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Supriatna

texts.en:
Supriatna is married and lives with his wife and two children in North Bogor, a suburban area that is about a two-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. To support his family, Supriatna runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, SIM cards, and airtime. In the photo, he is in his small stall.

About a month ago, Supriatna was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends. He quickly became interested in joining Ruma because he wants to increase his income. He is excited about his new business of selling mobile phone airtime to his community. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide access to mobile services for his community. He will be processing airtime transactions on the weekends.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and high quality potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products for her store.

loans.name: Mustaruddin

texts.en:
Meet Mustaruddin. Mustaruddin is married and he lives with his family in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Mustaruddin runs a small store which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime for his customers. He also runs a small business, a photo print shop for customers.

He was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago. He is excited about his new business which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community, because he wanted to increase his income. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. 

In the photo, Mustaruddin is standing in his small store. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Meet Joy. Joy is married and he lives with his wife and their only child in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Joy runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime for his customers.

He was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago. He is excited about his new business, which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community, because he wanted to increase his income. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Joy is standing in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile phone services in his community.

loans.name: Wendy Marisela

texts.es:
Wendy es una joven con tan solo 24 años de edad, soltera vive en compañía de sus padres.
Los deseos y aspiraciones son cada vez mas grandes, al meditar y recordar que lo bueno en la vida requiere de grandes sacrificios, le agradece a sus padres por el apoyo que le han brindado hasta este día, ya que en el transcurso de su vida siempre se preocuparon por brindarle lo necesario y con mucha humildad reconoce que sus padres son personas luchadoras.
Entre sus cualidades que la hacen sentir orgullosa, reconoce ser una persona responsable dedicada al estudio y al trabajo, es solidaria y muy caritativa con las demás personas.
Su motivación inicial para seguir estudiando, es poder crecer de una manera profesional ya que la educación hoy en día requiere de mucho sacrificio.
Desea contribuir al desarrollo de su país, implementando técnicas innovadoras en procesos donde el recurso humano es sumamente importante para lograr metas y objetivos; en su familia la joven desea apoyar a sus padres brindándoles una mejor calidad de vida y compensar así todos y cada uno de los grandes esfuerzos que por ella han hecho.
La joven agradece a todas las personas que han creído en sus capacidades profesionales y que la han motivado a luchar cada vez mas por lograr sus sueños, recuerda que a inicios de su carrera universitaria, mantuvo una actitud conformista de quedarse allí donde culminaría sus estudios de universidad, pero recordó que sus padres nunca mostraron limitantes para darle una buena educación -Mis padres podían pasar necesidades, pero nunca dejaron que faltara mi educación, sin duda es el mejor regalo que me han obsequiado por ellos soy lo que soy hoy en día-. 
Sus planes  se enfocan en la buena educación y el éxito empresarial mediante sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Wendy is a young woman who's only 24 years old.  She's single and lives with her parents. 

Her desires and goals grow all the time.  When she thinks about and recognizes that all that is good in life requires great sacrifice, she's grateful to her parents for their support up to the present, because throughout her life they have been concerned with giving her what she needed.  With great humility she recognizes that her parents are persevering people.

Among Wendy's qualities that she's proud of is being known as a responsible person who's dedicated to studying and working.  She's supportive and very charitable with other people.

Her initial motivation for continuing to attend school is being able to grow professionally because education requires a lot of sacrifice these days.  She wants to contribute to the development of her country, implementing innovative techniques in processes in which human resources are extremely important to achieve goals and objectives.  In her family, she wants to help her parents, giving them a better quality of life to pay them back for all the effort they have made for her.

The young lady is grateful to everyone who has believed in her professional abilities and motivated her to strive more all the time to realize her dreams.  She remembers that at the beginning of her university program she had the idea of staying there until she finished her college education.  She remembered, however, that her parents never imposed limitations: "My parents went through needy times, but they never allowed my education to suffer.  This is undoubtedly the best gift they gave me.  I am who I am today because of them."

Her plans are focused on a good education and business success through her knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for her master's degree

loans.name: Barina Ushindi Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Immaculate. She is a member of Barina Ushindi Women Group. She is married and the mother of three children. Immaculate is thirty-four years old.
 
She earns her living by operating a kiosk selling vegetables such as onions and tomatoes. With the training she has received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa she has been able to run the business more effectively as compared to before. She is borrowing a loan to add more stock of vegetables. This will enable her to improve on her supplies so she will be able to put up with the rising number of customers. This will ensure she improves her income and be in a position to educate her children. 

Immaculate is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock consisting of onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing and a sewing machine for her tailor shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria actualmente tiene dos trabajos, gana muy poco y no le alcanza para cubrir los gastos de la carrera que sigue, ya que hoy en dia estudiar es muy caro.
Quiere culminar su carrera de contabilidad para poder trabajar bien y ayudar a su familia por medio de sus estudios, es por ello que se esta esforzando mucho.
Pide este prestamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
María currently has two jobs.  She earns very little and it's not enough to cover the expenses for her program, because it's very expensive to go to school these days.

She wants to finish her accounting program so she can work and use her education to help her family.  That's why she's making such an effort.

María's requesting this loan to invest in paying her university fees so she can keep on attending school, just as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, 33 years old, is married and has three children who are in school. Helen works very hard to provide for them. For the past 3 years, Helen has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as rice, soft drinks, sardines, etc. to sell. In the future, Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as rice, soft drinks, sardines, etc. to sell

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.  She earns more income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Arcelita successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ajan

texts.en:
Ajan, his wife, and their only child live in West Bandung, a regency area located in West Java Province. He supports his family by managing a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, daily products, and mobile phone airtime.  In the photo, he is in his small stall.

About a month ago, Ajan was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends. He quickly became interested in joining Ruma because he wants to expand his network. He is excited about his new business of selling mobile phone airtime to his community. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community. He will be processing airtime transactions on the weekends. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: set up and expand a chicken coop

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives in Goghovit village with her husband, and three children. Her elder child, Frunzik, is an army officer and her second child Nare (in the photo) is a student. Ruzanna and her husband work hard to be able to sustain their family's basic needs. 

The requested loan is very important for this family to be able to cover Nare's university costs and give her an opportunity to get a higher education. 

Ruzanna greatly relies on the goodwill of lenders and hopes for their support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for her daughter.

loans.name: Jackelin Sindy

texts.es:
JACKELIN SINDY, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y es estudiante de la carrera de Industrias Alimentarias, paralelamente a sus estudio realiza sus prácticas en una empresa en el rubro de panadería y pastelería en el área de control de calidad.
El único inconveniente que tuvo durante sus estudio es de aspecto económico ya que siempre que ya veía que se acercaba la fecha para el pago de las cuotas veía la preocupación de sus padres por cumplir con los pagos para que me puedan evaluar.
Ella está muy agradecida con los inversionistas ya que gracias a ellos ella puede ver su sueño de ser profesional casi logrado. El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago para los tramite y el curso para la obtención del título profesional en la carrera de Industrias Alimentarias.
texts.en:
Jackelin Sindy, 26 years old, is single and is a food industry student. In addition to her studies, she gains experience by working in the quality control department of a company that makes breads and cakes.

The only difficulty she has had during her time as a student is the economic aspect. Each time the deadline for the school fees approaches, her parents worry about making the payments necessary for her to take exams.

She is very grateful to lenders, because it is thanks to them that she has almost achieved her dream of being a professional. The loan will be used to pay for administrative fees and semester tuition in order to earn a professional degree in food industry.

loans.use: to pay for school fees in order to earn a professional degree

loans.name: Qusai

texts.en:
Qusai is a 20-year-old single man from Nablus. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His father, the sole provider for the family, works as a laborer, earning a low and unstable income. Qusai is a student specializing in Physical Education at a local university. He would like to complete his BA degree and find a job in the future. 

َQusai took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him buy a laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, will be able to read articles online and write his reports.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 29 years old. She is single, yet she supports seven people in her family, two of whom are her children. Caroline makes pastries, a business she has done for the past four years earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Caroline has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bales of baking flour and cooking oil to make pastries to sell.

With the anticipated profits, Caroline will be able develop herself further as a result of expanded business. She will also be able to pay school fees for her children.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying her previous loan. Caroline's hopes and dreams are to have a more stable and profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Angela works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Angela is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Angela has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marites has a native bags making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marites has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Melissa requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Melissa has been in this business for four years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Melissa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Milagrose

texts.en:
Milagrose is 39 years old, widowed, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Milagrose has run a general store in the Philippines.

She is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell including soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, and sugar. This will be Milagrose's third loan from NWTF.

Milagrose aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, including soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Al- Ikhlas. Group

texts.en:
The Al- Ikhlas goupr consists of four women from the city of Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Iman, 34 years old, is married and has four children. Iman lives with her family in their own house in a poor area of Hodeidah. She is an educated woman with a diploma certificate in computer science. She works as a teacher in a private school, earning a small salary. She decided to work as a teacher in order to help her husband cover some of the family's expenses. Iman's husband sells vegetables in the streets under the sunshine. His income is also not enough to cover all of the family's expenses. 

Iman wants to help her husband improve the family's living conditions. Hodiedah has a hot climate year round, particularly in the summer season. Unfortunately, the family's air conditioner has became very old and they need to buy a new one. Iman is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new air conditioner for the house.

Iman looks forward to taking another loan from Kiva in order to renovate the inside of her old house.

loans.use: to purchase a new air conditioner for the house.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 38 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Mirasol is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mirasol has been in pig fattening for 10 years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita is 38 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.
